jobText: TXT/50711532.txt	§Principal Medical Officer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Principal Medical Officer§§Advertiser: §Department of Health§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§9 Oct 2020§§Location§§ACT§§Salary§§$207,827 - $238,135§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Science & Technology§, §Laboratory & Technical Services§§§§§§The Medicines Regulation Division is responsible for evaluating prescription medicines and vaccines, leading to an approval or rejection decision. The Division is also responsible for monitoring the safety of medicines and vaccines approved for supply in Australia after they are on the market.§Principal Medical Officers lead Clinical Evaluation Units and are the delegated decision makers for evaluation of applications for registration of particular groups of medicines. A separate Principal Medical Officer position leads the Signal Investigation Unit which monitors, investigates and responds to new safety issues that arise with medicines and vaccines.§These are key leadership roles, leading a team of professional medical and scientific staff and working more broadly to support the Therapeutic Goods Administration  and the wider Department of Health.§Applications are sought from candidates with a degree in medicine and relevant clinical experience to fill several Principal Medical Officer roles.§The successful candidate must have demonstrated strategic leadership, team management and communication skills.§ §The key duties of the position include:§ §Principal Medical Officers lead Clinical Evaluation Units and are the delegated decision makers for evaluation of applications for registration of particular groups of medicines. A separate Principal Medical Officer position leads the Signal Investigation Unit which monitors, investigates and responds to new safety issues that arise with medicines and vaccines.§ §Eligibility§ §To be eligible for employment, applicants must be an Australian citizen or be an Australian Permanent Resident and provide evidence within a specified timeframe that they are actively seeking citizenship at the time an offer of employment is made.§​​​​​​§An applicant’s suitability for employment with Health will also be assessed through a variety of pre-employment check processes, such as:§ § §Satisfactory completion of an Australian Federal Police criminal history check§ §Completion of a medical declaration and pre-employment medical (where required).§ §Providing evidence of qualifications (where required).§ §For these roles, applicants must be able to obtain and maintain a Negative Vetting Level 1 security clearance, or hold a current security clearance of an appropriate level§ §To be eligible for these positions, applicants must hold a degree in Medicine, registration with the Medical Board of Australia or the ability to obtain this, and relevant clinical and supervision experience.§ § §§§§

jobText: TXT/50582046.txt	§Zoologist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Zoologist§§Advertiser: §Spectrum Ecology§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§17 Sept 2020§§Location§§Perth§, §CBD, Inner & Western Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Science & Technology§, §Environmental, Earth & Geosciences§§§§§§About the business and the role§ §Spectrum Ecology is a Perth-based environmental consultancy built on innovation, scientific rigour, and quality service. We offer a comprehensive suite of capabilities in the fields of ecology, botany, zoology, and GIS/remote sensing. Due to strong growth and increasing business opportunities, we are looking for experienced zoologists to join the highly talented and growing team in our Leederville office.  § §Job tasks and responsibilities§ §This role will work across a wide range of projects, safely and effectively completing both vertebrate and invertebrate zoological field trips, analysing data, and the completion of high quality, informative reports and project solutions for our clients. This role is both office and field based with the successful applicant required to complete field work in a variety of sometimes extreme environments. Successful applicants will also work with us in our aim to continuously improve the products we offer and the ways in which we conduct our business.§ §Skills and experience§ § §Bachelor level degree in zoology, environmental science, or equivalent. Post-graduate qualifications are not essential but will be viewed favourably. Extensive field experience in lieu of tertiary qualifications will also be considered.§ §2-5 years experience working as a zoologist in Western Australia, including terrestrial (vertebrate and SRE invertebrate) fauna field surveys and species identification. Keen interest in ornithology or invertebrate fauna would be viewed favourably.§ §Strong communication skills, and a demonstrated high standard of report writing abilities.§ §Strong analytical skills, including statistical analysis. High level competencies in Microsoft Excel and "R" (statistical software) highly desirable.§ §Experience with GIS and associated spatial data will be viewed favourably.§ §Current ‘manual’ driving licence.§ §What we offer§ §Spectrum Ecology offers you the opportunity to join an experienced, growing team with a positive, friendly culture in a booming industry. You will be exposed to some of the latest technologies employed in ecological surveys and monitoring, and we are always open and encouraging of new ideas that staff may have. We offer a competitive salary, commensurate with your experience and expertise.§ §How to apply§ §Please apply directly online with a Cover Letter and CV.§ §Please note:§ § §Only shortlisted applicants will be contacted.§ §Applicants must have the right to work in Australia.§ §This position is not open to Recruitment Agencies.§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§How many years' experience do you have in a consulting role?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

Due to business growth we have opportunities open for Laboratory Technicians to work in our Media Preparation Area.§ §The Media Team are key stakeholders who liaise with all departments within the business and supply media formulations for in-process and our finished product vaccines.§ §The Role§ § §Prepare large scale sterile media in a GMP vaccine production environment§ §Operate laboratory equipment including filter integrity testing machine, balances, pH meters, peristaltic pumps§ §Autoclave operation of media loads to be sterilized§ §Cleaning of media laboratories§ §Complete GMP paperwork including media production sheets§ §Follow SOP’s and complete batch documentation§ §Inventory and upkeep of chemicals§ §Skills and experience: § § §Understanding of GMP manufacturing and documentation principles, excellent attention to detail and have a very careful and considered approach to all tasks§ §Ability to work in a team§ §Adaptable to changes in the production plan and be available for overtime if required§ §Sound computer skills§ §Excellent oral and written communication skills§ §Own transport§ §Desirable attributes:§ § §Industry experience in food, cosmetic or pharmaceutical manufacturing§ §Cleanroom experience§ §Experience in aseptic laboratory techniques§ §Tertiary qualifications desirable but not necessary depending on experience§ §What’s on Offer§ § §Bioproperties is a stable privately owned Australian company which offers a flexible and friendly working environment§ §We are proud of our employees and our multiculturalism§ §Bioproperties is in a picturesque rural area with stress free driving against the traffic§ §The Company offers a Share of Success program for employees.§ §How to Apply§ §Does this sound like you? Please ‘click’ the ‘Apply’ button below or email application to:§ §Angie Parkinson§ §angie.parkinson@bioproperties.com.au§ §BIOPROPERTIES site biosecurity prevents the employment of personnel with live poultry, birds or pigs at home.§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§Do you have a current Australian driver's licence?§§§

own business sector to significantly shape the positive future of JMB§Relevant education/qualifications and/or experience:§Essential:§Experience and knowledge in the applications of Quality management or supervisory role within a laboratory environment§Proficiency in analysis for direct mould ID undertaken in accordance with ASTM methods for Spore trap cassettes§Proficiency in analysis jobText: TXT/50708733.txt	§Sample Receipt Officer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Sample Receipt Officer§§Advertiser: §Eurofins§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Newcastle, Maitland & Hunter§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Science & Technology§, §Environmental, Earth & Geosciences§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Sample Receipt Officer §      §        §Company Description§        §Eurofins Scientific§ is an international life sciences company which provides a unique range of analytical testing services to clients across multiple industries. With about 45,000 staff in more than 800 sites across 47 countries, Eurofins believes it is the world leader in food, environment and pharmaceutical products testing and in agroscience CRO services. It is also one of the global independent market leaders in certain testing and laboratory services for genomics, discovery pharmacology, forensics, advanced material sciences and for supporting clinical studies. Thanks to its decentralized structure and very strong growth, Eurofins provides unparalleled career opportunities for leaders and professionals who want to join a fast paced environment and grow their responsibilities quickly, in Australia, New Zealand or overseas.§        §Eurofins Environment Testing Australia New Zealand §is an Environmental testing network of fully accredited laboratories. With a staff of over 200 our laboratories are located in Sydney, Melbourne, Perth, Brisbane, Auckland and Christchurch, with Client Service Offices located in Adelaide, Darwin, Newcastle and Wollongong. We also operate field sampling services out of Melbourne and Sydney. We specialise in all areas of Environmental analysis, including Contaminated Soil, Sludge, Sediments, Leachate, Soil Vapour, Trade Waste Effluents, Sewage Effluents, Stack Emissions, Work Place Air, Ambient Air, Dust, Drinking Water, Surface Water run off, River & Stream Monitoring, Seawater, and Groundwater. § §        §Job Description§        §Our Service Center located in Newcastle - Sandgate is looking for a sample receipt officer to join a three-person operation. §        §Experience working in the environmental field would be preferred and remunerated accordingly - although this is not necessary, we are looking for recently qualified graduates ready to start their careers. §        §General tasks:§        §          § greeting our clients and consultants upon samples delivery;§          § samples logging into our online system for the laboratories to perform analysis on;§          § statistics update, packing of samples and items for couriers, some heavy lifting among other small jobs, general warehousing;§          §working hours will be approx. 8am-4pm / 8:30am-4:30pm.§        §        §Efficiency on Microsoft Office  is required and good customer service as well as general knowledge of environmental and chemistry. All other training will be conducted by Eurofins.§        §If you are interested in working in a field of chemistry that offers a high level of self-satisfaction and in an industry that is growing, then this is the place for you to start your career.§        §Due to the high number of applications, only the successful applicants will be contacted. If interested please submit an application for this role with a CV and Cover Letter detailing your interest in this opportunity.§        §Qualifications§        §          §Tertiary BSc qualification§          §TAFE Certificate in Laboratory Practices§        §        §Additional Information§        §All candidate CV's and cover letter's will be reviewed, however please note that we are not always able to respond to every expression of interest submitted.  §        §This opportunity is only open to candidates who are eligible to work in Australia/New Zealand, and already have work rights or an appropriate working visa.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§Company Description§ §Eurofins Scientific§ is an international life sciences company which provides a unique range of analytical testing services to clients across multiple industries. With about 45,000 staff in more than 800 sites across 47 countries, Eurofins believes it is the world leader in food, environment and pharmaceutical products testing and in agroscience CRO services. It is also one of the global independent market leaders in certain testing and laboratory services for genomics, discovery pharmacology, forensics, advanced material sciences and for supporting clinical studies. Thanks to its decentralized structure and very strong growth, Eurofins provides unparalleled career opportunities for leaders and professionals who want to join a fast paced environment and grow their responsibilities quickly, in Australia, New Zealand or overseas.§ §Eurofins Environment Testing Australia New Zealand §is an Environmental testing network of fully accredited laboratories. With a staff of over 200 our laboratories are located in Sydney, Melbourne, Perth, Brisbane, Auckland and Christchurch, with Client Service Offices located in Adelaide, Darwin, Newcastle and Wollongong. We also operate field sampling services out of Melbourne and Sydney. We specialise in all areas of Environmental analysis, including Contaminated Soil, Sludge, Sediments, Leachate, Soil Vapour, Trade Waste Effluents, Sewage Effluents, Stack Emissions, Work Place Air, Ambient Air, Dust, Drinking Water, Surface Water run off, River & Stream Monitoring, Seawater, and Groundwater. § § §Job Description§ §Our Service Center located in Newcastle - Sandgate is looking for a sample receipt officer to join a three-person operation. § §Experience working in the environmental field would be preferred and remunerated accordingly - although this is not necessary, we are looking for recently qualified graduates ready to start their careers. § §General tasks:§ § § greeting our clients and consultants upon samples delivery;§ § samples logging into our online system for the laboratories to perform analysis on;§ § statistics update, packing of samples and items for couriers, some heavy lifting among other small jobs, general warehousing;§ §working hours will be approx. 8am-4pm / 8:30am-4:30pm.§ §Efficiency on Microsoft Office  is required and good customer service as well as general knowledge of environmental and chemistry. All other training will be conducted by Eurofins.§ §If you are interested in working in a field of chemistry that offers a high level of self-satisfaction and in an industry that is growing, then this is the place for you to start your career.§ §Due to the high number of applications, only the successful applicants will be contacted. If interested please submit an application for this role with a CV and Cover Letter detailing your interest in this opportunity.§ §Qualifications§ § §Tertiary BSc qualification§ §TAFE Certificate in Laboratory Practices§ §Additional Information§ §All candidate CV's and cover letter's will be reviewed, however please note that we are not always able to respond to every expression of interest submitted.  § §This opportunity is only open to candidates who are eligible to work in Australia/New Zealand, and already have work rights or an appropriate working visa.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Do you have currently visa/Permanent Residency/Citizenship with satisfactory work rights for this position?§Do you have the formal qualification and/or experience required for this position?§What are your salary expectations?§§§

jobText: TXT/50700769.txt	§Expressions of Interest - Laboratory Positions§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Expressions of Interest - Laboratory Positions§§Advertiser: §Eurofins§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Brisbane§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Science & Technology§, §Laboratory & Technical Services§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Expressions of Interest - Laboratory Positions §      §        § §        §Company Description§        §Eurofins Scientific is an international life sciences company, providing a unique range of analytical testing services to clients across multiple industries, to make life and our environment safer, healthier and more sustainable. From the food you eat, to the water you drink, to the medicines you rely on, Eurofins works with the biggest companies in the world to ensure the products they supply are safe, their ingredients are authentic and labelling is accurate. Eurofins believes it is a global leader in food, environmental, pharmaceutical and cosmetics products testing and in agroscience CRO services. It is also one of the global independent market leaders in certain testing and laboratory services for genomics, discovery pharmacology, forensics, CDMO, advanced material sciences and in the support of clinical studies.§In over just 30 years, Eurofins has grown from one laboratory in Nantes, France to over 47,000 staff across a network of more than 900 independent companies in over 50 countries and operating more than 800 laboratories. Eurofins offers a portfolio of over 200,000 analytical methods to evaluate the safety, identity, composition, authenticity, origin, traceability and purity of biological substances and products, as well as providing innovative clinical diagnostic testing services, as one of the leading global emerging players in specialised clinical diagnostics testing.§ §In 2019, Eurofins generated total revenues of EUR € 4.56 billion, and has been among the best performing stocks in Europe over the past 20 years.§Eurofins Environment Testing Australia New Zealand §is an Environmental testing network of fully accredited laboratories. With a staff of over 200 our laboratories are located in Sydney, Melbourne, Perth, Brisbane, Auckland and Christchurch, with Client Service Offices located in Adelaide, Darwin, Newcastle and Wollongong. From the food you eat, to the water you drink, to the medicines you rely on, Eurofins works with the biggest companies in the world to ensure the products they supply are safe, their ingredients are authentic and labelling is accurate. Eurofins believes it is a global leader in food, environmental, pharmaceutical and cosmetics products testing and in agroscience CRO services. It is also one of the global independent market leaders in certain testing and laboratory services for genomics, discovery pharmacology, forensics, CDMO, advanced material sciences and in the support of clinical studies.§In over just 30 years, Eurofins has grown from one laboratory in Nantes, France to over 47,000 staff across a network of more than 900 independent companies in over 50 countries and operating more than 800 laboratories. Eurofins offers a portfolio of over 200,000 analytical methods to evaluate the safety, identity, composition, authenticity, origin, traceability and purity of biological substances and products, as well as providing innovative clinical diagnostic testing services, as one of the leading global emerging players in specialised clinical diagnostics testing.§ §In 2019, Eurofins generated total revenues of EUR € 4.56 billion, and has been among the best performing stocks in Europe over the past 20 years.§Eurofins Environment Testing Australia New Zealand §is an Environmental testing network of fully accredited laboratories. With a staff of over 200 our laboratories are located in Sydney, Melbourne, Perth, Brisbane, Auckland and Christchurch, with Client Service Offices located in Adelaide, Darwin, Newcastle and Wollongong. We also operate field sampling services out of Melbourne and Sydney. We specialise in all areas of Environmental analysis, including Contaminated Soil, Sludge, Sediments, Leachate, Soil Vapour, Trade Waste Effluents, Sewage Effluents, Stack Emissions, Work Place Air, Ambient Air, Dust, Drinking Water, Surface Water run off, River & Stream Monitoring, Seawater, and Groundwater. § § § §Job Description§ §We are currently seeking expressions of interest (EOI's) from highly motivated individuals to be placed in our talent pool to be called upon to assist with high volumes of work due to commence in the coming weeks.§ §We are seeking EOI's for a variety of roles which include:§ § §Sample Receipt Officers§ §Laboratory Technicians§ §Solid/Water Splitting Officers§ §All positions are casual assignments and will be based at our laboratory in Murarrie. § §About you:§ §To be considered, we are looking for individuals who possess the following:§ § §Genuine interest in working within a laboratory environment.§ §Drive and commitment to acquire skills and knowledge. § §Excellent time management and prioritising skills.§ §Working knowledge of MS Office suite - particularly MS Excel.§ §An understanding and appreciation for OH&S procedures.§ §A can-do attitude and no task seems too big or small.§ §Flexibility to work either day or afternoon shifts with potential weekend shifts§ § § §Qualifications§ § §Tertiary qualifications in Laboratory Techniques and/or Science would be advantageous.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Do you have currently visa/Permanent Residency/Citizenship with satisfactory work rights for this position?§§Do you have the formal qualification and/or experience required for this position?§What are your salary expectations?§§§

jobText: TXT/50694008.txt	§VINTAGE LABORATORY TECHNICIAN§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§VINTAGE LABORATORY TECHNICIAN§§Advertiser: §Treasury Wine Estates Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Yarra Valley & High Country§§Work Type§§Casual/Vacation§§Classification§§Science & Technology§, §Laboratory & Technical Services§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §VINTAGE LABORATORY TECHNICIAN §      §        §At Treasury Wine Estates (TWE) we know that it’s the thinkers, makers and doers who have the most impact as we continue to strive towards being recognised as the world’s most admired premium wine company.  We are proud of our portfolio of brands that have tremendous heritage, rich quality and a reputation for excellence across the globe.  From the iconic luxury of Penfolds, to the broad appeal of Lindeman’s and newer brands like 19 Crimes, we are committed to creating memorable wine experiences for our consumers.§        §Coldstream Hills was established by eminent wine-writer, James Halliday and his wife Suzanne in 1985 and makes some of the best Pinot Noir and Chardonnay in Australia. In addition to these renowned varieties, the winery also processes Sauvignon Blanc, Pinot Gris, Cab Sauvignon, Merlot & Shiraz. Vacancies exist in the cellar for suitable people to join the team for the 2021 vintage. These casual positions would start in late January 2021.§        §About the role.§        §Responsibility would be primarily focused in the laboratory but would include some cellar duties related to making premium cool climate red and white table wine (and some fizz base…) at a recently upgraded 1500t winery.§        §Laboratory tasks include, but are not limited to:§        §          §Determination of SO2, pH/TA, Alcohol, Density and enzymatic analysis for Malate, VA and Glucose/Fructose,§          §Maturity testing,§          §Ferment rounds,§          §Maintaining analysis records and databases,§          §Calibration of laboratory equipment as required.§        §        §About you:§        §You should have a solid knowledge of laboratory practices and procedures – ideally with previous experience in a winery setting.§        §To be successful you must be able to work as part of a team, however there is an expectation that you can work independently in many situations.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§At Treasury Wine Estates (TWE) we know that it’s the thinkers, makers and doers who have the most impact as we continue to strive towards being recognised as the world’s most admired premium wine company.  We are proud of our portfolio of brands that have tremendous heritage, rich quality and a reputation for excellence across the globe.  From the iconic luxury of Penfolds, to the broad appeal of Lindeman’s and newer brands like 19 Crimes, we are committed to creating memorable wine experiences for our consumers.§ §Coldstream Hills was established by eminent wine-writer, James Halliday and his wife Suzanne in 1985 and makes some of the best Pinot Noir and Chardonnay in Australia. In addition to these renowned varieties, the winery also processes Sauvignon Blanc, Pinot Gris, Cab Sauvignon, Merlot & Shiraz. Vacancies exist in the cellar for suitable people to join the team for the 2021 vintage. These casual positions would start in late January 2021.§ §About the role.§ §Responsibility would be primarily focused in the laboratory but would include some cellar duties related to making premium cool climate red and white table wine (and some fizz base…) at a recently upgraded 1500t winery.§ §Laboratory tasks include, but are not limited to:§ § §Determination of SO2, pH/TA, Alcohol, Density and enzymatic analysis for Malate, VA and Glucose/Fructose,§ §Maturity testing,§ §Ferment rounds,§ §Maintaining analysis records and databases,§ §Calibration of laboratory equipment as required.§ §About you:§ §You should have a solid knowledge of laboratory practices and procedures – ideally with previous experience in a winery setting.§ §To be successful you must be able to work as part of a team, however there is an expectation that you can work independently in many situations.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years' experience do you have as a laboratory technician?§§§

jobTitle: Laboratory Technician Job in Brisbane - SEEK

jobText: TXT/50706249.txt	§Laboratory Technician§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Laboratory Technician§§Advertiser: §Cement Australia Pty Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Brisbane§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Science & Technology§, §Laboratory & Technical Services§§§§§§Based in Brisbane, we are searching for a highly experienced Laboratory professional to fill our vacancy of §Laboratory Technician§ in our central laboratory in Darra.§ §About us:§ §An icon of the Australian cement industry, Cement Australia is the nation’s leading supplier of cementitious products and services.§ §Whilst cement is in the name, the business portfolio is diverse, comprising a series of heavy industrial manufacturing operations, coal and limestone mines, bulk distribution transport fleet, rail and shipping interactions and hazardous waste treatment and alternative fuel production (Geocycle).§ §As an organisation, we offer our employees work-life balance, a close-knit and collaborative team whilst providing you with the tools and opportunity to make your mark as our environmental and sustainability champion. Our vision is to create a safe, healthy, productive and sustainable business and we are looking for like-minded professionals who align with our company values and have a focus on supporting a positive safety culture.§ §About the role:§ Our laboratory performs testing for the construction industry. As a member of the team, you will rotate through different stations at various intervals to safely complete routine testing and analysis. This can include manual testing of various products as well as chemical analysis. Safety is a priority and you would be expected to not only comply but contribute to a safe work environment.§ §This is a great opportunity for someone who has a positive attitude, takes accountability for their work and likes to demonstrate initiative around quality and continuous improvement.§ §As a Laboratory Technician, you will:§ § §Comply with and participate in an environment that promotes safety§ §Carry out routine testing of cement, concrete and related products§ §Conduct non-routine testing of cement, concrete and related products§ §Calibration and maintenance of equipment§ §Housekeeping within the laboratory§ §Conduct analysis as part of investigations§ §Interpret data generated and analyse and solve technical problems in conjunction with Team Leaders§ § §About you:§ To be considered for this role, you will have a Cert IV in Laboratory Techniques or another related discipline and be able to demonstrate:§ § §Proven success in a Laboratory role within a heavy industrial, manufacturing or mining environment§ §Ability to analyse and solve technical problems and interpret data§ §Previous experience in a construction laboratory would be advantageous§ §An understanding of laboratory instrumentation will be highly regarded§ §Good level of computer literacy, i.e. Microsoft Office§ § §Why work for Cement Australia:§ § §Industry respected cement manufacturer§ §Engaged, collaborative and diverse team§ §Free onsite parking§ § §As part of the recruitment process you will be required to complete a pre-employment medical and a background check.§ §Cement Australia is an Equal Opportunity employer and open to residents of Australia with valid working rights.§ §Please apply directly as submissions from third party agencies will not be accepted at this time.§ §Build your dream career and lifestyle with Australia’s largest and most respected cement manufacturer and innovator.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50708489.txt	§Graduate Research Assistant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Graduate Research Assistant§§Advertiser: §University of Western Australia§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Perth§, §CBD, Inner & Western Suburbs§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Science & Technology§, §Laboratory & Technical Services§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Graduate Research Assistant §      §        §Faculty of Science§        §School of Human Sciences§        §          §Full time, 12 month fixed term appointment§          §Salary range: Level 5 $70,693 - $78,354 p.a. plus superannuation§        §        §The University of Western Australia (UWA) is ranked amongst the top 100 universities in the world and a member of the prestigious Australian Group of Eight research-intensive universities.  With an enviable research track record, vibrant campus and working environments, supported by the freedom to ‘innovate and inspire’ there is no better time to join Western Australia’s top University.§        §About the team§        §The School of Human Sciences was formed in 2017 as an amalgamation of the School of Anatomy, Physiology & Human Biology and the School of Sports Science, Exercise and Health. The School is one of the largest in the University and makes a significant contribution to the BSc majors in Anatomy and Human Biology, Exercise and Health, Physiology, Neuroscience, Medical Sciences, and Sports Science. The School also contributes to medical, dental and paramedical education in all tertiary institutions within Western Australia.§        §About the opportunity§        §A full time opportunity exists for a Graduate Research Assistant in the School of Human Sciences. Under limited direction, you will provide a high level of assistance to researchers and undertake experiments and research activities, including undertaking immunoblot and immunohistochemistry experiments.§        §To be considered for this role, you will demonstrate:§        §          §Relevant degree qualification in biochemistry or physiology or pharmacology or molecular science§          §Experience in biochemistry including immunoblot and/or western blot technique, fluorescent detection of cellular ions (e.g. FURA-2) or mitochondrial function (e.g. JC-1)§          §Experience in immunohistochemistry and confocal microscopy§          §Experience in animal physiology (measurement of cardiac contractile function by left ventricular catheterisation, echocardiography) is highly desirable §        §        §About you§        §As a proactive and passionate research assistant, you will have the ability to work independently, show initiative and work productively as part of a team. Prior experience in animal physiology (measurement of cardiac contractile function by left ventricular catheterisation, echocardiography) will be highly regarded.§        §Closing date: Monday, 2 November 2020§        §This position is only open to applicants with relevant rights to work in Australia.§        §Application Details: Please apply online via the Apply Now button.§        §Full details of the position’s responsibilities and the selection criteria are outlined in the position description and applicants should clearly demonstrate they meet the selection criteria. §        §Please see the position description prior to applying:   §Position Description - Graduate Research Assistant.pdf§        §Our commitment to inclusion and diversity§        §UWA is committed to a diverse workforce. We celebrate inclusion and diversity and believe gender equity is fundamental to achieving our goal of being a top 50 university by 2050.§        §          §We have child friendly areas on campus, including childcare facilities. The School is one of the largest in the University and makes a significant contribution to the BSc majors in Anatomy and Human Biology, Exercise and Health, Physiology, Neuroscience, Medical Sciences, and Sports Science. The School also contributes to medical, dental and paramedical education in all tertiary institutions within Western Australia.§About the opportunity§A full time opportunity exists for a Graduate Research Assistant in the School of Human Sciences. jobText: TXT/50700905.txt	§cGMP Technician (Upstream or Downstream) - Multiple Positions§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§cGMP Technician (Upstream or Downstream) - Multiple Positions§§Advertiser: §CSIRO§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §Bayside & South Eastern Suburbs§§Salary§§$63594 - $94679 p.a. + up to 15.4% super§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Science & Technology§, §Biological & Biomedical Sciences§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §cGMP Technician (Upstream or Downstream) - Multiple Positions §      §        §§        § §        §          §Immerse Yourself in an Inclusive Culture§          §Use your Skills and Make an Impact on CSIROs Manufacturing!§          §Join CSIRO - Australia's Premier Science and Technology Research Organisation§        §        § §        § §        §The Position§ § The cGMP Technicians will be involved with CSIRO’s new cGMP pilot scale facility in the production of biologics for clinical trials (Phase 1 and beyond). Our clients will include Australian and overseas researchers and biotech and biopharmaceutical organisations, supporting the development of new biologics and growing the biotech industry. The cGMP Technicians will work on either upstream processing (media and reagent preparations, cell culture, scaling up to stirred tank bioreactors, filtration), or downstream processing (chromatography, viral reduction, tangential flow filtration), or fill and finish.§ §        § §        §Your duties will include:§        §          §Participating in manufacturing activities to meet production schedules, which will require weekend work.§          §Performing upstream or downstream processing activities in clean room conditions.§          §Adhering to the requirements of the Quality Management System (QMS) and Pharmaceutical Quality System (PQS).§          §Accurate and timely completion of quality records.§          §Identifying and reporting quality events in a timely manner according to procedure. Participating in investigations related to quality events (OOS, deviations, non-conformance).§          §Participating in process reviews, CAPA and risk assessments.§          §Reviewing other quality and process documents under the QMS/PQS.§          §Contributing to the maintenance of the facility (cleaning and technical sanitisation, environmental monitoring, ordering).§          §Assisting in the commissioning, validation and re-validation of equipment.§          §Contributing to audits by clients or regulatory bodies.§          §Under technical direction undertaking experiments, laboratory analyses or technology development activities (some non-routine) using a range of techniques, often working on a numerous parallel and competing tasks.§        §        § §        § §        §Duties (additional for CSOF4):§§        §          §Leading investigations related to quality events (OOS, deviations, non-conformance).§          §Drafting quality and process documents under the QMS/PQS.§          §Overseeing the activities of less experienced staff and provide guidance on experimental/ technological techniques and protocols.§          §Direct experiments, laboratory analyses or technology development activities (some non-routine) using a range of techniques, often working on a number of parallel and competing tasks.§        §        § §        § §        §Location:§ Clayton, VIC§ § §NOTE: The appointees may be required to work occasionally at Parkville, or at non-CSIRO sites elsewhere in Melbourne (Parkville or Broadmeadows).§ § §Salary:§ AU$63,594 to AU$80,937 pa + up to 15.4% superannuation (CSOF3)§ § or§ § AU$83,687 to AU$94,679 pa + up to 15.4% superannuation (CSOF4)§ § §NOTE: The positions are offered across two levels, the appointment level will be determined by the qualifications, skills and relevant experience of the successful candidates.§ § §Tenure:§ Indefinite (Full-time)§ §Reference:§ 69778§ §        § §        §To be successful you will need:§        §          §Relevant bachelor’s degree or equivalent relevant work experience in Cell Biology, Biotechnology, Biochemistry, Chemical Engineering or Process Engineering.§          §Extensive experience with sterile techniques.§          §A current Australian driver’s licence.§          §Computer literacy and familiarity with MS Office applications.§          §Demonstrated track record of working collaboratively within a team to achieve results.§          §Ability to use judgement to select the best option for improving performance (better yields, higher quality, improved client satisfaction).§        §        § §        §Additional for CSOF4:§        §          §Demonstrated competence in drafting technical documents, especially those associated with QMS.§          §Evidence of experience in leading and directing projects.§ Ability to investigate underlying issues of complex problems and develop the most appropriate response by adapting, creating and testing alternative solutions.§        §        § §        §For details about who to contact and for more information please view the §Position Description§ §        § §        §CSIRO’s Commitment to Diversity§        §We’re working hard to recruit diverse people and ensure all our people feel supported to do their best work and empowered to let their ideas flourish.§ §        § §        §Flexible Working Arrangements§        §We work flexibly at CSIRO, offering a range of options for how, when and where you work. Talk to us about how this role could be flexible for you. §Balance§ § §        §About CSIRO§        §At CSIRO you can be part of helping to solve big, complex problems that make a real difference to our future. We spark off each other, learn from each other, trust each other and collaborate to achieve more than we could individually in a supportive, rewarding, inclusive and truly flexible environment.§ §        § §        §Apply Online§ § To apply online, please provide a CV and letter outlining your suitability and motivation for the role, including an address of the essential criteria outlined in the Position Description.§ §        § §        §Applications Close§        §23:59 AEDT 22nd October, 2020§ §      §    §    §    §For the selection documentation and details on how to apply, visit www.csiro.au/careers or call §1300 984 220§ §  §§§ §Immerse Yourself in an Inclusive Culture§Use your Skills and Make an Impact on CSIROs Manufacturing!§Join CSIRO - Australia's Premier Science and Technology Research Organisation§ § §The Position§ § The cGMP Technicians will be involved with CSIRO’s new cGMP pilot scale facility in the production of biologics for clinical trials (Phase 1 and beyond). The cGMP Technicians will work on either upstream processing (media and reagent preparations, cell culture, scaling up to stirred tank bioreactors, filtration), or downstream processing (chromatography, viral reduction, tangential flow filtration), or fill and finish.§ § §Your duties will include:§Participating in manufacturing activities to meet production schedules, which will require weekend work.§Performing upstream or downstream processing activities in clean room conditions.§Adhering to the requirements of the Quality Management System (QMS) and Pharmaceutical Quality System (PQS).§Accurate and timely completion of quality records.§Identifying and reporting quality events in a timely manner according to procedure. Participating in investigations related to quality events (OOS, deviations, non-conformance).§Participating in process reviews, CAPA and risk assessments.§Reviewing other quality and process documents jobText: TXT/50591762.txt	§Hydrographic Surveyor§§Private Advertiser§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Hydrographic Surveyor§§Private Advertiser§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§18 Sept 2020§§Location§§Perth§, §CBD, Inner & Western Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Science & Technology§, §Environmental, Earth & Geosciences§§§§§§As a diverse and expanding company, we have three divisions that support our business. Marine surveys are undertaken as part of our Metocean Division. We are currently entering exciting times with a project commencing in the near future and several other prospects looming in the horizon.  As a result, we are seeking an experienced Level 1 (CPHS1) Surveyor to lead these projects and grow our small surveying team. In our company you will find development opportunities, you will be valued, recognised, challenged, and rewarded.§The Marine Surveying Team provides a range of surveying services to our ports and harbour clients. This includes precise bathymetric surveys of coastal environments. In addition, as the Marine Surveying Team Lead you will provide support to subsea search and recovery operations of lost/damaged infrastructure and instrumentation, for example post cyclonic activity in the North West Shelf. You will also be encouraged to develop new business opportunities, secure future work, and develop tools and processes to service projects within the marine surveying space.§You will demonstrate experience in a similar role within Australia, strong commitment to safety, and sound commercial acumen.You will possess the skills and experience to lead all aspects of projects and assignments including client and regulator liaison, people management skills to lead office and field teams, project management (track budget and schedule), field leading capability, sound data collection, and data processing. Excellent reporting skills are essential.§The Marine Surveying Team Lead will report directly to the Company General Manager and will assist other positions as needed.§You will be responsible for:§Business development§Liaison with clients and regulators§Team management§Project management§Selecting, adopting, and maintaining data collection and data processing tools,§Work outsourced to subcontractors§Surveying deliverables§Represent Company in relevant conferences and workshops§Demonstrating HSE commitment and leadership within the Company team and subcontractors§Provide specialist guidance to Company operations§Contribute to the coaching and development of Company staff§Remain informed and promote new technology and software to improve Company operations§The successful candidate will be offered a full-time role, based in Perth WA, and will be supported with his/her career growth as the Company expands. §Our Company offers bonuses as a reward for substantial project winds and achieving agreed key performance indicators (KPI).§ §§§§

jobTitle: Post-doctoral or Research and Development Scientist  Job in Brisbane - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50711736.txt	§Post-doctoral or Research and Development Scientist §§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Post-doctoral or Research and Development Scientist §§Advertiser: §Genics§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§9 Oct 2020§§Location§§Brisbane§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Salary§§$120,000 - $135,000§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Science & Technology§, §Laboratory & Technical Services§§§§§§Join an Australian company that is a global leader§Genics has a mission -§ To create the world’s most advanced pathogen detection company delivering global food security. §Our vision is also compelling -§ To help farmers reduce risk, boost productivity and sustainability to meet increases in global food demand. Pretty exciting stuff. The sort of stuff that keeps our team very focused on delivering amazing service and state-of-the-art technology. §You can help solve a global problem§Globally shrimp farmers are negatively impacted because of difficult to detect shrimp pathogens. And with shrimp pathogens costing farmers around $6Billion in losses p.a., more needs to be done to reduce disease and support farming communities. In this role the work you do will directly help farmers. Importantly, our work does not stop with shrimp farmers as we expand our test menu into other primary industry sectors including Poultry, Pork, Salmon and Tilapia. §About the role§You will be a key player for Genics molecular test development efforts supporting and reporting to the R&D Director. Your role will focus on project-based creative conception and advancement of new pathogen detection tests on Genics platform and orthogonal molecular technologies. This provides an opportunity for you to apply your highly developed project management and molecular biology skills to culminate in successful molecular test development. Your responsibilities will cover both the in-vitro as well as in-silico aspect of test development work, extends to test performance assessment including data analysis and providing succinct summaries to the Director and the Executive team.§What we are looking for§You’re an independent natural problem solver. You thrive in a team environment and are a great collaborator happy to pitch in whenever and however necessary. You’re also a highly motivated and experienced Scientist ideally at a Post-doctoral level. You enjoy and succeed in a challenging environment and are keen to apply your skills with a determined and positive approach.§Our Values§Building §security and sustainability§ in food production now and into the future by identifying and mitigating production impacting risks.§Neutrality §in recommendations and actions.§Trusted advisor§ in providing quality diagnostic data.§Creative spirit§ in our approach to customise solutions to solve industry problems.§Excellence in data provision and delivery§ to meet our client’s needs.§Working collaboratively§ for impactful client success.§Our Culture§Our people and culture underpin our success in delivering excellent end to end solutions for our client base. We are guided by our values and seek to be global leaders in delivery of high-quality data and customised solutions that value add to our clients’ enterprises.§Our people bring a creative mix of skills, brought together for their enthusiasm and drive to deliver food security and sustainability to our world. We believe we can transform farming practices globally by better understanding and mitigating risks from pathogens in culture systems.§Tasks and Responsibilities§- Understand and Apply Good Laboratory Practices (GLP) with respect to the development of molecular diagnostic tests and deployment of testing procedures.§- Executing pathogen detection testing procedure.§- Nucleic acid extraction and preparation from biological tissues/specimens§- Management of tissue and DNA/RNA sample repository§- High competency and independence in PCR, PCR product clean up, tissue extraction, sequencing, cloning, making of standard laboratory buffers, gel electrophoresis, dilution series experiments and other standard molecular biology laboratory procedures.§- High competency in the use of sequence analysis software such as Sequencher or similar, ability to interrogate genetic databases and perform sequence alignments.§- Development and execution of PCR tests for diagnosis of existing, new and emerging pathogens compatible with Genics platform technologies§- Development and execution of molecular testing procedures for validation of diagnostic tests for concordance, specificity and sensitivity including real-time PCR§- Participation in the interpretation and analysis of data generated from test development experiments and real-world clinical samples, including preparation of summaries and reports for presentation§- Comprehensive protocol and note taking of research and development of molecular workflows executed in the laboratory§- Participation and contribution to team meetings and team culture§All listed tasks and responsibilities are deemed as essential functions to this position; however, business conditions may require reasonable accommodations for additional task and responsibilities.§Location:§ Brisbane (St Lucia), QLD, Australia (Relocation assistance is not available)§Salary: §AU §$120-135K§ plus superannuation§Tenure:§ Full-time. Unrestricted work rights in Australia will be required to apply for this opportunity.§Preferred Experience and Skills:§1. Experience working independently in a laboratory environment§2. Demonstrated knowledge and experience in PCR test design and validation§3. Experience in various PCR and downstream workflow analysis methods including gel electrophoresis and real-time PCR§4. Experience in molecular laboratory procedures including but not limited to nucleic acid extraction, reverse transcription, PCR, cloning, sequencing and relevant data analysis§5. Experience in PCR amplification and detection of SNP and/or microsatellite markers for genotyping§6. Knowledge of current molecular genetics platforms to discover novel commercially impactful pathogens§7. Experience in test validation accreditation and audits§8. Project Management Experience to drive and successfully complete scientific project based assignments§8. Demonstrated history of compliance with organisational OHS&E requirements§9. A valid driver’s licence and the ability to travel when required§Additional Experience:§1. Commercial Customer interactions such as marketing, technical support, or offering commercial solutions§2. Experience in data analysis and report writing for clients§How to apply§Please email application in §one document only§ containing:§Cover letter§Resume/CV§Response to experience criteria§Three referees§Learn more about Genics at §www.genics.com [link removed] | @GenicsGlobal §§§§

jobText: TXT/50646661.txt	§RRAP Experimental Scientist - Molecular Ecology§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§RRAP Experimental Scientist - Molecular Ecology§§Advertiser: §Australian Institute of Marine Science§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Northern QLD§§Salary§§$84,285 to $95,915 pro-rata per annum§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Science & Technology§, §Biological & Biomedical Sciences§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §        §RRAP Experimental Scientist - Molecular Ecology §        §        §        §      §    §    §      §        §About AIMS§The Australian Institute of Marine Science is Australia’s tropical marine research agency.§We are a trusted advisor, a partner and employer of choice, and we value integrity, innovation, collaboration and respect.§AIMS’ research of Australia’s tropical marine ecosystems guides their effective environmental management and contributes to our understanding of similar ecosystems around the world. Our research seeks to deliver practical benefit to all Australians and supports the sustainable use our tropical marine estate. Governments, reef managers, industry and the wider community look to our high-quality, long-term research for informed decisions about our iconic Great Barrier Reef, North-West Shelf, and Arafura and Timor Seas.§AIMS expert teams at our locations in Townsville, Darwin and Perth have access to world-class infrastructure, unique data-sets, cutting-edge laboratories and a fleet of modern research vessels.§About this Opportunity §The Reef Restoration, and Adaptation Program (RRAP) is the largest, most comprehensive program of its type in the world; a collaboration of leading experts in reef ecology, water and land management, engineering, innovation and social sciences. The program draws on the full breadth of Australian expertise and that from around the world and aims to strike a balance between minimising risk and maximising opportunity to save Reef species and values from the impacts of climate change.§After completing the world's most rigorous and comprehensive investigation into medium and large-scale reef intervention in 2019, RRAP is now is embarking on a long-term R&D program to develop, test and risk-assess novel interventions to help keep the Reef resilient and sustain critical functions and values.§An opportunity exists to join AIMS in the position of Experimental Scientist – Molecular Ecology to support genetic based work across marine environments as part of RRAP R&D. In this role you will apply your molecular ecology and genetic laboratory skills to conduct and optimise methods for nucleic acid extractions, next generation sequencing, and digital PCR on a range of marine environmental and organismal samples. You will undertake molecular data analysis, maintain databases, and contribute to the development of genetic tools for selective breeding analyses. You will also assist with experimental set-up and execution and may perform field associated duties as opportunities arise.§Apply now and join a world leading organisation with attractive working conditions. The successful candidate will be rewarded with:§        §          §AIMS AOF Level 4 Salary ($84,285 to $95,915 pro-rata per annum)§          §15.4% superannuation§          §Generous leave provisions§          §Part-time (0.4 FTE)§          §2-year opportunity§          §Located in Townsville, Queensland§        §        §About You§You will have earned your tertiary qualification in molecular ecology, or hold equivalent experience and will be able to demonstrate your:§        §          §Skills in genetic laboratory practices and techniques including standard and quantitative PCR and DNA extraction, ideally on marine samples;§          §Skills and experience in undertaking molecular data analyses/bioinformatics; and§          §Experience developing and maintaining databases for further analyses.§        §        §Next Step§Further information about this exciting and challenging opportunity is outlined in the Candidate Information Pack which is available to download from our website §www.aims.gov.au§. jobText: TXT/50674999.txt	§Animal Technician§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Animal Technician§§Advertiser: §Curtin University§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§Perth§, §Fremantle & Southern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Science & Technology§, §Biological & Biomedical Sciences§§§§§§Job Reference: 619711§  § §Research Office Curtin § § § § “Curtin aspires to be a world class university through 'the application of creative thinking and ingenuity to the solution of definable and practical problems in all fields of human endeavour'.”  In pursuit of this overall goal, we have established a strong track record of working with industry, government and community groups to understand their needs and – through innovative research and development – to provide long-term benefits.§   § Animals play an invaluable role in understanding and treating human diseases. Curtin University is committed to ensuring ethical, humane and responsible care and use of animals used for scientific purposes through compliance with the Animal Welfare Act (WA) and the Australian Code for the Care and Use of Animals for Scientific Purposes.§ An exciting opportunity exists for an experienced Animal Technician to join the animal facility team on a full time basis, and be responsible for the husbandry and welfare of the animals housed in the Life Sciences Research Facility.§ §In this role you will§ § §Carry out laboratory animal husbandry and maintain the animal wellbeing for all animals housed in the facility§ §Be responsible for maintaining the cleanliness of the facility§ §Train facility staff and research students in required techniques.§ §Maintain and improve health monitoring programs for the animals.§ §Assist with and ensure compliance with all required regulatory and university requirements.§ §Assist with the maintenance of animal usage records through the use of digital systems§ § §Why choose Curtin? § § § § §Easily accessible location with great parking, bus station and end of trip facilities.§ §A flexible benefits package with excellent superannuation provisions.§ §Wellness is part of our culture, and we encourage positive lifestyle choices through a variety of activities and initiatives.§ §A vibrant campus with gym, child care, wellness programs, medical services.§ §Curtin continues to be a leader in reconciliation in the Higher Education sector, being one of the first Universities to receive accreditation for an Elevate RAP - the highest level within Reconciliation Australia’s Workplace RAP Framework.§ §The University has recently been named as one of Australia’s Inclusive Employers for §2019-2020§ by the Diversity Council of Australia (DCA).§ § For further information on Curtin and all of our employee benefits visit https://about.curtin.edu.au/jobs/§ §We are looking for someone with§ § §Completion of a relevant qualification in the animal technology industry or other related fields, or an equivalent combination of experience and/or education/training in animal handling.§ §Knowledge of specific pathogens free (SPF) environment, The Animal Welfare Act 2002 (WA), and “The NHMRC Code of Practice for the Care and Use of Animals for Scientific Purposes”.§ §Basic knowledge and experience in the care and use of animals in the University environment.§ §Strong computer literacy especially in the use of Microsoft office software.§ §Experienced working in an OGTR certified PC2 animal facility.§ §Demonstrable experience with animal husbandry§ §Experience with laboratory animals, including IVC technology and aseptic techniques (desirable).§ §DAWR AA (or commitment to undertake) for Accreditation Training - Class 1 to 8 (desirable).§ § §Next steps § Please apply on-line with a cover letter and resume to enable us to assess your suitability for the role.§ §Contact details § §Applications close:§ 10:00 PM, Sunday 18 October 2020§ §Contact details §  § To apply complete the application form below, or for more information contact:§   § Laura Keenan – Talent Acquisition Consultant§ Phone: §+61 8 9266 4640§ Email: §laura.keenan@curtin.edu.au§   § Please apply via the attached link, we cannot accept resumes sent to the above contact.§ § § §Valuing Diversity and Inclusion§ § At Curtin, we are committed to Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander reconciliation, diversity and social justice and seek to build an inclusive environment where our staff and students are valued and inspired. This includes a supportive recruitment process should you require any access assistance. § §Disclaimer§ Curtin reserves the right at its sole discretion to withdraw from the recruitment process, not to make an appointment, or to appoint by invitation, at any time. We reserve the right to remove the advert earlier than the date on the advert.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

This role will report to the lead Dietitian. You will be responsible for sourcing and evaluating raw materials plus formulating new recipes and improving existing recipes whilst maintaining product quality, cost efficiency and nutritional specifications. You will be required to review and streamline manufacturing parameters to gain efficiencies and cost savings across all products. The ideal candidate will have 3-5 years FMCG experience in Ready made meals or a similar compound food product.§ §We are seeking someone who takes pride in their work and is willing to share their knowledge with our team plus is willing to undertake their own professional development to ensure continuous improvement for our company.§ §Role Responsibilities§ § §Product development and project lead for new product innovation.§ §Review of existing product portfolios – identifying formulation and process improvement opportunities plus exploring alternative manufacturing and supply chain opportunities.§ §Review of raw materials for compliance, QA and constant nutritional innovation to ensure a premium product for a cost effective price.§ §Strong project management skills and have ability to manage business priorities.§ §Be the R&D representative at different forums - offering key technical support to 3PLs, manufacturers/suppliers, project partners, and in-house teams including Commercial/marketing, QA and Operations.§ § Consumer research - research and develop innovative solutions to deliver customer briefs or market needs according to consumer demand. § §Technical Skills & Experience Required §:§ § §Must have 3-5 years FMCG experience in Ready made meal development (or similar compound food products), with high level of food processing, cost analysis and product sourcing/manufacturing/procurement experience.§ §Strong knowledge functional of ingredients, to maintain product quality and product specifications.§ §A passion for problem solving, with the ability to adapt, think outside the box and deliver technical and innovative solutions.§ §Enjoys working with cross-functional teams and excels at building meaningful relationships with key internal and external stakeholders. Therefore, your influencing and communication skills will be second to none!§ §In depth knowledge of FSANZ regulations and food labelling laws.§ §If you believe you are the right candidate for this position, please apply with a CV and cover letter. You r application will not be accepted without a cover letter addressing why you believe this role is for you.§ §This is a part-time role approximately 12 hours per week - with room for growth.§ § § § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§§§

jobText: TXT/50590168.txt	§Project Environmental Scientist / Senior Environmental Scientist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Project Environmental Scientist / Senior Environmental Scientist§§Advertiser: §Aurora Environmental§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§18 Sept 2020§§Location§§Perth§, §CBD, Inner & Western Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Science & Technology§, §Environmental, Earth & Geosciences§§§§§§About us§ §Aurora Environmental is a privately owned, Western Australian based specialist environmental science and occupational hygiene consultancy that provides measured, practical environmental and occupational hygiene advice to a range of State Government and private enterprise clients across the State. Aurora Environmental was established in early 2011 and comprises a partnership of six partners all who actively work in the business and who are committed to providing expert, authoritative assessments and advice in all areas of environmental management. Currently Aurora is servicing projects in the energy and resources, infrastructure and urban development sectors.§ §Aurora has a proved track record of staff retention and our approach to building the business has been based upon selecting experienced, reliable and knowledgeable staff that offers specialist skills and practical advice to clients in an effective manner. This philosophy continues to provide our clients a value for money proposition. Aurora is currently experiencing an increased demand for its services and we therefore now need to increase our professional staff.§ §The Opportunity§ §Aurora Environmental contaminated sites team comprise an experienced group of Principals with over 55 combined years’ experience supported by senior, project and junior level scientists and engineers.  This team has worked to create a strong reputation and provide technical development opportunities and a flexible working environment.§ §We are currently seeking mid-range professionals with solid demonstrable experience to join our team and assist us with the assessment and management of site contamination and acid sulphate soils. Primary responsibilities for the role will vary project to project but will generally be:§ § §Day to day design, management, client liaison and delivery for a range of projects, including staff coordination where needed;§ §Assist with the preparation of proposals and tenders as required;§ §Collection and coordination of contaminated land and acid sulphate soil assessment data;§ §To provide support to senior staff for field work, data management (including quality) and reporting as appropriate;§ §Assist Project Director/Senior Manager in achieving a successful project outcome from inception to delivery; and§ §For more senior individuals, to be active in the maintenance of client relationships, development, and implementation of business development strategies.§ §Our Needs§ §It is expected that the applicant will possess and/or be able to demonstrate the following abilities and attributes:§ § §A relevant science (e.g. soil science, geology, chemistry) or engineering degree that has a demonstrable relevance to the role and responsibilities;§ §A demonstrable 4-10 years’ experience in relation to the assessment and management of contaminated land in the Western Australian regulatory environment, specifically with reference to National Environmental Protection (Assessment of Site Contamination) Measure and DWER guideline documents (preferably in a consulting context);§ §Clear experience with the management of projects (or parts thereof) and/or team and client liaison;§ §Strong time management and report writing skills, and the ability to manage data and databases together with proficiency in using Microsoft Office.§ §A strong field-based capacity with experience relating to the collection of high quality soil and groundwater samples, procurement and management of subcontractors, data management, report writing and coordination;§ §Sound ability to interpret and apply legislative and policy requirements;§ §A team player that has a focus on developing practical outcomes and a willingness to be involved in the bigger project picture;§ §A current driver's license and a willingness to travel and undertake field work in remote areas is mandatory. Demonstrated training in the use of a 4WD in off road situations would be desirable.§ §Our offer to you§ §At Aurora Environmental we believe in providing a flexible working environment where all members are valued equally. We pride ourselves on ensuring we have a positive culture.§ §Our employment benefits include:§ § §A competitive income package consisting of base salary plus super will be negotiated with the successful candidate.§ §Flexible working hours to accommodate individual needs.§ §Potential for paid overtime.§ §Working from home arrangements.§ §Paid Parental leave.§ §High profile project exposure with a range of government and private clients across a variety of sectors with projects of varying complexity.§ §Ongoing access to senior staff, mentoring and professional development.§ §External training opportunities. §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years' experience do you have in a consulting role?§Do you have a current Australian driver's licence?§Are you available to travel for this role when required?§§§

Nutrien Ag Solutions is one of the largest agribusinesses operating in Australia with a national network of more than 700 locations.§        §Employing the best and brightest minds, our business is supported by an extensive network of corporate branches, franchises, members and agents. Our team are experts in a range of different farming areas, including precision farming services, marketing livestock and wool, agricultural services, water solutions, finance, insurance, merchandise and real estate.§        §We are offering a great career progression opportunity for a Research Manager (Chemistry) to join our business and lead the research and development of the Priostar dendrimer technology from concept, design and synthesis, through to scale-up and manufacture.§        § §        §About the opportunity:§        § §        §Reporting to the Business Development Manager – you will support Nutrien Ag Solutions to work with local and international research capabilities to develop and evaluate dendrimers and products. and§ §Perform routine laboratory duties, such as ordering supplies and housekeeping.§ §This position assists in improving the technical capability by taking corrective action of a routine nature as required by equipment procedures or test methods, while actively thinking about and implementing improvements to own work practices.§ §This position is for a 24-month Fixed Term contract.§ §Who are we looking for?§ §You will possess the following attributes:§ § §A high level of GC/GCMS experience working in a laboratory environment; § §A demonstrated proficiency in the use of data reviewing software/equipment;§ §Are results driven with excellent communication and organisational skills;§ §Experience with Laboratory Information Management Systems;§ §Experience in a NATA accredited laboratory;§ §Experience in reviewing and releasing results to clients;§ §Good problem-solving skills;§ §A high level of attention to detail; and§ §A team player;§ §You will possess qualifications in Chemistry. § §What are the benefits?§ §You will join a well-established, professional team, working day shift Monday to Friday and when required to work on weekends.  We offer a competitive salary package with attractive benefits and career development.§ § § §Additional Information§ §We're proud to have been named an Inclusive Employer for 2019–2020 by the Diversity Council of Australia. We believe that our people are our strength. Having a diverse and inclusive workplace enables us to improve our capability and ensure continued, sustainable success.§ §We know that workplace flexibility can mean something different to everyone. Under our B-Flex initiative all of our roles have some degree of flexibility.  We encourage you to discuss your needs with us.§ §Applications close Monday, 19 October 2020.§§§§

Nyrstar has mining, smelting and other operations located in Europe, the Americas and Australia and employs over 4,000 people. The company’s global operations are located close to key customers and major transport hubs to facilitate delivery of raw materials and distribution of finished products. In August 2019, Nyrstar’s operating business became majority owned by Trafigura, a market leader in the global commodities industry, providing a stable long term platform for its marketing leading operations worldwide. Visit www.nyrstar.com§ §Nyrstar Hobart is a large scale zinc smelter located on Hobart's River Derwent, only a few kilometres from the Tasmanian capital's charming and cosmopolitan city centre. § §With its breathtaking natural beauty, Tasmania is famous for bush walks, stunning beaches, a thriving arts scene, and world class fresh and gourmet produce. The lifestyle is a hard one to beat.§ §This is a rare opportunity to work on site in the resources industry, in a capital city location.§ § § §Overview of the role§ §Nyrstar are employing Graduates to invest in the future skills and capabilities of the site to ensure we have the right skills at the right time, to deliver to the business strategy. We are seeking Graduates that align to the Nyrstar values, who have achieved excellent results through their specific field and who are willing to work hard and challenge the status quo.§ §As a graduate at Nyrstar Hobart, you will develop your competencies in a complex processing environment while furthering your business and leadership skills.§ § § §What does the Graduate program involve?§ §Graduates will participate in a structured, two-year program that focuses on developing both technical and leadership skills.  The program involves challenging on-the-job assignments as well as formal professional development.  There will be opportunities to work on a range of exciting and technically challenging problems, with potential exposure to other Nyrstar sites.§ §Your professional growth will be fostered with formal mentoring and support from experienced professionals, and a competitive remuneration package is provided.§ §Working as part of the Safety, Health Environment and Quality Department (SHEQ), you will become an integral part of the small specialist environment team. The role encompasses a broad range of activities including; environmental monitoring, data collation and interpretation, report writing, risk identification, as well as opportunities to work on a range of exciting and technically challenging business problems.  § §f you want to work in a role that will facilitate continual improvement in environmental performance and reduction in the risk profile at Nyrstar Hobart apply now.§ § § §Applications§ §You must have the Right to Work in Australia to apply for these positions.§ §We believe our people are our greatest asset and that our success as a business is a reflection of the quality and capability of our people.   Nyrstar Hobart is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a culturally diverse and gender equal workplace, where everyone is included, treated fairly and with respect.§ §Applications (to include cover letter and resume) are to be submitted via the Seek Apply button.  Any enquiries should be directed to Nyrstar HR on §03 6278 4708§ or §Hobart.Careers@nyrstar.com§ §Applications close 23 October 2020§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§Do you have a current Australian driver's licence?§§§
