Ideally, you have experience in wet and oil chemistry, familiarity with QAQC standards and general lab operations and use of GC, FTIR, ICP and other analytical instruments.§Position yourself in a successful and growing Australian company for future career growth while enjoying the benefits of a regional lifestyle.§For more information, please call Garry King on §+61 2 8912 9810§ or apply quoting Ref. No. 23924.§Click here to apply online§§§§

jobTitle: Hazmat/Environmental Consultant Job in Melbourne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50704274.txt	§Hazmat/Environmental Consultant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Hazmat/Environmental Consultant§§Advertiser: §Agon Environmental§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Science & Technology§, §Environmental, Earth & Geosciences§§§§§§Agon Environmental § §Agon Environmental is an established company focusing on asbestos and hazardous materials management, environmental and site contamination assessment and management. The Agon Team are energetic, pragmatic experienced consultants who enjoy our work, and work to make a positive difference for our clients. Agon has grown from 3 to 35 staff in just five years, with two NATA Accredited laboratories to service our national clients. Agon have completed several landmark projects in our Adelaide, Darwin, Melbourne and Canberra offices. We have more exciting projects in the pipeline and are looking to expand our team to help us deliver them.§ §The Role§ §Based in our Melbourne office, you will work across Victoria and interstate conducting asbestos and hazardous building material surveys, supervising and co-ordinating asbestos removal and remediation projects.§ §The full-time role will involve using your technical skills and knowledge on a wide variety of projects for both government and private industry clients. Tasks include:§ § §Conducting Asbestos / Hazmat audits in varied locations including commercial and industrial premises, government buildings and development projects.§ §Undertaking air monitoring, visual inspections and fibre counting associated with asbestos and hazardous building materials removal and remediation projects.§ §Assisting with the preparation of work scopes and field surveying programs in both the Hazmat and Environmental fields (asbestos contaminated land projects).§ §Organising and conducting field work and preparing and delivering technical reports for clients.§ §Who you are:§ § §2+ years of industry related experience in the field of asbestos and hazardous material surveys, including experience in site inspections, asbestos removal supervision and asbestos in soil.§ §Asbestos fibre counting experience (NATA Accredited laboratory).§ §Possess a sound knowledge of the OH&S Regulations and the supporting guidelines / practice notes.§ §A passion for field-based project work including oversight of excavation projects, contractor supervision and safety management.§ §Effective written and spoken communication skills, the ability to organise yourself and contractors.§ §Attention to detail, a commitment to working safely and the ability and willingness to travel throughout Victoria and interstate.§ §If you have a degree or certificate on Occupational Hygiene, we have work in these areas in all of our offices.§ §Knowledge of drawing programs and ESDAT is beneficial.§ §A great work ethic with lots of enthusiasm. The ability to build and maintain relationships, together with your motivation to grow will be the key for your success and professional development. The role offers a great opportunity to join a strong team of industry experts in a supportive, positive collaborative environment with a competitive salary package in accordance with your experience and capabilities. Agon Environmental is an equal opportunities employer.§ §Applicants must hold a current driver's licence and be an Australian resident. If you have Railway industry workers card (RIWC) and other accreditations, this will also be considered favourably.§ §If you are interested in this position, please attention your application to Stuart Hayes and email your CV to §stuart.hayes@agonenviro.com.au§.§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§Are you available to travel for this role when required?§Do you have a current Australian driver's licence?§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50701250.txt	§Strategic Environmental Projects Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Strategic Environmental Projects Coordinator§§Advertiser: §Port Macquarie-Hastings Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Port Macquarie & Mid North Coast§§Salary§§$89,742 - $95,207 per annum + Super + Vehicle§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Science & Technology§, §Environmental, Earth & Geosciences§§§§§§§§§.job-template__wrapper [border="0"] { border-width: 0px; border-style: solid; }§§  §    § §    §      §        §Strategic Environmental Projects Coordinator§      §      §        §Applications Close Sunday 25 October 2020 11:30pm§        § §        §About the Opportunity§        §At PMHC every employee plays a part in ensuring we work together to achieve positive outcomes for our Community. This person is a team player, a strong communicator and a strategic thinker. A vehicle option is available to the successful candidate.§        § §        §About Councils Natural Resources Team§        §The Natural Resources Team provides technical services to the community in regards to management of the natural environment extending from hinterland to the coastline in the Port Macquarie Hastings Local Government Area. jobText: TXT/50695668.txt	§Post Doctoral Fellow - Environment§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Post Doctoral Fellow - Environment§§Advertiser: §Australian Nuclear Science and Technology Organisation§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §Southern Suburbs & Sutherland Shire§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Science & Technology§, §Laboratory & Technical Services§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Post Doctoral Fellow - Environment §    §    §      §        §Fixed Term 2 Years w | Full Time | $89k +15.4% super §        §Sutherland Shire | Work-life balance | Health & Wellbeing Programs §        §Successful candidate will be awarded an ANSTO Industry Foundations Scholarship §      §      §        §§About ANSTO§ §ANSTO leverages great science to deliver big outcomes.  We partner with scientists and engineers and apply new technologies to provide real-world benefits.  Our work improves human health, saves lives, builds our industries and protects the environment.  ANSTO is the home of Australia’s most significant landmark and national infrastructure for research.  Thousands of scientists from industry and academia benefit from gaining access to state-of-the-art instruments every year.§Nuclear Science & Technology and Landmark Infrastructure (NSTLI) incorporate ANSTO’s research, innovation, landmark research infrastructure and associated platforms and capabilities. NSTLI conducts research and development in relation to nuclear science and technology and connects people, transfers knowledge and provides nuclear-based products and services for the benefit of Australia.§NSTLI’s Research Portfolio undertakes world class applied and translational research utilising nuclear techniques to foster innovation in research and development programs to enhance ANSTO’s contribution to supporting a sustainable and healthier future for our planet and people everywhere.  The Research Portfolio consists of research themes that define the broad subject areas of research with underlying research programs that are focussed activity groupings that contribute to the overall objectives of the research theme and also conducting research sub-programs within platforms.  The Research Themes are Environment, Human Health and Nuclear Fuel Cycle.§The Environment research theme includes three programs: (i) Water Resources Sustainability; (ii) Contaminant Impacts; (iii) Environmental Change. The programs inform, complement and reinforce each other and draw from ANSTO a broad range of capabilities and intrinsic strengths§About the position§The ANSTO Environment Research Theme is seeking a Post Doctoral Fellow with a marine/aquatic ecotoxicology background to understand the biological fate of mercury originating from offshore oil and gas infrastructure to aid in decommissioning planning.  The project is supported by industry partners in the oil and gas sector.   The position is expected to commence Jan/Feb 2021.§The project will comprise two major aims through the application of ecotoxicological principles and organism-contaminant exposure modelling to:§Determine primary exposure pathways and organ distribution parameters of infrastructure-associated contaminants (predominantly mercury) in the form of scale to marine organisms and,§Assess the potential individual and population-level effects of infrastructure-associated contaminants (predominantly mercury) in the form of scale to marine organisms.§ §Note, this position will require working in radiation-classified areas with radioactive materials and hazardous chemicals under tightly regulated safety conditions.  All safety training and regular personal radiation monitoring will be provided by ANSTO.§Duties and responsibilities§        §          §Conduct laboratory bioaccumulation studies using mercury (organic and inorganic) radioisotope tracers to better define exposure pathways and fate of internalised mercury in marine biota.§          §Conduct laboratory studies to better understand the biological effect of exposure to mercury-containing scale on marine biota.§          §Contribute to the development of a marine biota risk assessment framework for offshore petroleum infrastructure associated contaminants.  This includes collaborating with researchers from other institutions both nationally and internationally.§          §Produce reports to industry partner and prepare scientific publications.  Deliver findings of research at domestic and international scientific conferences.§        §        § §Skills and Experience§        §          §PhD in environmental toxicology (aquatic) or equivalent (Essential).§          §Demonstrated capacity to carry out experimental work, including laboratory ecotoxicology tests with aquatic organisms (Essential).§          §Experience with the development of environmental risk frameworks (Desirable).§          §Experience working with ‘omic’ tools in an ecotoxicology context to understand organism responses to contaminants (Desirable).§          §Demonstrated ability to work independently and effectively, and contribute and share knowledge within a research project team environment (Essential).§          §Demonstrated personal qualities that will add value to the research project team (Desirable).§          §Ability to effectively manage relationships and work collaboratively with key stakeholders (Essential).§          §Ability to allocate resources effectively and identify and manage risks (Desirable).   §          §Skills required to undertake the role: good verbal and written science communication; good interpersonal communication (Essential).§        §        § §        §“We are looking for an enthusiastic aquatic ecotoxicologist, who has a great attention to detail and who relishes a challenge.  The project is heavily industry-focussed and will deliver tangible outcomes for improved decommissioning strategies of offshore infrastructure” §- Tom Cresswell, Senior Research Scientist§        § §Why join ANSTO?§ANSTO employees are passionate about what they do. We enjoy being part of an organisation making a difference in the lives of Australians. §We support and reward our employees through eligibility for:§        §          §Training, development and mentoring opportunities§          §Performance based salary increases§          §Work-life balance with generous leave entitlements and flexible conditions§        §        §Located in the Sutherland Shire, we have free onsite parking, a swimming pool, health and wellbeing programs and an onsite café. §If you want to join a world class organisation that’s making a difference in the lives of Australians, apply now!§TO APPLY and view the Position Information Package please visit www.ansto.gov.au and follow the links to the Current Vacancies page.§For further technical information relating to this position please refer to the Position Information Package or contact Tom Cresswell on §(02) 9717 9412§. contaminants (predominantly mercury) in the form of scale to marine organisms and,§Assess the potential individual and population-level effects of infrastructure-associated contaminants (predominantly mercury) in the form of scale to marine organisms.§ §Note, this position will require working in radiation-classified areas with radioactive materials and hazardous chemicals under tightly regulated safety conditions.  All safety training and regular personal radiation monitoring will be provided by ANSTO.§Duties and responsibilities§§Conduct laboratory bioaccumulation studies using mercury of exposure to mercury-containing scale on marine biota.§Contribute to the development of a marine biota risk assessment framework for offshore petroleum infrastructure associated contaminants.  This includes collaborating with researchers from other institutions both nationally and internationally.§Produce reports to industry partner and prepare scientific publications.  Deliver findings of research at domestic and international scientific conferences.§§ §Skills and Experience§§PhD in environmental toxicology (aquatic) or equivalent (Essential).§Demonstrated capacity to carry out experimental work, including laboratory ecotoxicology tests with aquatic organisms (Essential).§Experience with the development of environmental risk frameworks (Desirable).§Experience working with ‘omic’ tools in an ecotoxicology context to understand organism responses to contaminants (Desirable).§Demonstrated ability to work independently and effectively, and contribute and share knowledge As a hands-on R&D Professional, you will take part in leading the development of the world’s first zero cement, geopolymer concrete product that is proven at scale. We have branded it Earth Friendly Concrete (EFC).§ §Duties will include:§ § §Develop and deploy secondary R&D initiatives that support the commercialisation of EFC across target applications§ §Support primary R&D workflow, led by the R&D Program Manager§ §Early research and investigation into feasibility of new ideas§ §Prepare and maintain appropriate laboratory processes, record keeping, and reporting§ §Assist with other technical support matters as required§ §Support the production of EFC activator systems§ §Skills and Experience:§ § §A strong commitment to safety§ §Bachelor’s degree in Chemical or Process Engineering, or similar§ §Proven experience in product R&D§ §Construction materials experience highly regarded§ §Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite§ §Ability to work independently with a high degree of attention to detail and initiative.§ §Willingness to contribute as a team member§ §Strong desire to learn our business and develop a long-term career§ §Good skills in problem-solving, formulating and applying solutions§ §Culture§ §We pride ourselves on our healthy culture of diversity, inclusiveness, community support and strong family values. Our employee health and wellbeing program includes fun sporting events, health information days as well as our Employee Assistance Program (EAP) outsourced externally which provides round the clock confidential phone counselling and support services for our employee’s wellbeing.§ §Benefits§ § §Regular employee functions§ §Career development opportunities§ §Strong safety culture§ §Discounts for corporate health insurance and accommodation§ §About Us§ §Wagner’s is an award-winning and diversified Australian Construction materials and services provider and innovator of New Generation Building Materials.  A highly renowned brand and producer of cement, concrete, aggregates and composite products, Wagner’s are considered a solid contender in concrete, heavy haulage transport services, precast concrete, and reinforcing steel.  With our head office based in Toowoomba, Wagner’s also operates in key locations throughout South East Qld.§ §How to Apply§ §Suitable applicants will be subject to the Wagners Recruitment Process, which includes recent employment references and full medical including instant drug and alcohol screen, and the provision of a National Police Check. jobText: TXT/50618629.txt	§Data Scientist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Data Scientist§§Advertiser: §Saluda Medical§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §North Shore & Northern Beaches§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Science & Technology§, §Mathematics, Statistics & Information Sciences§§§§§§We are looking for a Data Scientist to lead analysis projects to answer research or clinical questions based on patient and device-collected data. We need someone who can build up our data storage and processing infrastructure and uplift the information available across our business.§ §About you § §You are someone with exceptional research and statistical skills. You are passionate about finding gems in mountains of neural responses and patient data. You know how to drive pragmatic therapy and product innovations that improve patient outcomes in a commercial environment. You enjoy the prospect of working for a company experiencing rapid growth, and you are comfortable with working in a dynamic changing environement.§ §About Saluda Medical§ §We are a medical device company developing advanced neuromodulation systems for the next generation of implantable stimulation devices. We are a cutting edge, progressive Australian based company with offices and employees based in Europe and the USA. We are at the forefront of spinal cord stimulation technologies for the management of chronic pain.§ §Our team is made up of world-class engineers, clinicians and seasoned professionals with experience in bringing medical technologies to life.§ §About the role§ § §Liaise with Analytics, Engineering and Clinical teams to propose, plan, execute and communicate hypothesis-driven analytics projects leveraging Saluda’s massive amount of raw data.§ §Provide analytics insights and requirements towards potential therapeutic improvements, or product and service innovation.§ §Develop, deploy and maintain software code and pipelines for data mining and analysis.§ §Contribute to design, implementation and use of database / cloud storage platforms and visualisation tools for patient data, statistics and other information for reporting, trending and troubleshooting.§ §Supporting business needs for analysis and data visualisation as required.§ §Preparation of technical and research reports as required.§ §Performs duties in compliance with Saluda Medical’s Management System comprising the company policies regarding health, safety and environmental compliance.§ §Essential Requirements § § §At minimum, a technical bachelor’s degree in Biomedical Engineering/Biological Sciences/Software/Electrical/Mathematics or related discipline. Master’s degree or PhD highly regarded.§ §3+ years of commercial analytics or research experience.§ §A strong background in statistical and data mining methods, and a demonstrated ability to use them to answer research questions and drive outcomes. Strong proficiency in Python and SQL preferred.§ §Experience developing, and ideally deploying, analytics pipelines and/or software.§ §Good knowledge of data visualisation and dashboarding tools.§ §Experience working on a cloud-based data platform such as AWS, Google Cloud, or Microsoft Azure.§ §Some background in a relevant biological field such as biological signals / neuroscience / neurophysiology / clinical science.§ §Attention to detail balanced with pragmatism and project management skills to find practical and innovative solutions to complex and ambiguous problems.§ §Ability to produce top quality work in a team or with minimum supervision.§ §Demonstrated ability to communicate technical concepts to technical, business and lay audiences.§ §Insatiably curious and eager to continually develop new skills.§ §Desirable Requirements § § §Experience designing,managing and using databases and big data platforms and tools. Data engineering skills highly regarded.§ §Commercial experience using machine learning / predictive modelling techniques.§ §Experience in software architecture development and software design.§ §Experience with, and commitment to, systems development in a quality controlled environment.§ §Experience in medical device design, development and regulatory requirements.§ §You must have the legal right to work unrestricted in Australia, no visa or sponsorship support is available for this role.§ §Candidates may respond to this posting; we respectfully ask for no agency approaches. § § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years' experience do you have as a data scientist?§Which of the following data analytics tools are you experienced with?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

jobText: TXT/50618894.txt	§Robson Environmental Pty Ltd - Science Graduate Program§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Robson Environmental Pty Ltd - Science Graduate Program§§Advertiser: §Robson Environmental Pty Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Sept 2020§§Location§§ACT§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Science & Technology§, §Other§§§§§§Robson Environmental 2021 Graduate Program§ §Robson Environmental, established in 1990, is Canberra's leading environmental consultancy within multi-disciplinary teams covering asbestos and hazardous materials, environmental assessment & remediation, and occupational hygiene and workplace safety. We combine the benefits of a small company with the opportunities to have a big impact that comes from many years of diverse experience.§ §The Role§ §We are looking for science graduates, to participate in a one-year graduate program, with a guaranteed ongoing job at the conclusion of the program. This program will suit people who love science and who enjoy highly varied work in a fast-paced, well-supported environment. Robson Environmental is a workplace which values quality, and we pride ourselves on providing solution-oriented assessments and advice to our clients.§ §Robson Environmental offers dedicated career pathways in a range of disciplines including occupational hygiene, hazardous materials, asbestos assessment, environmental science, contaminated land and groundwater management and work health and safety.§ §As part of the Graduate Program, you will use your degree and discover its real-world applications while rotating through each of our sections. Over the course of the program you will spend time in each of our three sections, learning what they do and gaining on the job training and experience. Your successful completion of the program will give you with a broad understanding of Robson’s capabilities and an ongoing job with opportunities to work in a range of roles.§ §Hazardous Materials and Laboratory Services:§ §In the Hazardous Materials Section you will be involved in surveying, sampling, analysis and reporting on a wide range of hazardous materials in the built environment, including asbestos, lead, polychlorinated biphenyls and ozone-depleting substances, and will gain the skills and experience to qualify as a Licenced Asbestos Assessor.§ §You will also become a trained and approved Fibre Count analyst and a trained and approved asbestos Fibre Identification analyst under Robson’s National Association of Testing Authorities (NATA) accreditation.§ §Occupational Hygiene and Work Health and Safety: § §In your time in our OH and WHS Section you will be involved in research, sampling, analysis, reporting and project management, working in a wide range of areas including mould and bacteria assessments, indoor air quality assessments, noise surveys and exposure assessments, and particulate and gas sampling for hazardous dusts and gases.§ §Environmental Assessment and Remediation:§ §The Environmental Assessment and Remediation section works with a wide range of well-known clients on small and large contaminated land and waste management projects throughout Canberra and surrounding regions. Work undertaken in the EAR section includes NSW & ACT waste classification assessments, preliminary and detailed site investigations, tank excavation assessments and groundwater monitoring.§ §The Program§ §Our structured training and development program includes opportunities to gain nationally recognised qualifications such as a Certificate IV in WHS, Construction Induction Training (white card), Asbestos Awareness Training, the BOHS W504 Asbestos and other fibres Certificate, as well as participate in regular in-house training run by our qualified consultants with many years of experience across a wide range of industries. Across all sections you will also learn accountability, organisation, time management and responsibility as well as technical skills, and you will gain experience using a wide range of instruments and equipment.§ §As a graduate you will be expected to work collaboratively and learn from other members of the teams in which you are working as well as maintaining Robson's high level of performance, quality, and safety. You will also be expected to be flexible to adapt to changing tasks during the working day due to the highly reactive nature of the industry. Overtime/time in lieu is paid at penalty rates.§ §Essential Criteria§ § §Tertiary qualifications in Science or other suitable disciplines§ §Full unrestricted driver’s license§ §Ability to work under pressure and meet targets and deadlines§ §The ability to travel interstate and work flexible hours including overtime when required§ §Able to obtain security clearances, and a satisfactory health check§ §Australian citizen or permanent resident§ §Desirable Criteria§ § §Experience working in a laboratory§ §Experience working in the field§ §Benefits§ §Robson Environmental is a boutique consultancy, with a focus on specialised services. Our people, and their diverse range of experiences and skills, are our greatest asset. We invest to train new starters to the highest level, providing mentoring and support to ensure they achieve personal and company goals.§ §Our working environment is friendly, positive and cooperative, designed to achieve the best possible results for our clients, staff and the company. Robson Environmental is a workplace which values quality, and we pride ourselves on providing solution-oriented assessments and advice to our clients. We strive to create an inclusive workplace that reflect the communities we serve and where everyone feels empowered to bring their authentic best selves to work.§ §Canberra offers a great lifestyle – fantastic dining, cafes and arts scene, with a wide variety of outdoor activities on our doorstep. We are less than two hours from the coast with good surfing, fishing, bushwalking and camping, and just two hours from some of the best snowboarding and skiing in the country. Housing is high quality, plentiful and reasonably priced and we have virtually no traffic jams on average commutes to work of 10 – 20 minutes. Government and Private schools are amongst the best in the country and our four universities are world class. The Robson Environmental office is centrally located with easy access and free parking.§ §The Application Process§ §Prior to submitting an application, you must request a copy of the Graduate Handbook from Larissa Webb - via email - §larissa@robsonenviro.com.au§, to find out if this position is right for you.§ §After obtaining the Graduate Handbook, addressing the criteria above, forward your CV and cover letter outlining your qualifications, experience and outline why you would like to participate in this Graduate Program, commencing in February 2021, to Larissa Webb, Business Manager via email - §larissa@robsonenviro.com.au§ §Timeline§ § §Applications close: Friday 23rd October, 2020§ §Review of applications: 24th – 30th October, 2020§ §Phone interviews: 2nd - 13th November, 2020§ §Second round interviews: 16th – 25th November, 2020§ §Offers: 30th November – 4th December, 2020§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§Do you have a current Australian driver's licence?§Are you available to travel for this role when required?§Have you completed a qualification in science?§§§

jobTitle: Environmental Works Team Leader Job in Melbourne - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50679388.txt	§Environmental Works Team Leader§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Environmental Works Team Leader§§Advertiser: §Platypus Environmental Services§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§4 Oct 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Science & Technology§, §Environmental, Earth & Geosciences§§§§§§ §Environmental Works Team Leader §Work Type:§ Permanent Full Time §Location:§ Various client sites and field locations throughout Victoria, Greater Melbourne and surrounds (West Regions) §Categories:§ Environment, Natural Resource Management, Horticulture, Conservation and Land Management§Closing Date§: 19/10/2020§Our Team and What We Do§The team at Platypus Environmental Services (Platypus) are passionate and committed to §enhancing the natural environment through the delivery of innovative and sustainable services.§ §Platypus provide services across the full life cycle of natural resource and river restoration programs.  Combining our people capability and operational resources we specialise in delivering a diverse range of high-quality environmental services, including Consulting [link removed] Services, Restoration Programs and Activities, Civil Construction Services and Maintenance Services.  The team at Platypus undertake these range of services in environmentally sensitive locations – be that aquatic, ephemeral, riparian, terrestrial or bushland.§Our Values and People§Through a shared passion for the environment, the Platypus team is made up of inspired people who all contribute to a strong and positive team culture.§We value quality, integrity, care and respect.  §We have proven experience and a reputation in the industry based on our ability to meet client and environmental outcomes through our specialised insights, qualified ideas, collaborative relationships and innovative solutions.  We are a multiskilled team and have skilled ecological sensitive operators in both manual and mechanical techniques§The Environmental Works Team Member is part of the team ensuring Platypus maintains a safe and innovative culture that delivers high quality outcomes for our own team, our clients and the environment.§About the Role §As the Environmental Works Team Leader, you will be responsible to provide assistance in the delivery of various high-quality environmental services including weed control works, revegetation, wetland establishment, erosion control, tree works, consultancy, grooming and chipping. §You will be required to complete physically demanding manual work in the outdoors, and operate in a safe and effective team environment within the framework of our daily safety, quality and environmental management systems.§This role is located in the Inner and greater west regions of Melbourne and beyond. §Your Skills and Experience§Demonstrated experience and capabilities working within and leading field crews in Environmental, Conservation and Land Management and/or related sectors.§Diploma or Degree in Conservation and Land Management, Environmental Science, Agriculture or related disciplines and/or extensive equivalent experience. §Competency and knowledge in a variety of environmental and natural resource management techniques and methodologies including revegetation, weed control and herbicide application, both mechanical and manual.§Ability to take responsibility for ensuring own and team members physical and psychological wellbeing and safety.§Advanced indigenous and exotic flora species identification skills.§Advanced knowledge of a variety of safety and environmental hazards, risks and associated controls within a natural resource or waterway context.§Actively contribute to trying different approaches and taking responsibility for actions.§A drive and willingness to trouble shoot, apply problem solving skills, identify innovation and recommend solutions that achieve on ground quality, safety, technical and productivity outcomes.§Sound self-awareness, people leadership and communication skills, with an ability to work in a team environment and proactively communicate clearly and effectively with a range of people.§Knowledge of applicable legislative requirements, including for storage and use of herbicides.§Knowledge and experience in computer use, report writing, GPS and mapping, and HSEQ management systems requirements. §Competent use and ability to teach others about safe operation of range of tools, equipment and small plant, ranging from hand tools to machinery.§ §Other mandatory qualifications are: Chemcert or ACUP, Construction OHS Induction card, First Aid Level 2§Desirable (although not mandatory) qualifications are: Chainsaw Level 1 Operate and Maintain Chainsaws, Chainsaw Level 2. Fall Trees Manually, WWCC, Canoe Operation, Remote/ Wilderness First Aid§A diverse and inclusive team§At Platypus we strongly believe that diversity in our workplace is paramount to a positive, productive and effective team.  Such a workforce contributes a diversity of new ideas and approaches to works and outcomes. Platypus has created an inclusive workplace which values and utilises the contributions of people with different cultural backgrounds, professional skills, working styles, personality types, life experiences and perspectives.§We value having a range of people with different backgrounds and experiences in our team, as our individual perspectives collectively enables us to grow as people, and to be a safe and innovative team.  We are an equal opportunity employer and encourage applications from Indigenous people, all cultures, religions and welcome all genders.§How to Apply§For more information, please see the attached Position Description.§Please note your own transport and/or ability to get to remote sites is essential, and we pay above award rates.§Click on the “Apply” button and complete the online application, including cover letter and CV§ § §Email applications to: belinda.kelson@platypusenvironmental.com.au [link removed]§ §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§How many years of project management experience do you have?§Have you completed a qualification in science?§How many years of people management experience do you have?§Are you familiar with the Health, Safety, Environment and Quality (HSEQ) standards?§Do you have experience managing teams remotely?§§§

jobTitle: Research Technician (Translational Biotechnology) Job in Brisbane - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50581706.txt	§Research Technician (Translational Biotechnology)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Research Technician (Translational Biotechnology)§§Advertiser: §The University of Queensland§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§17 Sept 2020§§Location§§Brisbane§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Science & Technology§, §Other§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Research Technician (Translational Biotechnology) §      §        §§        §Australian Institute for Bioengineering and Nanotechnology (AIBN)§        §The University of Queensland's Australian Institute for Bioengineering and Nanotechnology (AIBN) is a dynamic multi-disciplinary research institute dedicated to developing technology to alleviate societal problems in the areas of health, energy, manufacturing and environmental sustainability. AIBN brings together the skills of more than 450 world-class researchers complimented by an extensive suite of integrated facilities, working at the intersection of biology, chemistry, engineering and computer modelling.§        §With a reputation for delivering translational science, AIBN conducts research at the forefront of emerging technologies, and has developed strong collaborations with leading members of industry, academia and government. AIBN goes beyond basic research to develop the growth of innovative industries for the benefit of the Queensland and Australian economies.§        §About This Opportunity§        §The Research Technician will provide support to the team of scientists at the National Biologics Facility to ensure the efficient operation of the laboratories, including instrument maintenance and consumables management. Duties will include but not be limited to; lab consumables management and equipment maintenance and assisting with general laboratory procedures such as preparation of buffers and reagents.§        §This position is located at our §picturesque St Lucia campus§, renowned as one of Australia’s most attractive university campuses, and located just 7km from Brisbane’s city centre. Bounded by the Brisbane River on three sides, and with outstanding public transport connections, our 114-hectare site provides a perfect work environment – you can enjoy the best of both worlds: a vibrant campus with the tradition of an established university.§        §Our Ideal Candidate§        §You will have qualifications and training equivalent to a diploma level or Certificate IV with experience in a similar role using and maintaining scientific equipment. You will have experience in stocktaking and ordering of consumables, following standard operating procedures and record keeping. You will have good computer literacy including experience with standard office software, electronic databases. Experience with equipment used in a recombinant protein bioprocessing facility, including bioreactors, chromatography systems and protein analytical equipment would be an advantage.§        §You must have ongoing unrestricted work rights in Australia to apply for this opportunity.§        §We value diversity and inclusion, and actively encourage applications from those who bring diversity to the University. Our §Diversity and Inclusion webpage§ contains further information if you require additional support. Accessibility requirements and/or adjustments can be directed to §recruitment@uq.edu.au§.§        §What We Can Offer§        §This is a fixed-term position until 30 June 2022 at HEW level 4. This role is a full-time position, however part time working arrangements may be negotiated.§        §The full-time equivalent base salary will be in the range $64,142 - $69,276 plus super of up to 17%. The total FTE package will be in the range $75,046 - $81,053.§        §You will be able to take advantage of §UQ Sport Facilities§, recreation leave loading (of 17.5%), salary sacrificing options, on-campus childcare, discounted private health insurance, affordable parking, §development programs§ and many other benefits.§        §For further information, please review §The University of Queensland's Enterprise Bargaining Agreement 2018-2021§.§        §Position Description§        § §3065110_Research Technician.pdf§        §Questions?§        §To discuss this role please contact §Dr Martina Jones§.§        §Want to Apply?§        §To submit an application for this role, use the §APPLY NOW§ button below. All applicants must supply the following documents:§        §          §Cover letter addressing key selection criteria§          §Resume§        §        §To satisfy pre-requisite questions and ensure your application can be considered in full, all candidates must apply via the UQTXT portal by the job closing deadline. Applications received via other channels including direct email will not be accepted.§        §Applications Close: §16 October 2020 at 11:00 pm AEST§        §UQ Job Reference #: §511250§      §      §      §    §  §§§§Australian Institute for Bioengineering and Nanotechnology (AIBN)§The University of Queensland's Australian Institute for Bioengineering and Nanotechnology (AIBN) is a dynamic multi-disciplinary research institute dedicated to developing technology to alleviate societal problems in the areas of health, energy, manufacturing and environmental sustainability. AIBN brings together the skills of more than 450 world-class researchers complimented by an extensive suite of integrated facilities, working at the intersection of biology, chemistry, engineering and computer modelling.§With a reputation for delivering translational science, AIBN conducts research at the forefront of emerging technologies, and has developed strong collaborations with leading members of industry, academia and government. AIBN goes beyond basic research to develop the growth of innovative industries for the benefit of the Queensland and Australian economies.§About This Opportunity§The Research Technician will provide support to the team of scientists at the National Biologics Facility to ensure the efficient operation of the laboratories, including instrument maintenance and consumables management. Duties will include but not be limited to; lab consumables management and equipment maintenance and assisting with general laboratory procedures such as preparation of buffers and reagents.§This position is located at our §picturesque St Lucia campus§, renowned as one of Australia’s most attractive university campuses, and located just 7km from Brisbane’s city centre. Bounded by the Brisbane River on three sides, and with outstanding public transport connections, our 114-hectare site provides a perfect work environment – you can enjoy the best of both worlds: a vibrant campus with the tradition of an established university.§Our Ideal Candidate§You will have qualifications and training equivalent to a diploma level or Certificate IV with experience in a similar role using and maintaining scientific equipment. You will have experience in stocktaking and ordering of consumables, following standard operating procedures and record keeping. You will have good computer literacy including experience with standard office software, electronic databases. Experience with equipment used in a recombinant protein bioprocessing facility, including bioreactors, chromatography systems and protein analytical equipment would be an advantage.§You must have ongoing unrestricted work rights in Australia to apply for this opportunity.§We value diversity and inclusion, and actively encourage applications from those who bring diversity to the University. Our §Diversity and Inclusion webpage§ contains further information if you require additional support. Accessibility requirements and/or adjustments can be directed to §recruitment@uq.edu.au§.§What We Can Offer§This is a fixed-term position until 30 June 2022 at HEW level 4. This role is a full-time position, however part time working arrangements may be negotiated.§The full-time equivalent base salary will be in the range $64,142 - $69,276 plus super of up to 17%. The total FTE package will be in the range $75,046 - $81,053.§You will be able to take advantage of §UQ Sport Facilities§, recreation leave loading (of 17.5%), salary sacrificing options, on-campus childcare, discounted private health insurance, affordable parking, §development programs§ and many other benefits.§For further information, please review §The University of Queensland's Enterprise Bargaining Agreement 2018-2021§.§Position Description§ §3065110_Research Technician.pdf§§Questions?§To discuss this role please contact §Dr Martina Jones§.§Want to Apply?§To submit an application for this role, use the §APPLY NOW§ button below. jobText: TXT/50647581.txt	§Water Quality Scientist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Water Quality Scientist§§Advertiser: §Viridis Consultants§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Brisbane§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Science & Technology§, §Environmental, Earth & Geosciences§§§§§§About Us  § §Viridis Consultants is nationally recognised for water quality expertise. We specialise in water quality management and work with state regulators, large metropolitan utilities and small regional and remote councils throughout Queensland, New South Wales and Victoria.  § §Every day we work to deliver on our mission, to provide expert scientific and engineering support to clients to enhance business performance, public health and environmental values. We understand the need to value the work that you do. We offer the opportunity to make the difference to communities across Australia. § §About the Role  § §We are looking for an experienced Water Quality Scientist to join our team of scientists and engineers.   § §We are based in Brisbane and have an office in Morningside. Prior to COVID-19 we worked semi-autonomously combining time in the office with working from home in accordance with our Working from Home Policy. Remote working options are available for this role.§ §The role will include:  § § § §Processing of water quality data, undertaking statistical analysis and generating graphic representations.§ § § §Interpreting water quality data and providing advice.§ § § §Writing technical reports and procedures.§ § § §Undertaking water quality risk assessments. § § § §Providing training and expert advice to water utility operations staff. § § § §Undertaking marketing activities and maintaining a professional network of clients, peers and service providers. § § §  § §What we’re looking for  § § § §Essential - Bachelor of science or similar§ § § §3+ years experience in the water and/or wastewater industry. § § § §Highly developed understanding of data analysis and statistics.  § § § §High level of proficiency with MS Office, in particular Excel. § § § §Excellent communication and report writing skills.§ § § §Highly desirable - familiar with the following software Minitab, QGIS or other GIS system§ § § § §Why Join Us  § §This position offers the opportunity to utilise your scientific skills to make a difference to public health in communities across Australia. § §We are a genuinely inclusive company and embrace a strong team culture. We value your professional growth. We embrace diversity. We value fairness and equal opportunity.  § §We’re flexible and know the importance of work/life balance. If you’re a parent or caregiver, studying or have other needs, we can support you with flexible work hours and leave options.  § § § §Apply  § §The following MUST be provided to be considered for this position: § § § §Current professional resume. § § § §Covering letter, as a minimum detailing the following: § § § §Rights to live and work in Australia§ § § §Current employment§ § § §Reason for applying for this position§ § § §Availability to start. § § § § § § §Closing Date§ §Applications close at 5pm on Friday October 16 2020.§ §Please submit via SEEK only. Shortlisted candidates will be contacted.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§Are you available to travel for this role when required?§Do you have a current Australian driver's licence?§Which of the following data analytics tools are you experienced with?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

jobText: TXT/50690764.txt	§Senior Technologist - Shepparton§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Technologist - Shepparton§§Advertiser: §The Arnott’s Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Science & Technology§, §Food Technology & Safety§§§§§§The Arnott’s Group portfolio of brands such as Tim Tams, Campbell Soup, Shapes, V8 and Scotch Finger continues the 155-year legacy of the Arnott family, providing quality, great-tasting food. Our ambition is to be a regional powerhouse of consumer food brands and our purpose is simple: to create delicious moments. We foster equality, diversity and sustainability, high performance with integrity, balancing decisions from our head and heart and delighting our customers every time.§ § § §An exciting opportunity has become available for a passionate Senior Technologist within our Meals & Beverage team. Based at our factory site in Shepparton and reporting to the Program Manager, you will be leading projects to develop new products and deliver margin improvement strategies and concepts. You will also be involved in re-engineering existing processes, ingredient changes, driving productivity programs, and providing technical support to enable the company to meet its business objectives.§ § § §This role will require you to work within international cross functional teams to ensure the delivery of objectives. Strong communication, problem solving, and effective project & time management skills will be critical to your success.§ § § §The successful applicant should have a minimum bachelor’s degree in food science & technology or related area and 4-6 years of experience in the food industry.  Experience in the product development of thermal processed food will be highly regarded however other product development experience will also be considered. § §If you have a passion for food and cooking, are curious about science and have strong analytical thinking skills, this is the role for you.§ § § §Our passion to create delicious moments and push the boundaries is what keeps us at the forefront of our industry. We pride ourselves on our high-performance work environment where everyone has the same opportunity to perform, grow and thrive.§§§§

The role will be responsible for the coordination and effective§implementation of GIS software and data infrastructure. This includes managing the corporate data to ensure there is appropriate care in the collection, storage and maintenance of spatial information throughout the organisation.§ §The incumbent will also provide technical advice and operational support to staff to ensure spatial information and analysis informs the development, implementation and review of projects, programs and strategies. In addition, the incumbent will undertake specialist data analysis to support corporate and project planning and delivery activities, as well as the decision making and prioritisation of on‐ground works and project expenditure.§ § §Skills and experience§ §Degree or diploma in Spatial Science, Natural Resource Management or similar field with a minimum of 12 months relevant experience.§A high‐level understanding of natural resource management issues§Strong organisational skills, the capacity to successfully manage competing§priorities, maintain attention to detail and meet deadlines§Thorough understanding of GIS database development, spatial analysis and map production§Well‐developed verbal and written communication skills§Experience and high‐level skills in the use of GIS software – across desktop, mobile and web platforms§ § § § §For further information, including position descriptions please go to §https://www.ghcma.vic.gov.au/about-us/work-with-us/ .§ Applications are to include a comprehensive resume and a cover letter outlining your skills and experience relevant to this position§ §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§§§

jobText: TXT/50618346.txt	§Agricultural Research Operations Officer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Agricultural Research Operations Officer§§Advertiser: §Soil Carbon Co.§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Sept 2020§§Location§§Blue Mountains & Central West§§Salary§§$70,000 - $79,999§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Science & Technology§, §Laboratory & Technical Services§§§§§§About Soil Carbon Co.§  §Soil Carbon Co is a fast-paced, rapidly growing organisation, driven by people who are enthusiastic about nature-based solutions to real world challenges. The organisation is leading a large-scale research program in the area of microbial carbon sequestration to increase soil carbon levels in agricultural soils as a climate change mitigation and adaptation tool. We focus on endophyte technologies that deliver multiple benefits to farming systems and the environment. The organisation is made up of both researchers and practitioners working across microbiology, soil carbon and agronomy to deliver practical, scientifically validated methods of sequestration.§  §About the role§ §  §The Operations Officer will be working closely with the R&D team to assist with both product development and grower engagement. The Officer will work with the microbial research team and agronomy team to ensure that projects run to time and hit deliverables, while supporting the management team for specific operational tasks. The role will be based in the Orange SCC office, with some field work at various locations. §  §Responsibilities:§ § §Assisting with project management within specific areas of the R&D program§ §Support SCC’s grower pilot group including both managing communications and extension resources and the running of on-farm pilot projects § §Regulatory and compliance management for carbon inoculum packages§ §Assist with hiring processes for Australia and international offices§ §Assist the carbon markets team with research and scoping and industry engagement as required§ §About You:§  §To fit into the team perfectly you will have most of these attributes:§ § §Studies in agricultural science, agricultural business, or agricultural production§ §Direct on-farm experience or experience with R&D for agriculture§ §Ability to proactively engage with farmers when managing on-farm project sites§ §Flexibility in approach to work - you will be required to direct day-to-day operations or processes § §Ability to manage multiple projects and confidence in working with teams§ §Willingness to travel, nationally where required§ §Benefits § § §Opportunities for capacity building and leadership § §Regionally based in Orange, NSW§ §Office located on university campus with direct access to sports facilities§ §$70,000 - $80,000 base salary depending on skills and experience§ §Applications close 12th October, 2020. Email questions on the role to §tegan@soilcarbon.co§. Only applications submitted via Seek will be assessed, and those with current Australian working rights progressed. §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

ChemSkill§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Salary§§Fixed-Term Tenure or Contract§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Science & Technology§, §Chemistry & Physics§§§§§§THE CLIENT§  §The §Defence Science and Technology Group (DSTG) §is part of the Australian Department of Defence dedicated to providing §science and technology support for Australia's defence and national security needs.§  §DST Group§ is a national leader in safeguarding Australia by delivering valued scientific advice and innovative solutions for Defence and national security.§ §  §THE ROLE§  §DSTG's Fuels Team perform bespoke applied fuel research programs, which support the Department of Defence's agenda and ensure the integrity of its fuels continue to support the ADF's array of military vehicles. The team has a project-based need for an experienced §Fuels Chemist §with analytical chemistry skills to a scientist. The successful candidate will perform work for the Fuels Services Branch (FSB) within the fuels and lubricants testing laboratory at §DSTG's Fishermans Bend §site in Melbourne.§  §Whilst starting shall be subject to being granted the necessary baseline clearance by AGSVA, the initial contract period will be until 2 July 2021 and then DSTG has the option to extend this period by up to 12 months. The position is  (i.e., 0.8 FTE).§  §CS Executive Group can offer employment under a fixed tenure, which includes §paid annual leave, sick leave, and public holidays§. Alternatively, if you opt to forgo those benefits, we can engage you on §a contract based solely on hours worked§ that affords a higher hourly rate of pay in accordance with casual employment terms.§  §With §tertiary qualifications in chemistry§, you will need to have a comprehensive understanding of Work Health and Safety (WHS) requirements for working in a chemical laboratory and specific experience from working in a fuels laboratory. DSTG will not be providing additional training. Therefore, you must be completely capable of performing complex analytical chemistry tasks and be competent in the operation of all relevant laboratory equipment.§  §In summary, your duties will involve the provision of technical and professional support in the following areas:§ § §Complex fieldwork on Australian Defence Force (ADF) fuel and lubricant systems;§ §Analytical support to Aerospace Division fuels work programs;§ §Project work on degradation and technical integrity of fuels; and§ §Provision of a laboratory capable of conducting applied fuel research.§ §The outcomes of your work will be used to provide written reports to fulfil the ongoing requirements of DSTG's fuel research activities.§ §  §SELECTION CRITERIA§  §To be considered for this unique opportunity you §MUST BE AN AUSTRALIAN CITIZEN§ and will also need to meet the following criteria:§ § § §Degree in Chemical Science;§  § § §Highly skilled experienced fuels chemist;§  § § §Comprehensive understanding of working safely in a fuels laboratory environment;§  § § §Demonstrated competent operation of Agilent GCMS, GC-AED, HPLC & FTIR systems, which extends to the skills necessary to develop methods;§  § § §Demonstrated operation of complex fuels-related analytical equipment (e.g., JFTOT, BOCLE freeze point, and distillation equipment);§  § § §Technical report writing experience; and§  § § §MUST be Willing to Undergo a Security Clearance.§  § §Whilst work will primarily be conducted at the Fishermans Bend site, DST may occasionally require other working arrangements to meet requirements of its fuel-related projects.§ §  § §APPLICATIONS§  §Please click the 'Apply' button to submit your application. Kindly ensure you attach a Resume and Cover Letter in Word Format addressing, the letter should address all of the above selection criteria. A formal selection criteria document will form part of CS Executive Group's pre-screening assessment process and an initial interview by a member of our team will occur prior to our presentation of shortlisted candidates to DSTG.§  §If you would like to know more about this opportunity then SMS/call Dr Daniel (Dan) Turner on §0415 573 220§.§  §Alternatively, you can submit any questions via email to §recruiters@csexecgroup.com§ with the following included within the subject line as a SEEK job reference :§  §FUELCHEM0920§ §  §THANK YOU§  §CS Executive Group would like to thank you in advance for taking the time to apply for this role. Unfortunately, due to the large volume of correspondence our recruitment team receives on a daily basis, we genuinely cannot respond to each application—only those applicants being considered for shortlisting as candidates are contacted.§  §If on this occasion you're unsuccessful, your details will be added to our Talent Pool database. Do ensure you visit our website to view all of our current opportunities: §  §www.csexecutivegroup.com/jobs§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§Have you completed a qualification in science?§Do you have experience working in a NATA accredited laboratory?§Do you hold Australian Security Clearance?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

To learn more visit us at §http://www.saputo.com/en/careers§ § § §About the role§ § § §We are seeking a qualified and experienced Quality Administrator to join our Quality team on a full-time basis. This position will report to the Laboratory Manager and will be based at our Allansford site.§ §The purpose of the Quality Administrator-Site Hygienist is to ensure the continued compliance of SDA Allansford Quality Management System with relevant regulatory, accreditation & customer requirements.§ §The main system elements that the role will be responsible for are§ §Environmental Monitoring Program§Contaminant/Periodic Testing Program§Regulatory Testing Program§Investigative Microbiological Testing Program§ §Duties:§ § §Maintain all documented quality procedures, work instructions, forms and databases.§Coordinate the collection of samples for testing, investigating and reporting upon out-of-spec/off base line results. Maintaining customer/regulatory requirements and ensure that any changes are communicated and the QMS is updated accordingly.§Review investigative surveys and ensure actions taken in response to these surveys is appropriate, completed and documented.§Monitor and manage divisional expenditure on testing, highlighting significant cost variances on a mothly basis.§Attend and report upon the status of the testing programs and investigative surveys at weekly Operations meeting.§Conduct information/training sessions across the business§Focus on the need for continuous improvement in an ongoing effort to improve products, services and/or processes.§ § § §Essential Criteria§ § § §Minimum 3 years experience within Quality or Laboratory environment§Knowledge and experience in food safety and quality assurance management systems§Strong knowledge of microsoft suite (excel, word, visio, powerpoint)§Strong Interpersonal and team work skills§Action and outcome focused§Qualification in food science, quality management or equivalent (Preferred)§ § § §Employee Benefits§ § § §Permanent full time position§Competitive salary package§Discount on company branded products§Assistance program for employees and their families §Employee share ownership program§ § § §Applications close Friday, 16th October 2020§ § § §Saputo Dairy Australia is an equal opportunity employer§ § §As we receive a high level of interest in our opportunities, only short-listed applicants will be contacted§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years' experience do you have in a quality assurance (QA) role?§Have you completed a qualification in science?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

For product launches, ensuring factory recipes, key cards and other relevant documentation is available.§ §Review product specifications as required and ensure that updated recipes and sop’s are issued to production.§ §Writing and reading technical papers, reports, reviews and specifications.§ §keeping up to date with relevant scientific and technical developments§ §Delivering a product from initial creative food brief through to successful implementation on plant, meeting key milestones and cost target§ §Travel to other Turosi sites to conduct trials as required. § §Qualifications and skills required: § § §Food Science / Technology (or related discipline) qualification to degree level (or equivalent)§ §3 – 4 years’ experience in NPD meat / further processing is desirable. § §Experience of microbiological schedules and results interpretation§ §Knowledge of relevant food safety legislation, HACCP and the current BRC quality standard§ §Intermediate Food Hygiene qualification would be desirable§ §Formal qualification in HACCP to Level 3 would be desirable§ §Demonstrable experience in conduct and management of Internal Audits is a requirement. jobText: TXT/50672249.txt	§Research Officer - Stem Cells and Neural Development§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Research Officer - Stem Cells and Neural Development§§Advertiser: §The Florey Institute of Neuroscience & Mental Health§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Science & Technology§, §Biological & Biomedical Sciences§§§§§§ §Attractive salary and benefits§ §Based in Parkville, Melbourne§ §Full-time, fixed term until 30 Dec 2022§ § § §About us:§ §One in five Australians are affected by a brain disorder each year. The Florey Institute of Neuroscience and Mental Health has more than 600 staff and students who are passionately committed to researching the way the brain works. We are internationally renowned for our discoveries and research on the central nervous system and associated brain disorders.§ §We are an Institute that makes a difference.§ § § §About the role:§ §An excellent opportunity is available for a highly motivated individual to join an outstanding team of scientists and staff, and work within the §Stem Cells and Neural Development Laboratory§.  The role will be responsible for contributing to the broader understanding and potential utility for human stem cells in regenerative medicine – with a focus on brain repair.§ §The position seeks to advance the directed differentiation of human pluripotent stem cells into neuronal subpopulations; and advance the implementation of biomaterials for regenerative medicine – assessing the potential of functionalised scaffolds to support stem cells in culture and during the integration of cell transplants into the injured brain.§ §To view the Position Description:§ https://florey.edu.au/about/careers/research-officer-stem-cells-and-neural-development-laboratory § § § §About you:§ §The successful candidate will have a doctoral degree in a relevant field and solid understanding of neural development and stem cell biology. Specific skills in human stem cell culturing and stereotaxic surgery is required for this position together with good communication, writing and organisation skills.§ § § §We are seeking someone with a minimum of 3 years post-doctoral experience.§ §A Research Officer salary of Research Officer 1($83,974) to Research Officer 3 ($90,143) plus 14%/17% superannuation and generous salary packaging options is available. For more information or to obtain a position description please visit our web site at www.florey.edu.au/careers § §Applicants who meet the above criteria should apply for this position addressing the Key Responsibilities in the cover letter by no later than 4pm on 30 October 2020.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50632198.txt	§Research Assistant Biochemical Analytics§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Research Assistant Biochemical Analytics§§Advertiser: §Exopharm§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Science & Technology§, §Biological & Biomedical Sciences§§§§§§This is a §hands-on lab-based§ position in a fast-paced environment where the successful candidate will work on in the Product Development Group to support current and future analytical studies. These studies will improve our understanding of exosomes and their use in regenerative medicine for multiple healthspan-related indications. §To be successful for this role you will need to have: §A Bachelor’s Degree in Biochemistry, Chemistry, Biotechnology, Biomedical Sciences (or a related/relevant discipline) or an equivalent level of knowledge gained through any other combination of education, training, or experience. §Preferably industry experience§ or demonstrated strong interest in drug development and analytical biochemistry. §Demonstrated§ competence with IT§, key programs used in bioanalytics, such as PRISM, R or MatLab, and troubleshooting instruments and computers. §Demonstrated experience with key biochemistry/analytical assays, including protein isolation and characterization, electron microscopy, agarose gel electrophoresis and western blots.  §Demonstrated experience using §HPLC/FPLC§ for the characterization of biological samples. §Experience with §fluorescent dyes§ and markers will be well regarded. §Demonstrated experience with §particle analysers.§ §Ideally §experienced in working in a regulated laboratory environment§ (GLP, GLP-like or similar) - at a minimum must be able to demonstrate excellent recordkeeping around maintaining laboratory records, including lab notebooks, and collection and organisation of data. §Experience in working in a paperless work environment,  §electronic record keeping§ / lab notebooks expected. §Excellent communication, organization and interpersonal skills plus working knowledge in Microsoft Office tools (including Excel and Word). §Participate in laboratory meetings and seminars. §Experience with proteomics and/or lipidomics mass spectrometry§ will be highly regarded. §The ideal candidate will be a great team player who is pro-active, capable at troubleshooting, able to self-motivate and can grow within a flexible and dynamic work environment.  §Exopharm is an ASX-listed company (EX1) – see www.exopharm.com §We are committed to bringing disruptive advanced medicine products into reality, doing good science and meeting the highest quality standards. §§§§

Ltd.§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Sept 2020§§Location§§Newcastle, Maitland & Hunter§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Science & Technology§, §Food Technology & Safety§§§§§§The Company:§  §Masterol Foods designs, manufactures and distributes a range of innovative vegetable oil-based products at sites in NSW and QLD. The company’s products are used throughout the baking, confectionery and wider food industries by regional, national and multi-national manufacturers and food service operations.§  § §  §The Role:§  §Part of a small, multi-skilled team designing and manufacturing specialty products. The position offers an opportunity to develop a broad skill set through working with various areas of the business including sales and manufacturing. The role will start as a full-time contract and offers a competitive remuneration package commensurate with skills and experience.§  § §  §Key Responsibilities:§ § §Perform routine quality assurance tasks related to products and facilities§ §Maintain a certified food safety system implemented across two sites§ §Complete a range of internal and external documentation§ §Provide support to customers and internal stakeholders including Site Managers§ §Contribute to New Product Development under the guidance of the Technical Director§ § §  §The Applicant:§ § §Degree level qualification in Food Science and Technology or a related field§ §Recent graduate with one to two years’ experience in industry§ §Sound understanding of HACCP, GMP and GFSI standards§ §Self-motivated person with ability to work autonomously§ §High level of attention to detail§ § §  §Candidates based in the Newcastle / Lake Macquarie area may be preferred over candidates who would need to relocate for this position.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§How many years' experience do you have in a quality assurance (QA) role?§§§

Proper outsourcing of certain tests is part of this responsibility. In case no suitable test method is available, test methods need to be developed, often based on technology transfer from the client. The work in the Quality Control lab is a mixture of development tests, project related activities and routine testing for which an adequate organization need to be managed.§What will you do?§        § customer requirements.§          §Peer review of analysis for completeness and correctness.§          §Assist QC Supervisor in review / approval of test records, where relevant§          §Identify and report non-conformances and OOS/UR results directly to Supervisor and Sr. Manager, QC or delegate.§          §Contribute to the effective delivery of high value analytical services to clients.§ tools (i.e. failure mode effect analysis, fishbone diagrams, hazard and operability studies) and ability to directly develop, participate, and advise others on the appropriate and efficient application of these processes.§          §Support in the practical application of the Quality System, Change Control, Deviations, CAPA, OOS and OOT, Document Management, related to the Quality Control Department.§          §Assist with site PPI projects.§          §Perform any other legitimate duties as directed by the Senior Manager, QC (or delegate).§        §        §How will you get here?§        §          §Bachelor of Science (Bio-Technology, Chemistry, or closely related degree).§          §1 - 2 years’ experience in the pharmaceutical and/or pharmaceutical industry aligned to Analytical and Quality Control fields (preferred)§        §        §What will put you ahead of the competition?§        §          §Knowledgeable in cGMP practices§          §Familiarity with principles of Aseptic techniques, preferred.§          §Background in analytical theory and technical competency with laboratory analysis, desirable.§          §Ability to work in a highly dynamic, frequently changing environment with a wide variety of people and perspectives.§          §Proven record of ability to work as a team member and independently as required.§          §Ability to effectively communicate in multiple modalities (e.g. electronic, written, verbal, etc.)§          §Ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously and demonstrate initiative to complete tasks according to company milestones / goal tree.§          §Strong team working and collaborative skills.§          §Good knowledge of Microsoft applications (e.g. Excel, Word, Outlook, PowerPoint).§ jobTitle: CHIEF RESEARCH OFFICER Job in Adelaide - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50635763.txt	§CHIEF RESEARCH OFFICER§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§CHIEF RESEARCH OFFICER§§Advertiser: §Hender Consulting§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Adelaide§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Science & Technology§, §Other§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §CHIEF RESEARCH OFFICER §    §    §      §        §SmartSat CRC§        §The SmartSat CRC is a consortium of universities and other research organisations, partnered with industry, that has been funded by the Australian Government to develop know-how and technologies in advanced telecommunications and IoT connectivity, intelligent satellite systems and Earth observation next generation data services.  The impact of this research will be to develop intellectual property and a specialist industry expertise that will spawn new businesses, create export economic value and generate new high-tech jobs for all Australians.§        §Reporting to the CEO, this critical role provides high level research leadership and operational direction in delivering on SmartSat’s vision. Working closely with the Research Program Directors, Theme Leaders and the Education Directors, the CRO will drive SmartSat’s research programs and missions as well as its education and training programs.  Applications are encouraged from senior research leaders with significant experience in the space or space-related research environment.  Technical experience in space systems will also be expected.  Demonstrated ability with leading senior researchers as well as a track record of success in working directly with industry are also considered minimum requirements.§        §This role presents an exciting opportunity to contribute towards building Australia’s Space Industry.  SmartSat is an organisation committed to ensuring a diverse and inclusive workplace and culture.  Eligibility for Australian Security NV1 Clearance is desirable.§        §Please visit §henderconsulting.com.au §for a job and person specification.§  For further information on our client, please visit §smartsatcrc.com§  §        §Applications should be addressed to Justin Hinora and Trish Retallick.  §        §For a confidential discussion, please call +61 §8 8100 8827§ or via email §justin.hinora@hender.com.au§        § §      §      §      §    §    §  §§§SmartSat CRC§  §The SmartSat CRC is a consortium of universities and other research organisations, partnered with industry, that has been funded by the Australian Government to develop know-how and technologies in advanced telecommunications and IoT connectivity, intelligent satellite systems and Earth observation next generation data services.  The impact of this research will be to develop intellectual property and a specialist industry expertise that will spawn new businesses, create export economic value and generate new high-tech jobs for all Australians.§  §Reporting to the CEO, this critical role provides high level research leadership and operational direction in delivering on SmartSat’s vision. Working closely with the Research Program Directors, Theme Leaders and the Education Directors, the CRO will drive SmartSat’s research programs and missions as well as its education and training programs.  Applications are encouraged from senior research leaders with significant experience in the space or space-related research environment.  Technical experience in space systems will also be expected.  Demonstrated ability with leading senior researchers as well as a track record of success in working directly with industry are also considered minimum requirements.§  §This role presents an exciting opportunity to contribute towards building Australia’s Space Industry.  SmartSat is an organisation committed to ensuring a diverse and inclusive workplace and culture.  Eligibility for Australian Security NV1 Clearance is desirable.§  §Please visit §henderconsulting.com.au §for a job and person specification.§  For further information on our client, please visit §smartsatcrc.com§  §  §Applications should be addressed to Justin Hinora and Trish Retallick.  §  §For a confidential discussion, please call +61 §8 8100 8827§ or via email §justin.hinora@hender.com.au§  § §§§§
