campus§, renowned as one of Australia’s most attractive university campuses, and located just 7km from Brisbane’s city centre. Bounded by the Brisbane River on three sides, and with outstanding public transport connections, our 114-hectare site provides a perfect work environment – you can enjoy the best of both worlds: a vibrant campus with the tradition of an established university.§        §Our Ideal Candidate§        §Alongside the completion of a PhD in a relevant discipline area, the successful candidate will demonstrate:§        §          §In-depth knowledge and understanding of protected horticulture.§          §Excellent skills in the independent design, acquiring, management, execution and reporting of research projects.§          §Success in leading a research program.§          §A distinguished record of contribution to research in protected horticulture. value-in-use.§ §About the Position§ALS is seeking a suitably experienced Business Development Manager to join our management team based in Brisbane (Richlands).  Reporting to the General Manager, you will be responsible for the identification, development and delivery of new business and market opportunities to increase the profitability and growth of the business in the coal market whilst leveraging our reputation.  This is a highly strategic position which will assist in the creation of strategy and help open new industry opportunities.  In this role you will have functional working relationships with various Business Unit Managers, technical staff and other key management contacts.§It will be expected that the successful candidate will hold existing strong relationships across the industry, negotiate deals for the business and achieve key revenue targets.  This position will operate as a key interface between ALS and external partners and drive complex negotiations to close significant business deals.§ §Position Synopsis§The position responsibilities and requirements include but are not limited to:§        §          §Developing growth strategies and plans§ skills§          §Proven ability to negotiate§          §Experience with design and implementation of business development strategy§          §Conflict resolution skills§          §The ability to self-motivate and motivate a team§          §Experience working to and exceeding targets§          §Sound computer skills Microsoft Office and Microsoft Dynamics (CRM). § §        §About you§To be considered for this opportunity you will be of an outgoing nature, enthusiastic, autonomous, client focused and possess a strong attention to detail.  You will have excellent verbal and written communication and problem solving skills, sound computer skills in Microsoft Office and Microsoft Dynamics (CRM).  Previous coal industry experience in a similar role would be seen as a strong advantage. § §A competitive remuneration package will be offered to the successful candidate based on skills and experience for the role.§ §As part of the selection process, a pre-employment medical assessment will be required, including drug and alcohol screening. § §ALS is committed to making a diverse work environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. §§To apply please click on retaining relationships with existing clients§Increasing the client base§Writing proposals and tenders§Negotiating with stakeholders§Drafting and reviewing contracts§Having an in-depth knowledge of jobTitle: Reef Restoration & Adaptation Program Projects Coordinator (Management & Comms) Job in Northern QLD - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50640006.txt	§Reef Restoration & Adaptation Program Projects Coordinator (Management & Comms)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Reef Restoration & Adaptation Program Projects Coordinator (Management & Comms)§§Advertiser: §Australian Institute of Marine Science§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§27 Sept 2020§§Location§§Northern QLD§§Salary§§($84,285 to $95,915 pro-rata/per annum)§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Science & Technology§, §Environmental, Earth & Geosciences§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §        §Reef Restoration & Adaptation Program Projects Coordinator (Management & Comms) §        §        §        §      §    §    §      §        §About AIMS§The Australian Institute of Marine Science is Australia’s tropical marine research agency.§We are a trusted advisor, a partner and employer of choice, and we value integrity, innovation, collaboration and respect.§AIMS’ research of Australia’s tropical marine ecosystems guides their effective environmental management and contributes to our understanding of similar ecosystems around the world. Our research seeks to deliver practical benefit to all Australians and supports the sustainable use our tropical marine estate. Governments, reef managers, industry and the wider community look to our high-quality, long-term research for informed decisions about our iconic Great Barrier Reef, North-West Shelf, and Arafura and Timor Seas.§AIMS expert teams at our locations in Townsville, Darwin and Perth have access to world-class infrastructure, unique data-sets, cutting-edge laboratories and a fleet of modern research vessels. At AIMS, the way we work guides our team members’ on their collective journey towards the successful delivery our AIMS Strategy 2025 targets.§About this Opportunity §The Reef Restoration, and Adaptation Program (RRAP) is the largest, most comprehensive program of its type in the world; a collaboration of leading experts in reef ecology, water and land management, engineering, innovation, and social sciences. The program draws on the full breadth of Australian expertise and that from around the world and aims to strike a balance between minimising risk and maximising opportunity to save Reef species and values from the impacts of climate change.§As our RRAP Projects Coordinator (Management and Communication) you will support the delivery of projects within the sub-programs:§        §          §Enhanced Corals and Treatments; and§          §Coral Aquaculture and Deployment.§        §        §Your planning, organisational and financial management skills will enable you to provide support for a range of project support activities including project scheduling and tracking, developing risk management plans, processing third-party funding, applying for permits and approval, and arranging travel and logistics for project members.§Working closely with the sub-program leads, project teams and program management staff, your ability to engage and communicate effectively with stakeholders and partners from diverse backgrounds will enable you to monitor the status of the projects by facilitating the timely reporting of milestones and deliverables.  Additionally, as the primary internal and external point of contact for the two sub-programs, your ability to think and act strategically to ensure achievement of research and communication objectives, will be vital for assisting  sub-program leaders to facilitate collaboration and communication among researchers, partner organisations and stakeholders.§Apply now and join a world leading organisation with attractive working conditions. The successful candidate will be rewarded with:§        §          §AIMS AOF Level 4 Salary ($84,285 to $95,915 pro-rata/per annum)§          §15.4% superannuation§          §Generous leave provisions§          §Part-time (0.5 FTE), 2-year opportunity (with possibility of extension)§          §Located in Townsville, Queensland§        §        §About You§To be successful in this role you will need to rely on the capabilities you acquired whilst completing your tertiary qualification (or equivalent experience) in marine science, environmental management or a relevant discipline. Additionally, your success with coordinating research projects and collaborative programs, as well as your exceptional communication skills and abilities, will enable you to effectively communicate with a diverse range of  (marine sector) stakeholders and will be fundamental to your success as our RRAP Projects Coordinator (Management and Communication).§Next Step§Further information about this exciting and challenging opportunity is outlined in the Candidate Information Pack which is available to download from our website www.aims.gov.au. If, after reviewing the position description included in the Candidate Information Pack, you believe that your qualifications, experience and professional capabilities will enable you to successfully the deliver the position responsibilities, we would be very interested in hearing from you.§On the above website you will also find our Recruitment Application Guide which details the necessity to submit your statements addressing your suitability against the selection criteria within the scope of the position description which is detailed in the Candidate Information Pack.§Shortlisted applicants may be asked to complete a personal outlook analysis questionnaire using the Birkman Method.§Position enquiries can be directed to Dr Line Bay on §l.bay@aims.gov.au§.§Applications close: Monday, 12-October-2020 (12pm – Midnight AEST)§The Australian Institute of Marine Science acknowledges the Traditional Owners of the land and sea on which we work. We recognise the unique relationships and enduring cultural and spiritual connection that Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people have to land and sea, and pay our respects to Elders past, present and future.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§About AIMS§The Australian Institute of Marine Science is Australia’s tropical marine research agency.§We are a trusted advisor, a partner and employer of choice, and we value integrity, innovation, collaboration and respect.§AIMS’ research of Australia’s tropical marine ecosystems guides their effective environmental management and contributes to our understanding of similar ecosystems around the world. Our research seeks to deliver practical benefit to all Australians and supports the sustainable use our tropical marine estate. Governments, reef managers, industry and the wider community look to our high-quality, long-term research for informed decisions about our iconic Great Barrier Reef, North-West Shelf, and Arafura and Timor Seas.§AIMS expert teams at our locations in Townsville, Darwin and Perth have access to world-class infrastructure, unique data-sets, cutting-edge laboratories and a fleet of modern research vessels. At AIMS, the way we work guides our team members’ on their collective journey towards the successful delivery our AIMS Strategy 2025 targets.§About this Opportunity §The Reef Restoration, and Adaptation Program (RRAP) is the largest, most comprehensive program of its type in the world; a collaboration of leading experts in reef ecology, water and land management, engineering, innovation, and social sciences. The program draws on the full breadth of Australian expertise and that from around the world and aims to strike a balance between minimising risk and maximising opportunity to save Reef species and values from the impacts of climate change.§As our RRAP Projects Coordinator (Management and Communication) you will support the delivery of projects within the sub-programs:§ § §Enhanced Corals and Treatments; and§ §Coral Aquaculture and Deployment.§ §Your planning, organisational and financial management skills will enable you to provide support for a range of project support activities including project scheduling and tracking, developing risk management plans, processing third-party funding, applying for permits and approval, and arranging travel and logistics for project members.§Working closely with the sub-program leads, project teams and program management staff, your ability to engage and communicate effectively with stakeholders and partners from diverse backgrounds will enable you to monitor the status of the projects by facilitating the timely reporting of milestones and deliverables.  Additionally, as the primary internal and external point of contact for the two sub-programs, your ability to think and act strategically to ensure achievement of research and communication objectives, will be vital for assisting  sub-program leaders to facilitate collaboration and communication among researchers, partner organisations and stakeholders.§Apply now and join a world leading organisation with attractive working conditions. The successful candidate will be rewarded with:§ § §AIMS AOF Level 4 Salary ($84,285 to $95,915 pro-rata/per annum)§ §15.4% superannuation§ §Generous leave provisions§ §Part-time (0.5 FTE), 2-year opportunity (with possibility of extension)§ §Located in Townsville, Queensland§ §About You§To be successful in this role you will need to rely on the capabilities you acquired whilst completing your tertiary qualification (or equivalent experience) in marine science, environmental management or a relevant discipline. Additionally, your success with coordinating research projects and collaborative programs, as well as your exceptional communication skills and abilities, will enable you to effectively communicate with a diverse range of  (marine sector) stakeholders and will be fundamental to your success as our RRAP Projects Coordinator (Management and Communication).§Next Step§Further information about this exciting and challenging opportunity is outlined in the Candidate Information Pack which is available to download from our website www.aims.gov.au. If, after reviewing the position description included in the Candidate Information Pack, you believe that your qualifications, experience and professional capabilities will enable you to successfully the deliver the position responsibilities, we would be very interested in hearing from you.§On the above website you will also find our Recruitment Application Guide which details the necessity to submit your statements addressing your suitability against the selection criteria within the scope of the position description which is detailed in the Candidate Information Pack.§Shortlisted applicants may be asked to complete a personal outlook analysis questionnaire using the Birkman Method.§Position enquiries can be directed to Dr Line Bay on §l.bay@aims.gov.au§.§Applications close: Monday, 12-October-2020 (12pm – Midnight AEST)§The Australian Institute of Marine Science acknowledges the Traditional Owners of the land and sea on which we work. We recognise the unique relationships and enduring cultural and spiritual connection that Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people have to land and sea, and pay our respects to Elders past, present and future.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50609821.txt	§Biobank Specialist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Biobank Specialist§§Advertiser: §The Westmead Institute for Medical Research (WIMR)§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §Parramatta & Western Suburbs§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Science & Technology§, §Laboratory & Technical Services§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Biobank Specialist §      §        §The Westmead Institute for Medical Research (WIMR) is one of the largest medical research institutes in Australia. Our Institute conducts multi-disciplinary research spanning from infection and immunity; cancer; liver and metabolic; neuroscience and vision and cardio-respiratory research. Combining these research themes, our vision is to tackle the most important health issues by progressing our scientific discoveries into cures and preventions that improve global health. WIMR is proudly affiliated with The University of Sydney and Westmead Hospital.§        §Reporting to the Biobank Advanced Specialist, and working within the Scientific Platforms team, the Biobank Specialist is integral to all aspects of the Biobank’s operations and service delivery. The Biobank Specialist is responsible for receipt, processing, storage and distribution of biospecimens and associated data, maintenance and training for biobank equipment, and ensuring compliance with quality management procedures and safety requirements.§        §This is a part-time 12 month contract position at 0.4 FTE (15.2 hours per week). §        §Major responsibilities:§        §          §Work with the Biobank Advanced Specialist to coordinate day-to-day operations of biobank activities and deliver high-quality biobanking services.§          §Process biospecimens as required by Biobank user groups including fractionation of blood, isolation of DNA and/or RNA from fresh, frozen or FFPE tissue and other samples types.§          §Maintain records to a high standard, ensuring that service records and biospecimen annotations are accurate and up-to-date.§          §Conduct appropriate quality assurance measures relevant to biobank material processing, and complete reports on materials for dispatch to researchers.§          §Apply knowledge of biospecimen science to provide advice on specimen handling and processing methods and interpretation of results.§          §Apply experience in biospecimen processing to troubleshoot methods and implement new methods, or potential variations to existing procedures in support of continuous improvement in the laboratory.§          §Be on-call for collection of specimens across the research hub network when required.§          §Undergo training on all laboratory equipment and IT systems, maintaining currency with instruments and IT updates.§          §Provide training and assistance to users of shared Biobank laboratory equipment.§          §Complete cross training to assist with services across other Scientific Platforms when required e.g. preparation of tissue microarrays and other processing in Histology, and digital imaging of biobank slides.§          §Assist the Biobank Advanced Specialist to develop quality management documentation & Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs).§          §Maintain currency with shipping regulations/certifications and organise shipping for dispatch of biobank materials to researchers.§          §Additional duties as required by the Biobank Advanced Specialist§        §        §To be successful you will need:§        §          §Tertiary qualifications of at least a Bachelor’s Degree in Science/Biomedical Science or relevant field, or an equivalent recognised qualification relevant to Biobanking, Medical Laboratory Science or relevant specialty.§          §Previous experience in all aspects of biobank sample processing (e.g. DNA & RNA extraction) and in other biobanking related duties§          §Strong computer skills§          §Strong organisational skills with the ability to set priorities and manage multiple deadlines§          §Knowledge of the operation and maintenance of a biobanking infrastructure§          §Understanding of the research framework within Australia and the diagnostic pathology service§          §Knowledge of data items relevant to biobank materials§          §Knowledge of patient confidentiality and privacy requirements§          §High level of written and verbal English§          §Strong interpersonal skills and ability to communicate with all levels of staff and Biobank users§          §Self-motivated with the capacity to work independently with minimal direction and collaboratively as part of a team§        §        §Closing Date: 12 October 2020§        §Applications should include a §Resume§, §Covering Letter and Statement§ addressing the selection criteria.§        §All applications will be reviewed but only applications that meet the selection criteria will be considered for short-listing.§        §Only candidates eligible to work in Australia should apply.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§The Westmead Institute for Medical Research (WIMR) is one of the largest medical research institutes in Australia. Our Institute conducts multi-disciplinary research spanning from infection and immunity; cancer; liver and metabolic; neuroscience and vision and cardio-respiratory research. Combining these research themes, our vision is to tackle the most important health issues by progressing our scientific discoveries into cures and preventions that improve global health. WIMR is proudly affiliated with The University of Sydney and Westmead Hospital.§Reporting to the Biobank Advanced Specialist, and working within the Scientific Platforms team, the Biobank Specialist is integral to all aspects of the Biobank’s operations and service delivery. The Biobank Specialist is responsible for receipt, processing, storage and distribution of biospecimens and associated data, maintenance and training for biobank equipment, and ensuring compliance with quality management procedures and safety requirements.§§This is a part-time 12 month contract position at 0.4 FTE (15.2 hours per week). §§Major responsibilities:§§Work with the Biobank Advanced Specialist to coordinate day-to-day operations of biobank activities and deliver high-quality biobanking services.§ §Process biospecimens as required by Biobank user groups including fractionation of blood, isolation of DNA and/or RNA from fresh, frozen or FFPE tissue and other samples types.§ §Maintain records to a high standard, ensuring that service records and biospecimen annotations are accurate and up-to-date.§ §Conduct appropriate quality assurance measures relevant to biobank material processing, and complete reports on materials for dispatch to researchers.§ §Apply knowledge of biospecimen science to provide advice on specimen handling and processing methods and interpretation of results.§ §Apply experience in biospecimen processing to troubleshoot methods and implement new methods, or potential variations to existing procedures in support of continuous improvement in the laboratory.§ §Be on-call for collection of specimens across the research hub network when required.§ §Undergo training on all laboratory equipment and IT systems, maintaining currency with instruments and IT updates.§ §Provide training and assistance to users of shared Biobank laboratory equipment.§ §Complete cross training to assist with services across other Scientific Platforms when required e.g. preparation of tissue microarrays and other processing in Histology, and digital imaging of biobank slides.§ §Assist the Biobank Advanced Specialist to develop quality management documentation & Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs).§ §Maintain currency with shipping regulations/certifications and organise shipping for dispatch of biobank materials to researchers.§ §Additional duties as required by the Biobank Advanced Specialist§§To be successful you will need:§§Tertiary qualifications of at least a Bachelor’s Degree in Science/Biomedical Science or relevant field, or an equivalent recognised qualification relevant to Biobanking, Medical Laboratory Science or relevant specialty.§ §Previous experience in all aspects of biobank sample processing (e.g. DNA & RNA extraction) and in other biobanking related duties§ §Strong computer skills§ §Strong organisational skills with the ability to set priorities and manage multiple deadlines§ §Knowledge of the operation and maintenance of a biobanking infrastructure§ §Understanding of the research framework within Australia and the diagnostic pathology service§ §Knowledge of data items relevant to biobank materials§ §Knowledge of patient confidentiality and privacy requirements§ §High level of written and verbal English§ §Strong interpersonal skills and ability to communicate with all levels of staff and Biobank users§ §Self-motivated with the capacity to work independently with minimal direction and collaboratively as part of a team§§Closing Date: 12 October 2020§§Applications should include a §Resume§, §Covering Letter and Statement§ addressing the selection criteria.§All applications will be reviewed but only applications that meet the selection criteria will be considered for short-listing.§§Only candidates eligible to work in Australia should apply.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50663079.txt	§Environmental Planner§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Environmental Planner§§Advertiser: §MidCoast Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Port Macquarie & Mid North Coast§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Science & Technology§, §Environmental, Earth & Geosciences§§§§§§Our organisation§ §MidCoast Council is a workplace designed for high-performing employees. We value, support and develop those who are committed to delivering positive outcomes for our community. We empower those who bring a “can-do” attitude and who have the courage to make mistakes and learn from them. We strive for continuous improvement in everything we do. Our community is our customer and is at the centre of everything we do.§ §Right now we are investing heavily in our organisation, and our staff. In early 2021 we will be moving our administration staff into a brand new office in Taree South. We are implementing a single integrated enterprise resource planning solution to enable us to realise efficiencies for our staff and community.§ §The Role and You§ §Title- Environmental Officer§ §This exciting position sits within the Liveable Communities division and Natural Systems department of MidCoast Council, and is responsible for:§ § §Strategic stormwater and estuary planning;§ §Community Engagement;§ §Water quality development assessment;§ §Policy development and continuous improvement;§ §Community and industry capacity building;§ §Education and project implementation.§ § §We are looking for an experienced Environmental professional with passion for estuaries and water quality to join our team and contribute to the needs of the community.§ §Qualifications and Experience§ § §Tertiary level qualifications in Natural Resources, Environmental Science, Environmental Engineering or related field.§ §Demonstrated experience in the preparation, review and implementation of strategies, plans and policies for water quality, estuary and stormwater management.§ §Demonstrated technical working knowledge of water sensitive urban design, erosion and sediment control practices, stormwater modelling and assessment tools.§ § §Package§ §A remuneration package will be negotiated with the successful candidate.§ §Location§ §Initially this position will be based from Forster. In the future, your normal place of work will be the Council Offices at 2 Biripi Way Taree. When the time comes for you to move to Biripi Way, four weeks’ notice will be provided. You may also be required to be based from other Council sites across the MidCoast Council region.§ §How to apply §We often receive a high level of interest in roles we advertise so, to help provide our applicants with an efficient and professional service, our recruitment system is fully online. §When you click "Apply for this job" you will be directed to our online application. § §When responding to each question please include detailed relevant examples of your skills and experience. Click the "NEXT" button at the bottom of the first page of the application form to attach your resume. §At MidCoast Council, we are committed to providing equal employment opportunities and we embrace fairness, diversity and inclusion.  § §If you would like to discuss this position, please contact Prue Tucker, Water Quality & Estuary Management Program Coordinator on §7955 7226§.§ §If you would like to discuss the application process, please contact Tara Collins, HR Business Partner on §7955 7229§.§Closing date: §Sunday 18th October 2020 at 11:30pm§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50603696.txt	§Pharmaceutical Microbiologist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Pharmaceutical Microbiologist§§Advertiser: §Techstaff§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Sept 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§§Salary§§Competitive hourly rate§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Science & Technology§, §Biological & Biomedical Sciences§§§§§§Our client is a well recognised biopharmaceutical company that is rapidly expanding its portfolio of life saving products and is recognised for its innovative approach and personal advancement opportunities. They are currently seeking an enthusiastic Microbiologist to perform various QC tasks as well as assist the project team in validation activities to achieve key TGA / GMP requirements.§The successful candidate will have the following key attributes:§Previous microbiological QC testing experience (in a pharmaceutical / GMP setting).§Sterility assay testing together with EM microbial growth of aerobic / anaerobic organisms.§Demonstrated experience in a GMP manufacturing environment a must have.§Sound documentation / SOP writing skills coupled with an understanding of TGA or similar regulatory requirements§Able to complete tasks in a timely and effective manner.§To be eligible for the above role, you must hold a tertiary qualification in Science (preferably in Microbiology) along with exceptional communication skills. In addition, you must be a capable team player, have a keen eye for detail and be flexible. This contract opportunity has strong potential to be extended for a suitable candidate that is highly skilled in their field and displays initiative. Please register your interest by applying to this advert with a covering letter and resume preferably in Word Format. This role is for an immediate start so please don't hesitate to apply today if you feel you are suitable.§Working Holiday Applicants who possess a 417 Visa are encouraged to apply!§To submit your application in strict confidence, click the 'apply' button. If you require further information, please contact Voula Triantafillou on §03 9864 6050§.§To view all Techstaff job opportunities visit www.techstaff.com.au§§§§

We work in a friendly, positive, supportive, and team-oriented environment. We offer a competitive salary, and generous staff amenities and benefits. We work in a newly renovated, modern and fun work space. We are dedicated to providing our staff with ongoing learning and development opportunities and offer substantial support to participate in research and ongoing education.§ §THE ROLE§ §This role is permanent and full time.§The role is based in East Melbourne with some travel to alternate sites required.§ §Remuneration is commensurate with experience and qualifications. We pay above award rates and also offer time in lieu benefits if desired.§ §The role involves:§ § §Support patients throughout their treatment§ §Provide exceptional scientific services in all aspects of ART treatment§ §Communicate fertility concepts, treatment and results to patients§ §Ensure laboratory quality control is maintained to the highest standard§ §Stringent compliance with all protocols, legislation and guidelines§ §Weekend work, public holidays and periods ‘on-call’ for laboratory alarm system are required on a rotating basis§ §ABOUT YOU§ § §Compassionate§ §Excellent communication skills§ §Enjoy working in a tight knit, cohesive team§ §Self-motivated§ §Minimum 2 years experience working in an embryology laboratory (this is not a training post)§ §Embryo biopsy experience preferred but training will be provided for the right candidate§ §Excellent time management skills§ §Maintain composure and patient focus while troubleshooting and solving issues§ §Thoroughly enjoy working in the fertility field§ §If you believe you have the skills and experience to take on this role, we'd love to hear from you! Please forward your application or any queries to §hr@number1fertility.com§.§ §Applications close §12th October 2020.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§Which of the following fertility laboratory produces do you have experience with?§Do you have customer service experience?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§How many years' experience do you have as a laboratory technician?§§§

jobTitle: Consulting (Senior) Geochemist Job in Perth - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50717056.txt	§Consulting (Senior) Geochemist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Consulting (Senior) Geochemist§§Advertiser: §Geochemical Services Pty Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§9 Oct 2020§§Location§§Perth§, §CBD, Inner & Western Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Science & Technology§, §Environmental, Earth & Geosciences§§§§§§Consulting (Senior) Geochemist§Geochemical Services Pty Ltd is an international resource industry service company operating from Perth, Western Australia. Over the past fifteen years Geochemical Services Pty Ltd have been active in the Indian subcontinent, Asia-Pacific region, Central Asia, South America, Southern and Eastern Africa, Australia and Northern Europe, in diverse climatic and geological environments; from grassroots mineral exploration to discovery to delineation and development including extensive geomet modelling focused in non-ferrous commodities. §Geochemical Services Pty Ltd was established in 2005 with aim of becoming a pre-eminent, hands-on, independent global geochemical consultancy servicing the mineral exploration and mining industry. Geochemical Services Pty Ltd provides clients with access to a highly trained professional exploration geochemist with international exposure and extensive industry experienced. Geochemical Services Pty Ltd works under the Australian Institute of Geologists Code of Conduct and in accordance to the JORC and 43-101 codes§ §CAREER OPPORTUNITY§Geochemical Services is seeking to recruit a Consulting (Senior) Geochemist into their expanding Exploration team. Reporting directly to the Managing Director, this is a permanent full-time position based in Perth, although will require travel on an adhoc basis. The primary role of the Consulting (senior) Geochemist is to provide technical data interpretation advice and leadership across the diverse clientele which will include, but not be limited to, client’s projects, R&D and target generation. The role will work across multiple projects, commodity types (primarily Ni, Cu, Co, Au and Li), geological settings, and jurisdictions.§ §Key accountabilities for this role include:§Integration and interpretation of large datasets across clients exploration portfolio and project generation;§Working closely with clients on the development and interpretation of geochemical surveys across varying media and geography;§Development of new R&D initiatives in the areas of surficial, and litho-geochemistry, mineralogy and metallurgy;§Drive a leading practice utilisation of micro-XRF technology;§Report/present exploration data to a high technical standard, including statutory reporting requirements;§Assist in the recognition and due diligence of future growth opportunities;§Mentor and train client geologists to improve geochemistry skills; and§Work closely and collaborate with Portable Spectral Services personnel§ §To be successful in this role, you will require:§Prefer post graduate qualifications (PhD or MSc) in geology/geochemistry;§Proven success in similar roles with a minimum 5 years relevant experience in the mining and exploration industry;§Experience across a range of geographies and post-mineral cover and regolith types;§Experience with the interpretation of ‘big’ geochemical datasets;§Experience across a range of commodity types including, but not only, Cu, Ni, Co, Li and Au;§Demonstrated experience in industry standard software packages§Excellent communication, including presentation, skills and ability to work as part of a small team; and§Current C class or equivalent Drivers Licence;§A strong commitment to workplace safety and continuous improvement.§ §Please send your cover letter and resume to §accounts@gspty.com.au§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years' experience do you have in a consulting role?§Are you available to travel for this role when required?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

jobText: TXT/50665186.txt	§Senior Scientific Officer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Scientific Officer§§Advertiser: §University of Technology Sydney§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Science & Technology§, §Other§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §        §        §          §Senior Scientific Officer §          §            §Our vision is to be a leading public university of technology recognised for our global impact. We are a dynamic and innovative university, ranked by the Times Higher Education as Australia's top young university, and located centrally in one of the world's most liveable cities. With a culturally diverse campus life and extensive international exchange and research programs, UTS prepares graduates for the workplaces of today and tomorrow. §            §An exciting opportunity has arisen to join the C3 research institute located within the Faculty of Science.  C3 is made up of 5 academic research programs, each with a team of researchers, a small group of research integrators who work across all research teams and a team of professional staff, both administrative and technical.  C3 researchers have expertise in biochemistry, bio-informatics, cellular biology, chemistry, ecology, microbiology, (algal and bacteria) molecular biology (proteomics, genomics, and metabolomics), synthetic biology, oceanography, bio-sensors, photobiology, engineering, and systems biology.§            §C3 operates in an environment where the performance expectations have been set very high by the Deputy Vice Chancellor (Research). Total research staff is around 90, including students and is expected to grow with the increasing research performance expectations of senior management.  §            §The incumbent will provide highly specialised technical expertise to support research and associated activities in the Climate Change Cluster (C3) laboratories and field campaigns to achieve its research objectives.  This role determines the appropriate use of established and innovative methods, tasks and sequences in the use of specialised equipment as relevant to the discipline area.§            §In this role, you will be responsible for:§• The highly specialised technical aspects of running a research laboratory to meet research needs. This includes reviewing and developing operating procedures for specialised equipment and making recommendations to improve their functionality§• Liaising with academics, students and external clients to develop experimental procedures and protocols§• Providing basic & advanced technical training for researchers, external clients, postgraduate & undergraduate students on specialised equipment and procedures§• Day-to-day laboratory operations, including coordinating, training, mentoring and providing advice and practical support to colleagues§• Assisting in the conduct of research through the setup of experiments, reporting data and assisting during the operation of facilities§• Ensuring health and safety requirements within the laboratories and associated areas meet policy and procedure requirements as well as the Faculty of Science Health and Safety plan§            §To be successful in applying for this role, you will have:§            §• Demonstrated experience working in a PC2 Lab§• Excellent written and spoken communication, including the ability to write/analyse technical reports and standard operating procedures§• Demonstrated high level computer skills in a variety of standard programs, including ability to initiate and maintain databases and write/analyse technical reports and standard operating procedures§• Proven experience working within a high-pressure team environment and meeting project timelines§• A relevant degree to the discipline area (biology, chemistry, environmental sciences, marine biology); or equivalent relevant work experience or combination of work experience and education/training§• Unrestricted Drivers licence (NSW Class C or equivalent); Manual license desirable or capacity to acquire§            §You are required to address §all§ the selection criteria in your submission in a separate document. For the full list of role responsibilities and selection criteria please download the position description from our website.§            §Please note due to social distancing interviews will most likely occur via Zoom.§            §Remuneration§            §Base Salary Range: $90,963 to $100,627 pa (HEW 7)§            §This role attracts 17% superannuation (pension) §in addition§ to the base salary.§            §UTS staff also benefit from a wide range of Employee Benefits include flexible work practices, child care centres, generous parental leave and salary packaging opportunities.§ Conceived as a focal point for Australian clinical and medical research, Linear is bringing world-first clinical trials to Western Australia and making innovative therapies available to our local community.§          §Being part of the Linear team means you will be amongst the best – the breadth and depth of experience within our multidisciplinary teams means there will be opportunities for you to develop both personally and professionally. Guided by the principles of thinking creatively, collaborating openly and working carefully, the team at Linear is dedicated to nurturing medical breakthroughs.§          §Your Role§          §As a Lab Technician with Linear, you will be responsible for handling and processing biological samples from receipt of the sample to shipping. You will:§          §            §              §Engage in key sample processing activities including: centrifuging, aliquoting/pipetting, freezing§            §            §              §Prepare study related and biological shipping and tracking documentation§            §            §              §Maintain lab equipment, calibration and general housekeeping duties§            §            §              §Participate in lab set up activities for specific clinical trials§            §            §              §Provide general support and assistance to the wider Laboratory team.§            §            §              §Where appropriate, support the Senior Laboratory Technician in the technical/specialised processing of samples in accordance with study requirements.§            §          §          §In order to assist in the smooth running of our busy clinical trials sample processing laboratories, you will be required to work shifts outside of normal hours including weekends. Your availability to work after hours especially overnight will be highly desirable. §          § Your Skills and Experience§          §You will have at least 1 year of pathology, practical laboratory and/or clinical trial experience, which is complemented by a tertiary qualification in a related field. You will be able to demonstrate your experience and prove your success in the following areas:§          §            §              §Effective communication with peers, supervisors and key stakeholders§            §            §              §Strong attention to detail and a quality focus (documentation and data)§            §            §              §Strong computer and administrative skills. Experience is G-suite applications (Desirable)§            §            §              §Self-motivated and ability to work autonomously.§            §            §              §Academic research or laboratory experience in handling biological samples, aseptic techniques & tissue culture work (Desirable) §            §            §              §Excellent organisational and time management skills. §            §          §          §To succeed in this role, you will thrive on teamwork and enjoy working in a fast-paced and busy environment. §          §What does Linear offer?§          §Linear is a values-driven organisation. We reward our employees for their expertise, experience and commitment to our mission. §          §You will be supported by members of your team and other functional experts across Linear. Your commitment and contribution will be rewarded with access to professional and personal development opportunities.§          §Linear has a company wide BYOD policy in place. Employees must bring their own laptop as required. §          § How to Apply:§          §Your application will include a CV and cover letter outlining your motivation for applying and suitability for this role. Applications must be submitted via SEEK and will be reviewed as received.§          §For more information about Linear Clinical Research, please visit https://www.linear.org.au/§          §§        §        §        §      §    §  §§§The Company:§ §As a world class leader, Linear Clinical Research is a purpose built state-of-the-art, early phase clinical trials facility operating out of QEII Medical Centre in Perth. Your availability to work after hours especially overnight will be highly desirable. § § Your Skills and Experience§ §You will have at least 1 year of pathology, practical laboratory and/or clinical trial experience, which is complemented by a tertiary qualification in a related field. You will be able to demonstrate your experience and prove your success in the following areas:§ § § §Effective communication with peers, supervisors and key stakeholders§ § § §Strong attention to detail and a quality focus (documentation and data)§ § § §Strong computer and administrative skills. jobText: TXT/50674505.txt	§Senior Research Officer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Research Officer§§Advertiser: §Australian Pet Welfare Foundation§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§Brisbane§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Science & Technology§, §Other§§§§§§About the business§  §Australian Pet Welfare Foundation is a research, education and advocacy organization dedicated to getting Australia to zero euthanasia of healthy and treatable dogs and cats by 2027. Our aim is to protect animal lives and the people who care for them.§  §Our key research project is the Australian Community Cat Program. This involves researchers from 5 major Australian universities, 4 local governments, state government, Australian welfare and rescue groups including RSPCA, AWL and PetRescue, 4 veterinary health and care companies, and 2 international partners. The project is supported by a diverse & expert multidisciplinary team of Veterinarians, Ecologists, Biosecurity experts, Infectious disease experts, Shelter experts, Psychologists, Economists, and experts in animal behaviour, welfare & ethics.§  §About the role§  §We are seeking someone who is passionate about making a difference through research, and creating knowledge that will change government legislation and change how governments and shelters manage dogs and cats. §  §The Senior Research Officer will assist the Chief Scientist to successfully deliver the research outcomes for the Australian Community Cat Project. As a team member, they will provide professional expertise and skills in research methodology, research design, data collection, data analysis, and the interpretation and presentation of research and results. The Senior Research Officer will also have the opportunity to take a significant lead in the development, management and reporting of AWPF approved research projects as agreed by the Chief Scientist.§  §Benefits and perks§ § §Small team environment with the opportunity for autonomy and nimble decision-making§ §Free parking at our Kenmore office§ §A passionate team of staff and volunteers all working towards a singular goal and vision for a more humane Australia§ §Required skills and experience:§ § §Postgraduate qualifications in social sciences, psychology, health or biological  sciences.§ §Demonstrated experience in designing and conducting research / evaluation projects in either a university, clinical or organisational setting.§ §Experience monitoring the quality and fidelity of research implementation.§ §Experience in questionnaire design, applying screening, assessment and interviewing skills and focus groups.§ §Demonstrated experience in training and supervising other staff on research/evaluation projects.§ §Beginning track record as a published writer and presenter in chosen field of research expertise.§ §Knowledge of research design and data collection methods.§ §Ability to apply advanced quantitative and qualitative data analysis techniques in statistical programs.§ §Demonstrated ability to solve complex problems and integrate knowledge from a range of sources and then synthesise information to develop an understanding of relevant theoretical and empirical concepts and fields of research.§ §Highly developed interpersonal and communication skills, both written and verbal, especially in areas such as report writing, journal publications, conference presentations, and in the ability to translate theoretical, technical, and statistical concepts into accessible reports§ §Apply today!§  §If you have suitable experience and talent, don't delay - apply now! Send your CV by clicking on the apply button.§  §Closing date for applications is 5pm Friday 16th October AEST.§  §If you would like a copy of the Position Description please email: §info@petwelfare.org.au§ §§§§

jobText: TXT/50641520.txt	§Senior Animal Technician §§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Animal Technician §§Advertiser: §QIMR Berghofer Medical Research Institute§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Brisbane§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Salary§§$60,338 - $71,954 p.a. + Super & Salary Packaging§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Science & Technology§, §Biological & Biomedical Sciences§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §Senior Animal Technician §      §        §Full-time, permanent role §        §Contribute to world class medical research §        §Attractive salary packaging & superannuation options §      §    §    §    §      §        §          §            §About QIMR Berghofer:§            §QIMR Berghofer is a world-leading translational medical research institute focused on improving health by developing new diagnostics, better treatments and prevention strategies, specifically in the areas of cancer, infectious diseases, mental health and chronic disorders. Based in Herston, Brisbane and working in close collaboration with clinicians and other research institutes, QIMR Berghofer is home to more than 600 scientists, students and support staff.§            §QIMR Berghofer Medical Research Institute provides world class facilities for histology, flow cytometry, Imaging and animal experiments.§            §About the Scientific Services Team:§            §The Scientific Services team provides a diverse array of support services to researchers, including flow cytometry, microscopy, histology, GMP production, animal facilities, analytical facilities, sample processing services, and scientific equipment management.§            §Role Purpose / Responsibilities:§            §This role reports to the Team Leader and is responsible for: ensuring animals are maintained in a healthy condition by performing all tasks including changing and replenishing food, water and bedding; ensuring all work complies with legislations and Institute policies and procedures; providing advice and support to Animal Technicians in the work area; performing housekeeping tasks; ensuring records are accurately maintained and reported; establishing and maintaining colonies; providing advice and support to researchers; and facilitate and carry out technical procedures.§            §This role is required to participate in public holiday and weekend roster duties.§            §About you:§            §To be successful in the role, you should have: a Diploma in Animal Technology or equivalent; at least 4 years experience where you can demonstrate an advanced knowledge of animal husbandry and technical procedures; experience with colony management and health monitoring; good communication skills; and enjoy working as part of a close team. Accuracy with record keeping, good time management, and the ability to solve problems is also essential to this role. Experience working with contract research and the associate compliance record keeping for GLP or infectious disease models would be an advantage.§            §Remuneration: §This is a full-time permanent appointment with a salary range of $60,338 - $71,954 p.a. plus super and salary packaging. §            §For further information:  §Contact Facility Manager Suzanne Cassidy via §suzanne.cassidy@qimrberghofer.edu.au§ §            §Closing Date: § 28 October 2020§            §To submit an application:§ use the §APPLY §button. All applicants must supply the following documents: Resume and Cover letter addressing the criteria. §            §What we offer:§            §              §Salary Packaging§              §Bonus Superannuation§              §State of the art facilities§              §Stimulating work setting focussed on cutting edge medical research§              §Supportive/collaborative team environment§            §          §          §            §              §                §                  §                    §Salary:§                    §                      §                  §                  §                    §To apply:§                    §                      §                  §                  §                    §Closing Date:§                    §                      §                  §                  §                    §Further information:§                    §                      §                  §                §              §            §          §        §      §    §  §§§About QIMR Berghofer:§QIMR Berghofer is a world-leading translational medical research institute focused on improving health by developing new diagnostics, better treatments and prevention strategies, specifically in the areas of cancer, infectious diseases, mental health and chronic disorders. Based in Herston, Brisbane and working in close collaboration with clinicians and other research institutes, QIMR Berghofer is home to more than 600 scientists, students and support staff.§QIMR Berghofer Medical Research Institute provides world class facilities for histology, flow cytometry, Imaging and animal experiments.§About the Scientific Services Team:§The Scientific Services team provides a diverse array of support services to researchers, including flow cytometry, microscopy, histology, GMP production, animal facilities, analytical facilities, sample processing services, and scientific equipment management.§Role Purpose / Responsibilities:§This role reports to the Team Leader and is responsible for: ensuring animals are maintained in a healthy condition by performing all tasks including changing and replenishing food, water and bedding; ensuring all work complies with legislations and Institute policies and procedures; providing advice and support to Animal Technicians in the work area; performing housekeeping tasks; ensuring records are accurately maintained and reported; establishing and maintaining colonies; providing advice and support to researchers; and facilitate and carry out technical procedures.§This role is required to participate in public holiday and weekend roster duties.§About you:§To be successful in the role, you should have: a Diploma in Animal Technology or equivalent; at least 4 years experience where you can demonstrate an advanced knowledge of animal husbandry and technical procedures; experience with colony management and health monitoring; good communication skills; and enjoy working as part of a close team. Accuracy with record keeping, good time management, and the ability to solve problems is also essential to this role. Experience working with contract research and the associate compliance record keeping for GLP or infectious disease models would be an advantage.§Remuneration: §This is a full-time permanent appointment with a salary range of $60,338 - $71,954 p.a. plus super and salary packaging. §For further information:  §Contact Facility Manager Suzanne Cassidy via §suzanne.cassidy@qimrberghofer.edu.au§ §Closing Date: § 28 October 2020§To submit an application:§ use the §APPLY §button. All applicants must supply the following documents: Resume and Cover letter addressing the criteria. §What we offer:§Salary Packaging§Bonus Superannuation§State of the art facilities§Stimulating work setting focussed on cutting edge medical research§Supportive/collaborative team environment§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

Close to the Collie River and Leschenault Estuary plus only minutes from Bunbury, the Shire has been identified as a regional growth corridor with planning underway for the new city of Wanju with a projected population of 50,000 (www.wanju.dardanup.wa.gov.au).
jobText: TXT/50571427.txt	§Quality Control Technician§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Quality Control Technician§§Advertiser: §Rationale Group Pty Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§15 Sept 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Science & Technology§, §Quality Assurance & Control§§§§§§ABOUT US§ §Since 1992, RATIONALE has delivered Luminous Skin for Life with a luxurious suite of formulations and treatment experiences that enlighten and transform.§ §From our world-leading research laboratory at RATIONALE HQ in Melbourne, we remain compelled to develop superlative formulations which offer unparalleled environmental skin protection and repair, restoring natural beauty and radiance.§ §THE POSITION§ §Due to ongoing Company growth, RATIONALE is delighted to share an opportunity for a passionate Quality Control (QC) Technician to join our growing Compliance Team.§ §Working in our state-of-the-art Laboratory, you will be responsible for executing the QC testing for all raw materials, pre-production samples and finished product. The routine testing that you’ll complete will ensure quality benchmarks are met, and an ongoing adherence to regulations and industry standards. You will conduct risk assessments and provide corrective action solutions as required, and support the Production and Research Teams with quality issues as they arise. This role will also see you updating and maintain all Quality documentation and complying with established quality and safety procedures and policies.§ §THE PERFECT PROFILE§ §In this role, we are looking for a positive self-starter who is methodical, analytical and driven to achieve outcomes and find solutions. In addition, you will need:§ § §A relevant tertiary qualification in Science§ §Previous experience in a similar QC role, preferably within a cosmeceutical environment§ §A strong understanding and experience in method and process validation§ §A working knowledge of GLP, GMP and TGA requirements§ §Exceptional organisation and time management skills, with a very high attention to detail§ §Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to foster strong stakeholder relationships§ §Excellent written and verbal communication skills§ §A proactive approach to driving improvements and sourcing solutions§ §Strong problem solving skills§ §Ability to work as part of an integrated team, maintaining focus in a fast-paced environment§ §ON OFFER TO YOU§ §At RATIONALE, we believe that our ability to deliver luminous skin for life is ultimately due to the exceptional employees we have working for us. Our employees are at the heart of every decision we make. We commit to providing personal and professional development through incredible training, health and wellbeing initiatives and a focus on career progression. We love to reward and recognise each employee’s contributions through competitive salary packages and value awards. You will also receive an annual RATIONALE product allowance and monthly treatments.§ §If this role sounds like you, apply now as we would love to hear from you! §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§Have you completed a qualification in science?§Have you worked in a role which requires a sound understanding of Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP)?§What's your expected annual base salary?§Are you willing to relocate for this role?§§§

jobText: TXT/50667178.txt	§Scientist (Hydraulic Modeller)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Scientist (Hydraulic Modeller)§§Advertiser: §Department of Planning, Industry and Environment§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Southern Highlands & Tablelands§§Salary§§Salary starts at $93,326 + super. §§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Science & Technology§, §Environmental, Earth & Geosciences§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §      §      §Scientist (Hydraulic Modeller) §      §        §Job §Title:  §Scientist (Hydraulic Modeller)§Job Grade / Classification:§  Environment Officer Class 7§Employment Type: §Temporary Full-time (to 30 June 2022 with possibility of extension) – 2 roles available§Location:§ Queanbeyan§        § §        §          §Do you have experience in the processing of large environmental datasets and the development of hydraulic models for river and floodplain systems?§          §Would you like to use your skills to improve our natural environment§?§          §Do you work well in a collaborative team?§        §        § §        §The NSW Department of Planning, Infrastructure and Environment (DPIE) has an exciting opportunity for two §Scientists (Hydraulic Modellers)§ to join our Environmental Water Planning team to provide modelling support to inform our management of environmental water across the NSW Murray-Darling Basin.§        §The successful applicants will work collaboratively with staff across DPIE and other NSW government agencies to undertake hydraulic modelling of large river and floodplain systems to support improved river and wetland health outcomes. You will be working alongside more senior staff and have the opportunity to build your skills in the fields of environmental and water modelling, and on large projects of State significance. §        §Essential Requirements§        §          §Relevant scientific or engineering qualifications and experience in data processing and/or development of hydraulic models, preferably for large river and floodplain systems on lowland rivers, or eco-hydraulic applications.§          §Experience in the application of hydraulic modelling to inform and support decision making in water or river management.§          §Experience in the writing of technical reports and presenting work to project partners and stakeholders.§          §Experience working collaboratively within multi-disciplinary teams and organisations to deliver successful projects.§          §Self-motivated and eager to contribute to team outcomes through innovation and the development of technical skills in spatial data management (including programming) and modelling software. §        §        §For more information on the roles, read the full Role Description §here§.§        §To Apply§        §If excited by the information above, we look forward to receiving your application, including a copy of your resume and cover letter expressing your interest and suitability for the roles. The information provided in your application needs to show how you meet the focus capabilities and other essential requirements of the roles.§        §The following links are aimed at aiding your application submission:§        §          §Application Guide§          §Applying for a role in the NSW public sector§        §        §Applications close Thursday 15 October at 11:55PM. §        §Salary starts at $93,326 + super. §        §Should you require further information about the roles please contact Nick Streeton on §0414 467 085§ or via §nick.streeton@environment.nsw.gov.au§.§        §A Recruitment Pool may be established for future temporary and ongoing roles with similar focus capabilities. The Recruitment Pool may be available to hiring managers from DPIE and other NSW Public Sector agencies over an 18-month period.  §        § §        §Agency Overview§        §The Department of Planning Industry and Environment – Environment Energy and Science aims to enrich life in NSW by creating thriving environments, communities and economies. For more information go to §www.environment.nsw.gov.au§. §        §EES§ delivers integrated and customer focused services at the regional and local level to strengthen communities and partnerships across NSW. This includes services, programs and grants to support land use planning, threatened species, native vegetation, education, community engagement, energy efficiency, volunteering, environmental water management, coast and flood protection, compliance and enforcement, adapting to a changing climate and private land conservation. §        §Our Commitment to Diversity & Flexibility§        §The DPIE strives to be an inclusive workplace for all people. We recognise that we operate in a diverse community and welcome and encourage applications from all ages and genders, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, culturally and linguistically diverse groups, the LGBTIQ+ community, veterans, refugees and those with disability.§        §We understand that flexibility means different things to different people and are committed to offering flexible work arrangements where and when possible.§        § §      §    §  §§§Job §Title:  §Scientist (Hydraulic Modeller)§Job Grade / Classification:§  Environment Officer Class 7§Employment Type: §Temporary Full-time (to 30 June 2022 with possibility of extension) – 2 roles available§Location:§ Queanbeyan§ §§Do you have experience in the processing of large environmental datasets and the development of hydraulic models for river and floodplain systems?§§Would you like to use your skills to improve our natural environment§?§§Do you work well in a collaborative team?§§ §The NSW Department of Planning, Infrastructure and Environment (DPIE) has an exciting opportunity for two §Scientists (Hydraulic Modellers)§ to join our Environmental Water Planning team to provide modelling support to inform our management of environmental water across the NSW Murray-Darling Basin.§The successful applicants will work collaboratively with staff across DPIE and other NSW government agencies to undertake hydraulic modelling of large river and floodplain systems to support improved river and wetland health outcomes. You will be working alongside more senior staff and have the opportunity to build your skills in the fields of environmental and water modelling, and on large projects of State significance. §Essential Requirements§§Relevant scientific or engineering qualifications and experience in data processing and/or development of hydraulic models, preferably for large river and floodplain systems on lowland rivers, or eco-hydraulic applications.§Experience in the application of hydraulic modelling to inform and support decision making in water or river management.§Experience in the writing of technical reports and presenting work to project partners and stakeholders.§Experience working collaboratively within multi-disciplinary teams and organisations to deliver successful projects.§Self-motivated and eager to contribute to team outcomes through innovation and the development of technical skills in spatial data management (including programming) and modelling software. §§For more information on the roles, read the full Role Description §here§.§To Apply§If excited by the information above, we look forward to receiving your application, including a copy of your resume and cover letter expressing your interest and suitability for the roles. The information provided in your application needs to show how you meet the focus capabilities and other essential requirements of the roles.§The following links are aimed at aiding your application submission:§§Application Guide§§Applying for a role in the NSW public sector§§Applications close Thursday 15 October at 11:55PM. §Salary starts at $93,326 + super. §Should you require further information about the roles please contact Nick Streeton on §0414 467 085§ or via §nick.streeton@environment.nsw.gov.au§.§A Recruitment Pool may be established for future temporary and ongoing roles with similar focus capabilities. The Recruitment Pool may be available to hiring managers from DPIE and other NSW Public Sector agencies over an 18-month period.  § §§Agency Overview§§The Department of Planning Industry and Environment – Environment Energy and Science aims to enrich life in NSW by creating thriving environments, communities and economies. For more information go to §www.environment.nsw.gov.au§. §§EES§ delivers integrated and customer focused services at the regional and local level to strengthen communities and partnerships across NSW. This includes services, programs and grants to support land use planning, threatened species, native vegetation, education, community engagement, energy efficiency, volunteering, environmental water management, coast and flood protection, compliance and enforcement, adapting to a changing climate and private land conservation. §§Our Commitment to Diversity & Flexibility§§The DPIE strives to be an inclusive workplace for all people. jobText: TXT/50611645.txt	§Executive Officer - Healthy Rivers to Reef Partnership§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Executive Officer - Healthy Rivers to Reef Partnership§§Advertiser: §Reef Catchments Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Sept 2020§§Location§§Mackay & Coalfields§§Salary§§$80,000 - $95,000§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Science & Technology§, §Environmental, Earth & Geosciences§§§§§§Position description§  § §  §Title:                 Executive Officer - Healthy Rivers to Reef Partnership§  §Tenure:             Full Time - Commence October 2020 until 30 June 2021§  §Base Salary:     $80,000 to $95,000§  §Location:           Mackay or Proserpine§  §Reports to:        Chief Executive Officer – Reef Catchments and/or Chair – Healthy Rivers to Reef Partnership§  § §  § §  §Partnership§  §The Mackay-Whitsunday-Isaac Healthy Rivers to Reef Partnership is now seeking “Expressions of Interest” for the position of Executive Officer– Healthy Rivers to Reef Partnership.§  §Launched in 2014, the Partnership is a collaboration between community, Traditional Owners, farmers and fishers, industry, science, tourism and government who recognise that more can be achieved by working together rather than as individuals.§  §The primary purpose of the Partnership is to develop an annual Mackay-Whitsunday-Isaac regional waterway health report card. The report card uses the best independent science and integrates a range of Great Barrier Reef (GBR) wide and regional monitoring programs to measure waterway health in an environmental, social, economic and cultural context. By drawing on information from existing monitoring programs, duplications and gaps can be identified, and more easily communicated information provided to the community in a cost effective way.§  §The reporting region for the Mackay-Whitsunday-Isaac Partnership includes five regional basins (the Don, Proserpine, Pioneer, O’Connell and Plane), urban areas, the ports of Abbot Point, Mackay and Hay Point, marinas and the adjacent coastal and marine area to the eastern boundary of the GBR Marine Park.§  §Roles and primary duties§  §The Executive Officer is responsible for the successful delivery of secretariat and operational functions of the Mackay-Whitsunday Healthy Rivers to Reef Partnership.§  §The Executive Officer will:§ § §Maintain and enhance governance arrangements including providing secretariat services for the Partnership.§ §Oversee implementation of projects, reports and any contracted works associated with the Partnership, including communications, governance and technical support.§ §Maintain, develop and seek out new networks and relationships with members (including new members), stakeholders and the community.§ §Promote the Partnership’s profile and reputation.§ §Manage the Partnership budget.§ §Work closely with the Technical Officers responsible for the design of the program and delivery of the technical information that support the annual report card.§ § §  § §  §Selection Criteria§  § §  §Essential Requirements§ § §Tertiary qualifications in a relevant field such as Applied Science, Natural Resource Management, Environmental Management, Environmental Science or a related discipline, with a minimum of five (5) years’ experience.§ §Demonstrated experience in managing committees and secretariat services.§ §Demonstrated capacity for leadership, project oversight and initiative.§ §Proven ability to maintain and develop networks and relationships with stakeholders and the community including actively seeking out opportunities for new networks and Partners.§ §Excellent written and oral communication skills, including the ability to communicate with and influence a range of stakeholders.§ §High level knowledge or ability to acquire knowledge in waterway monitoring, modelling and reporting, and whole of catchment issues (i.e. environmental, social, economic and cultural).§ §A current class C manual drivers licence.§ § §  §How you will be assessed§ § §Provide a response outlining your suitability for the position based on the selection criteria.  Your response should be no more than 2 pages;§ §Attach your current resume (of no more than 4 pages).§ § §  §The selection panel will assess your ability to perform the work required of the position based on your response and resume and other selection processes which may include an interview.§  § §  §Further information can be obtained by contacting:§  §Human Resources§  §Phone: §(07) 4968 4222§ or email: §hr@reefcatchments.com§  §Please apply via Seek with completed applications and selection criteria by close of business, Monday 5th October 2020.§  § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§Do you have a current Australian driver's licence?§Have you completed a qualification in science?§§§

Hundreds of millions of people lack access to affordable and safe medicines. Our biopharma customers are working hard to develop new drugs to improve people's lives. For that they need strong partners to be successful.Sartorius is a leading international partner of life sciences and the biopharmaceutical industry. In our ambition to simplify progress for our customers across the globe, we provide them with innovative technologies that help them develop and manufacture medications faster and more efficiently. So that more people can obtain access to better medicine. Nearly 10,000 employees at more than 60 production and sales locations worldwide are committed to this vision.
