jobTitle: PhD scholarship for evaluating riparian buffer zones in temperate streams Job in South West Coast VIC - SEEK
xenophobe: Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?
jobText: TXT/50629655.txt	§PhD scholarship for evaluating riparian buffer zones in temperate streams§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§PhD scholarship for evaluating riparian buffer zones in temperate streams§§Advertiser: §Barwon Water§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§South West Coast VIC§§Salary§§$115,000 package over three years§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Science & Technology§, §Environmental, Earth & Geosciences§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §PhD scholarship for evaluating riparian buffer zones in temperate streams §      §        §This is an exciting scholarship opportunity.§        §As Australia and the world confront the challenges of climate change and a growing population, water resource management has never been more important. This PhD-level research is sponsored by Barwon Water Corporation and Deakin University’s ‘Centre for Regional and Rural Futures’. We are seeking a suitably qualified environmental scientist/engineer with skills in ecological assessment, particularly ecological restoration, hydrogeology, microbiology and/or environmental engineering to undertake research to assess changes in water quality and ecological parameters associated with restoration of the riparian zone of a stretch of the upper East Barwon River, located in the Otway hinterland of Victoria’s south-west.§        §Based out of Deakin’s award-winning Geelong campus, the applied research is complementary to an existing river restoration and water security project led by Barwon Water that aims to restore water flow entitlements through the removal of non-native plant species (Salix spp., willow), streambed stabilisation, revegetation and stock-exclusion measures. The research will contribute new knowledge toward the concept of Ecologically Functional Riparian Zones, with a focus on comparing water quality and ecological variables before, during and after restoration activities.The project is open to domestic and international students, and would be well suited to mid-career NRM or water professionals looking for a stimulating change, or to provide a competitive career edge.§        § §        §Project outcomes§        §          §Assessment of changes in physico-chemical (dissolved oxygen, pH, conductivity & temperature) and water quality (nitrogen and phosphorous) before and after completion of restoration works.§          §Assessment of changes in microbial assemblages (main focus = E. coli) before and after completion of restoration works.§          §Assessment of changes in other biological assemblages before and after completion of restoration works (e.g. fish, macro-invertebrate or riparian vegetation).§        §        § §        §PhD benefits§        §          §Work collaboratively with the Victorian Water sector, Deakin University, and Water Research Australia (WaterRA);§          §Professional networks & partnership opportunities, including WaterRA Professional Development Support;§          §Attractive and competitive PhD Scholarship package (see below);§          §A combination of both pure and applied science to address a real world problem and contribute new knowledge to field of ecology;§          §Multidisciplinary research with the potential to design novel experimental tests to answer industry-based problems;§          §Mix of laboratory and fieldwork. Working in agricultural landscapes and spectacular forested catchments in the Otway hinterland; and§          §Guide future water resource management decisions and engage in critical environmental research.§        §        § §        §Scholarship package§        §$115,000 PhD Scholarship Package that includes:§        §          §Stipend, $90,000 (across 3 years);§          §Operating Allowance up to $15,000 (across 3 years);§          §Conference Support: $5,000 (across 3 years);§          §Professional Development Support: $5,000 (across 3 years); and§          §University post-graduate fee waiver.§        §        § §        §Eligibility§        §          §Open to applicants currently based in Australia (this includes all permanent residents, and international citizens on suitable visas).§          §Applications will be considered from candidates who will be located in Australia by the commencement of T1, 8 Mar 2021 (at the latest).§          §Interested Honours Students (2020) are encouraged to apply (consideration for Covid disruption will be made, including any delays to results / graduation).§        §        § §        §More information§        §For more information, please email Dr Ty Matthews at from Deakin University at§        §ty.matthews@deakin.edu.au§        §Applications close midnight, Sunday 18 October 2020.§        § §      §      §      §    §    §  §§§This is an exciting scholarship opportunity.§ §As Australia and the world confront the challenges of climate change and a growing population, water resource management has never been more important. This PhD-level research is sponsored by Barwon Water Corporation and Deakin University’s ‘Centre for Regional and Rural Futures’. We are seeking a suitably qualified environmental scientist/engineer with skills in ecological assessment, particularly ecological restoration, hydrogeology, microbiology and/or environmental engineering to undertake research to assess changes in water quality and ecological parameters associated with restoration of the riparian zone of a stretch of the upper East Barwon River, located in the Otway hinterland of Victoria’s south-west.§ §Based out of Deakin’s award-winning Geelong campus, the applied research is complementary to an existing river restoration and water security project led by Barwon Water that aims to restore water flow entitlements through the removal of non-native plant species (Salix spp., willow), streambed stabilisation, revegetation and stock-exclusion measures. The research will contribute new knowledge toward the concept of Ecologically Functional Riparian Zones, with a focus on comparing water quality and ecological variables before, during and after restoration activities.The project is open to domestic and international students, and would be well suited to mid-career NRM or water professionals looking for a stimulating change, or to provide a competitive career edge.§ § § §Project outcomes§ §Assessment of changes in physico-chemical (dissolved oxygen, pH, conductivity & temperature) and water quality (nitrogen and phosphorous) before and after completion of restoration works.§ §Assessment of changes in microbial assemblages (main focus = E. coli) before and after completion of restoration works.§ §Assessment of changes in other biological assemblages before and after completion of restoration works (e.g. fish, macro-invertebrate or riparian vegetation).§ § § §PhD benefits§ §Work collaboratively with the Victorian Water sector, Deakin University, and Water Research Australia (WaterRA);§ §Professional networks & partnership opportunities, including WaterRA Professional Development Support;§ §Attractive and competitive PhD Scholarship package (see below);§ §A combination of both pure and applied science to address a real world problem and contribute new knowledge to field of ecology;§ §Multidisciplinary research with the potential to design novel experimental tests to answer industry-based problems;§ §Mix of laboratory and fieldwork. Working in agricultural landscapes and spectacular forested catchments in the Otway hinterland; and§ §Guide future water resource management decisions and engage in critical environmental research.§ § § §Scholarship package§ §$115,000 PhD Scholarship Package that includes:§ § §Stipend, $90,000 (across 3 years);§ §Operating Allowance up to $15,000 (across 3 years);§ §Conference Support: $5,000 (across 3 years);§ §Professional Development Support: $5,000 (across 3 years); and§ §University post-graduate fee waiver.§ § § §Eligibility§ §Open to applicants currently based in Australia (this includes all permanent residents, and international citizens on suitable visas).§ §Applications will be considered from candidates who will be located in Australia by the commencement of T1, 8 Mar 2021 (at the latest).§ §Interested Honours Students (2020) are encouraged to apply (consideration for Covid disruption will be made, including any delays to results / graduation).§ § § §More information§ §For more information, please email Dr Ty Matthews at from Deakin University at§ §ty.matthews@deakin.edu.au§ §Applications close midnight, Sunday 18 October 2020.§ § §§§§

jobTitle: Poultry Environmental Management Officer Job in Blue Mountains & Central West - SEEK
xenophobe: right to live and work
jobText: TXT/50548385.txt	§Poultry Environmental Management Officer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Poultry Environmental Management Officer§§Advertiser: §Peffer Pastoral Co Pty Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§11 Sept 2020§§Location§§Blue Mountains & Central West§§Salary§§$55,000 - $60,000§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Science & Technology§, §Environmental, Earth & Geosciences§§§§§§Peffer Pastoral Co is a family owned and operated company in Central West NSW.  The company operates a mixed cropping/livestock business which is integrated into the core activity specialising in egg production.  Due to recent expansion, Peffer Pastoral Company requires an Environmental Management Officer experienced in poultry production.§ §This is an excellent opportunity which will appeal to someone who enjoys variety in the workplace, has a hands-on approach and wishes to develop further experience in environmental management in a primary production context.§ §The job requires a person with experience in farming and poultry to liaise with senior management to ensure key quality KPIs are met.§ §The responsibilities include:§ § §Erosion management from both poultry and farming activities§ §Managing water quality both into and out of the facilities§ §Manure and waste management§ §Managing biosecurity issues§ §Managing maintain good husbandry practices in the poultry flock management systems§ §Constantly assessing poultry to ensure appropriate welfare and health benchmark is maintained§ §Managing treat livestock to prevent diseases and other production losses§ § § §The main duties include:§ § §Monitor and record weather conditions and notify farm managers of possible critical limits§ §Monitor and record temperature, ventilation levels and humidity in poultry houses. Take corrective action where required§ §Monitor and record air quality and ammonia levels. Make necessary adjustments to the equipment to improve air quality. Take corrective action where required§ §Monitor, test and record water quality and quantity from various sources.§ §Monitor water nipple outlets in poultry sheds and repair or replace where needed§ §Monitor cooling pads and negative pressure fans for efficiency and air flow and clean as required.§ §Monitor poultry manure on belting system for inconsistencies in moisture and feed wastage. Maintain cleanliness and tracking of belting system. Take corrective action where required§ §Monitor floor litter for friable consistency. Take corrective action where required§ §Monitor floor egg numbers, collect, record and take measures to reduce or eliminate eggs on the floor§ §Monitor and record egg quality from different production systems§ §Administer vaccination and maintain vaccination records for the production facility§ §Monitor and record bird health and liveability. Take corrective action where required§ §Maintain ‘pecker’ blocks. Take corrective action where required§ §Monitor bird weights, record and assess to standard§ §Monitor and maintain feeding systems. Take corrective action where required§ §Monitor wild birds’ especially wild ducks around poultry facilities and be aware of potential biosecurity disease risks. Record and take corrective action§ §Monitor lighting systems and maintain in working order§ §Monitor range fencing to prevent wild animal access§ §Monitor poultry range area for degradation and take corrective action to minimise degradation§ §Monitor range grass cover to maintain acceptable level and record changes§ §Monitor degradation and foreign water bodies on range and record§ §Monitor manure spreading activities and climatic conditions. Take corrective action where required.§ §Monitor spraying activities and climatic conditions. Take corrective action where required.§ §Monitor and control floor litter manure removal. Take corrective action where required§ §Monitor shed clean downs, possible dust plumes and dispersion of dust. Take corrective action where required§ §Wash down sheds. Monitor chemical usage and drainage. Take corrective action where required§ §Ensure bird removal conducted humanely and correct euthanasia procedure applied.§ §Monitor dust suppression of access roads. Take corrective action where required§ §Monitor and record erosion sites and regeneration works§ §Monitor possible fire risk areas around farm and take remedial action where required§ §Monitor compost sites and maintain good composting procedures§ §The right candidate must meet the following essential criteria:§ § §Prior experience working with poultry in both caged and cage free environments§ §Knowledge of and experience with commercial agricultural systems, particularly poultry§ §The ability to work flexible hours (including being on-call as per roster)§ §Empathy with the rural environment§ §Tertiary qualifications in environmental science or similar§ §Be meticulous in record keeping with excellent attention to detail§ §Complete required reports and records on time§ §Ensure water is of an acceptable quantity and quality into and out of poultry and other livestock facilities§ §Document and manage potential and actual erosion on farms§ §Ensure manure, waste and effluent is managed in accordance with regulations and policies§ §Assist with the documentation and management of biosecurity risks and issues§ § § §This is a full time position with a salary of between $55,000.00 - $60,000 per year.§ §Please send your CV and cover letter to: §accounts@canobolaseggs.com.au§ by C.O.B. Friday 9th October 2020.§ §For further information please contact our office on §02 6366 8576§.§ § § § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Do you have a current Australian driver's licence?§§§

They are supported by a talented team from a range of disciplines. Our skills are combined to help clients achieve their objectives in ways that contribute to sustainable outcomes. Currently, we are involved in the investigation and assessment of some of the largest infrastructure projects in Australia, including Snowy 2.0 and the proposed Dungowan and Mole River dams.§ §We are seeking expressions of interest from experienced Ecologists, or graduates with some prior relevant work experience, to join us on either a casual or short-term contract basis to assist with regional fieldwork, including remote locations, over the coming months. Due to current COVID travel restrictions we are seeking Ecologists who are based in either NSW or Queensland.§ §Please clearly state in your covering letter if you are available for an immediate or future start and if you currently reside in NSW or Queensland. § §We welcome applications from degree qualified Ecologists with proven relevant experience who can confidently demonstrate the following key competencies:§ § §completion of a degree in ecology or a related discipline;§ §minimum of one year relevant experience (experience in ecological consulting will be viewed favourably);§ §experience with undertaking ecological field survey;§ §competent plant/botany or animal identification skills;§ §be able to show initiative and be proactive;§ §good interpersonal skills including the ability to liaise with the team, clients and all relevant stakeholders;§ §ability to manage own time and priorities and assist the rest of the team to meet project objectives in a deadline driven work environment;§ §have a strong work ethic and positive will do attitude;§ §have a fitness level where you are able to undertake fieldwork in remote areas, often involving long walks;§ §have a current/valid unrestricted NSW or QLD driver's licence§ §the ability to be an enthusiastic team player; and§ §aligns with EMM's culture, values and vision.§ §EMM offers you an opportunity to work with passionate professionals in an environment with a very positive and inclusive culture. We are highly committed to our staff, clients and the community.§ §If you meet the requirements of the position as stated above, please submit your application via email to §careers@emmconsulting.com.au§. Please quote reference “§Ecologist EOI  §0920§“. To have your application considered §it must include§ a tailored covering letter addressing the required key criteria and a full professional CV. §Applications close on Sunday, 11 October 2020.§ §EMM is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome applications from people with different backgrounds, including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander, people from culturally and linguistically diverse (CALD) backgrounds and people with disabilities.§ §Only those with a legal right to work in Australia will be considered.§ §Unsolicited resumes from recruitment consultants will not be accepted.§ §For more information about EMM please visit our website www.emmconsulting.com.au§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§Are you available to travel for this role when required?§§§

This position will drive, promote and implement positive cultural change to ensure that the GBR&MP Region and the broader QPWS&P are at the forefront of working meaningfully with First Nations peoples on the country we manage. §        §The GBR&MP Region has the primary responsibility for implementing the Field Management Program for the Great Barrier Reef World Heritage Area, a program jointly funded by the State and the Commonwealth governments. The Region's responsibilities here include both the national park islands and State and Commonwealth marine parks spread throughout the Great Barrier Reef World Heritage Area. This approach ensures we are committed to operating tenure-blind and values-focused. The GBR&MP Region also encompasses the State marine park waters associated with the Great Sandy and Moreton Bay Marine Parks.§        §This an excellent role for someone who is a good communicator, shows great initiative and has experience in project/ program management and reporting. The position is Indigenous Identified and can be based at any of our Cairns, Townsville, Airlie Beach or Gladstone base locations. jobText: TXT/50558878.txt	§Patent Examiner - Peptide Chemistry & Chemical Compounds§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Patent Examiner - Peptide Chemistry & Chemical Compounds§§Advertiser: §IP Australia§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§14 Sept 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Salary§§$76,583.00§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Science & Technology§, §Chemistry & Physics§§§§§§Please note: all positions are located in Canberra§ § §If you know about Peptide Chemistry, then we want to hear from you!§ §A great opportunity to apply your technical knowledge in a new field§ §Excellent working conditions, job security, genuine flexibility, and work/life balance§ §About the Agency§  §IP Australia is an Australian Government Agency that’s a little bit different. We work with Australians to help them protect their Intellectual Property.  We have a strong sense of purpose, ensuring Australians benefit from great ideas.§  §About the role§  §As a Patent Examiner you will see cutting edge ideas and technologies and apply your technical knowledge, research, and analytical skills to assess these inventions.  You will be the public face of our organisation, working with individuals, patent attorneys, businesses to protect their Intellectual Property rights. You will engage in a specialised training program to hone and develop your critical thinking, analysis, and communication abilities in this context.§Our Peptide Chemistry & Chemical compounds team in Canberra are looking for people with knowledge in one or more of the below areas:§ § §Peptide chemistry, sugars, and organic compounds along with their uses and methods of manufacture.§ §About you§  §To be successful you must love your field of expertise, be passionate about innovation and have excellent reasoning and judgement. Strong communication skills, a strong sense of curiosity and a love for problem solving are all critical traits for an examiner.§  §Most importantly you want to learn and apply that learning. You will be supported by a workplace coach through a competency-based training program to enable you to assess patent applications against legislative requirements including whether the invention is new, inventive, and clearly described.  After completing training, you will work independently but as part of a team, you will also be able to identify work group priorities and achieve team goals.§Advantages of being a Patent Examiner:§ § §You will see new ideas and technologies every day – and be responsible for assessing their eligibility for protection under a Patent.§ §You will enhance your critical thinking capability; questioning and analysing to ensure Patents are issued appropriately§ §You will work collaboratively with other scientists and engineers to problem solve and deliver positive outcomes for IP Australia and Australian business, but also have a high level of autonomy in your day-to-day work§ §You continue your learning, maintaining currency in your chosen field§ §You develop knowledge and capability in Patent Law§ §Eligibility requirements:§You will need:§ § §a recognised degree in at least one of the technologies areas listed under ‘About the role’§ §Australian Citizenship to be engaged in the APS and to meet IP Australia’s security clearance requirements§ §For more detailed information, including the other disciplines we are recruiting for please refer to the position profile below:§  §Position Profile §  §Would you like to know more?§ § §Access our website and see our § case studies and FAQ’s.§ §For more information check out these videos that showcase two of our Patent Examiners§ §YouTube Video – Vivian§, § YouTube Video – Alex.§ §Join our webinar on how to apply – § details here§ §Information related to the salary range can be found in § IP Australia's Enterprise Agreement 2017 - 2020.§ §Interested? We’d love to hear from you.§  §Please reach out to the IP Australia Recruitment Solutions team if you have any questions about the application process via §recruitment@ipaustralia.gov.au§  §If you have specific questions relating to the position, please reach out to the relevant Contact Officer – details found in Table A on the Position Profile - Patent Examiner. §§§§

jobText: TXT/50635615.txt	§Senior Ranger (Indigenous Identified)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Ranger (Indigenous Identified)§§Advertiser: §Department of Environment and Science§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§25 Sept 2020§§Location§§Gladstone & Central QLD§§Salary§§$84,555 - $91,703 p.a.§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Science & Technology§, §Other§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Senior Ranger (Indigenous Identified) §      §        §Permanent Full Time §        §$84,555 - $91,703 §        §Plus applicable allowances related to travel, overtime etc. §      §      §        §The focus of this role includes facilitating the involvement of First Nations peoples in protected area management through informal and formal partnership arrangements. This position will drive, promote and implement positive cultural change to ensure that the GBR&MP Region and the broader QPWS&P are at the forefront of working meaningfully with First Nations peoples on the country we manage. §        §The GBR&MP Region has the primary responsibility for implementing the Field Management Program for the Great Barrier Reef World Heritage Area, a program jointly funded by the State and the Commonwealth governments. The Region's responsibilities here include both the national park islands and State and Commonwealth marine parks spread throughout the Great Barrier Reef World Heritage Area. This approach ensures we are committed to operating tenure-blind and values-focused. The GBR&MP Region also encompasses the State marine park waters associated with the Great Sandy and Moreton Bay Marine Parks.§        §This an excellent role for someone who is a good communicator, shows great initiative and has experience in project/ program management and reporting. The position is Indigenous Identified and can be based at any of our Cairns, Townsville, Airlie Beach or Gladstone base locations. Travel throughout the State will be required at times as part of the role. There are no mandatory qualifications required, however a formal qualification or experience working in culturally sensitive and complex matters would be highly regarded.§        §This is an Identified position - Applicants must identify as being of Aboriginal or Torres Strait Islander descent.§        §Applications to remain current for 12 months§        §Job Ad Reference: QLD/353095/20§        §Closing Date: Friday, 23 October 2020§      §      §      §      §    §  §§§The focus of this role includes facilitating the involvement of First Nations peoples in protected area management through informal and formal partnership arrangements. This position will drive, promote and implement positive cultural change to ensure that the GBR&MP Region and the broader QPWS&P are at the forefront of working meaningfully with First Nations peoples on the country we manage. § §The GBR&MP Region has the primary responsibility for implementing the Field Management Program for the Great Barrier Reef World Heritage Area, a program jointly funded by the State and the Commonwealth governments. The Region's responsibilities here include both the national park islands and State and Commonwealth marine parks spread throughout the Great Barrier Reef World Heritage Area. This approach ensures we are committed to operating tenure-blind and values-focused. The GBR&MP Region also encompasses the State marine park waters associated with the Great Sandy and Moreton Bay Marine Parks.§ §This an excellent role for someone who is a good communicator, shows great initiative and has experience in project/ program management and reporting. The position is Indigenous Identified and can be based at any of our Cairns, Townsville, Airlie Beach or Gladstone base locations. Travel throughout the State will be required at times as part of the role. There are no mandatory qualifications required, however a formal qualification or experience working in culturally sensitive and complex matters would be highly regarded.§ §This is an Identified position - Applicants must identify as being of Aboriginal or Torres Strait Islander descent.§ §Applications to remain current for 12 months§ §Job Ad Reference: QLD/353095/20§ §Closing Date: Friday, 23 October 2020§§§§

jobText: TXT/50618832.txt	§Packaging Technologist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Packaging Technologist§§Advertiser: §Hilton Foods Australia§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Sept 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §Western Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Science & Technology§, §Materials Sciences§§§§§§About Us §Hilton Foods Australia is part of the Hilton Food Group based in the UK, with meat manufacturing plants throughout the UK, Western & Central Europe and Australia. §Hilton is a dynamic & progressive business with a strong reputation for quality & innovation within the fresh food industry. §Hilton invests heavily in all its facilities to maintain the state of the art levels required to service its customers' growth. We progressively extend the range of products supplied to customers, deliver first class service levels & continually increase production efficiency. Hilton continues to grow through additional volumes and close cooperation with our retail partners. §Hilton Foods Australia has a long term partnership with Woolworths Limited, to supply Woolworths Supermarkets with packaged and value-added meat product. Working together, we focus on strengthening our world class meat offer in Australia, by delivering affordable, innovative and convenient protein choices to customers. §Here's a taste of what you’ll be doing §A fantastic opportunity has arisen for an experienced Packaging Technologist to join the HFA Team! §Your role will include, however will not be limited to:§Manage the end to end development of new packaging formats from concept through to shelf§Manage, develop and identify new packaging suppliers, developing key relationships and improving Quality of materials§Ensure compliance of all packaging formats to and championing the Packaging Covenant Strategy§Identify, research and put forward packaging innovation projects§Technical input into the artwork procedure§Drive packaging implementation at the site of manufacture§Work in efficiency-improving initiatives§Work with factory QA teams on setting standards and resolving Quality issues.§Support commissioning of new packaging lines§Lead packaging trials and implementations across multiple manufacturing sites§Support and advance the Packaging Sustainability Strategy and its associated targets and concepts§Develop and maintain Packaging Specifications for all applicable categories§The ingredients for success §Significant experience working in a Packaging position within a manufacturing business such as Food, Beverage, Pharmaceutical, Personal Care or Packaging industries.§Proven background of taking a packaging concept and delivering to the market§Ability to work and network across all areas of the business§Exceptional communication skills with the ability to liaise with key stakeholders at all levels from operator to Senior Manager §Confident in the translation of technical detail into packaging concepts and vice versa§Proactive in the design of new packaging innovations and the identification of continuous improvement opportunities – both within the manufacturing process and the packaging materials§Experience dealing with design houses, printing houses, packaging material suppliers, and packaging machinery suppliers§Previous experience leading complex projects, with multiple stakeholders, across different geographical locations§Great attention to detail, yet creative§Ability to work autonomously, and self-directed§What’s on Offer §Hilton Foods is a fast paced, constantly changing business that focuses on your talents and challenges you to perform at your best. As a team, we are bold with ideas and operate with pace and passion, always looking for better ways to delight our customers. §We look for people who can hit the ground running, devour new challenges, and generate innovative ideas with passion and enthusiasm! §The pace of our business has made it a gathering place for passionate and talented people. In this environment, team members draw the motivation, focus, determination and personal growth required to achieve more, faster! §If this is the role for you, please submit a cover letter and resume.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

jobTitle: Data Scientist Job in ACT - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50672933.txt	§Data Scientist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Data Scientist§§Advertiser: §Community Services Directorate§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§ACT§§Salary§§$86,547 - $99,051§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Science & Technology§, §Mathematics, Statistics & Information Sciences§§§§§§Community Services§ §Housing ACT§ §Policy and Business Transformation§ §Insights and Analytics§ § § §Data Scientist§ § § §Administrative Services Officer Class 6§ §Salary Range: §$86,547 - $99,051  (PN: 08031)§ § § §Details:§ Housing ACT is seeking a Data Scientist to contribute to the transformation of Housing ACT through data management, data delivery, analysis and strategic advice to inform and enhance policy and operational practice.§ §The Insights and Analytics team aims to build the capability of Housing ACT to deliver evidence-based services for our clients, and to empower our clients and community partners by creating discoverable, accessible and usable data. The successful candidate will need to work in partnership with policy, operational and business systems support teams to build the data maturity of our organisation and contribute to our vision to deliver strategic, timely and relevant information.§ §Candidates who can use their knowledge of data mining techniques, their programming skills and knowledge of government service delivery and policy to extract insights from complex sets of data are essential. This includes cleaning, transforming and combining data sources, building explanatory and predictive models, and creating visualisations to analyse and communicate findings to stakeholders. The ACT Public Service supports workforce diversity and is committed to creating an inclusive workplace. As part of this commitment, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, people with disability, culturally diverse people and those who identify as LGBTIQ are encouraged to apply.§ §Note:§ This is a temporary position available from 2 November 2020 until 30 April 2021 with the possibility of permanency. An order of merit will be established from this selection process and may be used to fill future identical vacancies over the next 12 months.§ §How to Apply:§ For further information, please visit www.jobs.act.gov.au§ § § §Contact Officer:§ Anne Jenkins §(02) 6205 0082§ §anne.jenkins@act.gov.au§ § § §Applications Close: §14 October 2020§§§§

ChemSkill§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§14 Sept 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Science & Technology§, §Quality Assurance & Control§§§§§§CLIENT§  §Our client is part of a not-for-profit, highly respected Biomedical Research Facility with more than 170 staff, based near Melbourne's CBD. A Division within this organisation is the National Reference Laboratory (NRL). With a work-force of over 30 scientific personnel, NRL works to improve the accuracy of testing for infectious diseases by laboratories and in point-of-care  settings in Australia and internationally. §  §Established as a not-for-profit scientific organisation as part of the Australian Government’s HIV and AIDS strategy in 1985, NRL is contracted by the Department of Health and licensed by the Therapeutic Goods Administration (TGA). It collaborates with scientific partners worldwide to assure the quality of testing for the diagnosis and management of human communicable diseases, including but not limited to HIV, HCV, and HTLV.§  §NRL does this by providing specialised products and services, including pre- and post-market evaluations of test kits; provision of quality assurance programs to laboratories; highly specific and non-routine testing services; consultation, education and training for laboratories. These services are provided globally.§  § §  §THE ROLE§  §This position is accountable for three areas of NRL: Quality,  Risk, and Safety Management. §  §As both a TGA licensed and NATA accredited facility, the successful candidate will ensure all aspects of the NRL’s Quality Management System (QMS) relating to NATA, ISO 9001, ISO 15189, GMP & AS 4801 are maintained, further developed, and implemented. §  §In addition to being the primary contact person for all QMS-related activities, you will also be the NRL's management representative responsible for safe work practices and staff safety. §  §As all other NRL roles, the Quality & Risk Manager role is an initial fixed-term three-year renewable contract. §  §Some of your responsibilities will include:§ § §Manage the development, implementation, and maintenance of NRL’s QMS in accordance with ISO 9001, AS 4801, GMP, TGA license for compliance with the Code of Good Manufacturing Practice NATA, ISO 15189 & 17043.§ §Ensure all relevant policies and procedures are updated, available, and fit for purpose § §As a Quality Manager, provide advice to staff across the organisation relating to improvements of internal practices and policies § §Prepare and host all activities related to external audits, conduct root cause analysis to identify corrective actions, and respond to audit findings in a timely manner § §Develop and deliver quality training courses for internal staff and for WHO-related or capacity building consultancies on an international level as required§ §Lead NRL's risk management framework, co-ordinate risk assessments, reviews, and management planning § §Assess, report, and manage strategic and operational risks § §As a part of the Executive Team, contribute to strategic, business, and operational planning, management review, and reporting requirements§ §Together with the Health & Safety Advisor, ensure NRL complies with the best safe work environment practices§ §Actively support and mentor staff, lead by example and engage people in quality using your excellent people-influencing skills§ §Establish and maintain processes to support regulatory affairs activities supporting different products and services§ § §  §SELECTION CRITERIA§  §To be short-listed for this responsible role, you will need to meet the following criteria:§ § §Tertiary scientific qualification of at least Masters level, preferably in virology or cell biology § §Detailed knowledge of infectious diseases testing, including standards and regulations relating to QC testing and/or manufacturing procedures§ §Previous QA experience working in a laboratory environment within infectious disease testing or manufacturing environment § §Proven leadership experience within a management role responsible for quality systems maintaining compliance with TGA, NATA, GMP, relevant ISO standards, and AS 4801§ §Open and transparent management style, with the ability to empower and mentor staff§ §Excellent stakeholder engagement and relationship building skills§ §Self-motivated with outstanding communication skills and passion for diagnosis and management of infectious human diseases § §To be considered you shall be required to provide evidence you have permanent working rights in Australia or hold a relevant working visa to work full-time hours.§  § §  §APPLICATIONS§  §Please click the 'Apply Now' button to submit your application. Please ensure you attach a Resume and Cover Letter addressing your suitability for this role, in Word Format. §  §To have a strictly confidential discussion about this unique and exciting opportunity please call Helen on §0438 620 434§ or text to organise a suitable time.  §  § §  §THANK YOU§  §We would like to thank you for taking the time to apply for this role. Unfortunately, due to the large volume of applications we receive daily, we cannot contact all candidates.  Please note, if you are not successful on this occasion, your resume will remain on our database and you may be contacted for other similar roles in the future.§  §To view other available roles, please visit our website §www.csexecutivegroup.com§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Patent Examiner - Peptide Chemistry & Chemical Compounds Job in ACT - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50558784.txt	§Patent Examiner - Peptide Chemistry & Chemical Compounds§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Patent Examiner - Peptide Chemistry & Chemical Compounds§§Advertiser: §IP Australia§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§14 Sept 2020§§Location§§ACT§§Salary§§$76,583.00§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Science & Technology§, §Chemistry & Physics§§§§§§Please note: all positions are located in Canberra§ § §If you know about Peptide Chemistry, then we want to hear from you!§ §A great opportunity to apply your technical knowledge in a new field§ §Excellent working conditions, job security, genuine flexibility, and work/life balance§ §About the Agency§  §IP Australia is an Australian Government Agency that’s a little bit different. We work with Australians to help them protect their Intellectual Property.  We have a strong sense of purpose, ensuring Australians benefit from great ideas.§  §About the role§  §As a Patent Examiner you will see cutting edge ideas and technologies and apply your technical knowledge, research, and analytical skills to assess these inventions.  You will be the public face of our organisation, working with individuals, patent attorneys, businesses to protect their Intellectual Property rights. You will engage in a specialised training program to hone and develop your critical thinking, analysis, and communication abilities in this context.§Our Peptide Chemistry & Chemical compounds team in Canberra are looking for people with knowledge in one or more of the below areas:§ § §Peptide chemistry, sugars, and organic compounds along with their uses and methods of manufacture.§ §About you§  §To be successful you must love your field of expertise, be passionate about innovation and have excellent reasoning and judgement. Strong communication skills, a strong sense of curiosity and a love for problem solving are all critical traits for an examiner.§  §Most importantly you want to learn and apply that learning. You will be supported by a workplace coach through a competency-based training program to enable you to assess patent applications against legislative requirements including whether the invention is new, inventive, and clearly described.  After completing training, you will work independently but as part of a team, you will also be able to identify work group priorities and achieve team goals.§Advantages of being a Patent Examiner:§ § §You will see new ideas and technologies every day – and be responsible for assessing their eligibility for protection under a Patent.§ §You will enhance your critical thinking capability; questioning and analysing to ensure Patents are issued appropriately§ §You will work collaboratively with other scientists and engineers to problem solve and deliver positive outcomes for IP Australia and Australian business, but also have a high level of autonomy in your day-to-day work§ §You continue your learning, maintaining currency in your chosen field§ §You develop knowledge and capability in Patent Law§ §Eligibility requirements:§You will need:§ § §a recognised degree in at least one of the technologies areas listed under ‘About the role’§ §Australian Citizenship to be engaged in the APS and to meet IP Australia’s security clearance requirements§ §For more detailed information, including the other disciplines we are recruiting for please refer to the position profile below:§  §Position Profile §  §Would you like to know more?§ § §Access our website and see our § case studies and FAQ’s.§ §For more information check out these videos that showcase two of our Patent Examiners§ §YouTube Video – Vivian§, § YouTube Video – Alex.§ §Join our webinar on how to apply – § details here§ §Information related to the salary range can be found in § IP Australia's Enterprise Agreement 2017 - 2020.§ §Interested? We’d love to hear from you.§  §Please reach out to the IP Australia Recruitment Solutions team if you have any questions about the application process via §recruitment@ipaustralia.gov.au§  §If you have specific questions relating to the position, please reach out to the relevant Contact Officer – details found in Table A on the Position Profile - Patent Examiner. §§§§

jobText: TXT/50561730.txt	§Data Scientist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Data Scientist§§Advertiser: §KBR - Kellogg Brown & Root Pty Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§14 Sept 2020§§Location§§Brisbane§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Science & Technology§, §Mathematics, Statistics & Information Sciences§§§§§§Is the future as exciting to you as it is to us?§ §Are you passionate about digital innovation and data driven solutions?§ §At KBR we are paving the way in how we do things.  Creativity, collaboration and excellence is what KBR’s core is made up of.  Does this resonate with you?§ §We value an inclusive and diverse work environment and are working together to build a culture that embraces each other’s unique strengths and experiences.§ §Our people are important to us, and are what makes our business successful.  Therefore we realise it is important to nurture a culture of trust giving you the freedom to step up and take opportunities that challenge you and push your career to the next level.  We will encourage you to work in a way that suits you, and look forward to discussing what you need to be successful.§ §The Opportunity§ §KBR’s Infrastructure Services Business is reimagining how we deliver, and transforming into a digitally enabled business.§  §Our strategy focuses on data-driven solutions, using cloud-based data analytics to provide improved outcomes for our clients and our business. The Data Scientist will work within a national team providing specialist advice and best practice solutions to internal and external stakeholders. The role§ §will use both§ §technology and support from those with domain expertise to identify trends based on industry knowledge and contextual understanding. They will support the development of tools for the analysis of strategic data, allowing the business to interrogate and report on data trends that further improve its decision making and performance.§ §Who are you? § §If COVID-19 has taught us anything, it’s that working together to reach common goals cannot be done without passion and commitment behind them.  If you are a recent graduate with qualifications in Computer Science, Data Science or Information Systems with 2 to 4 years experience in a similar role we would love to hear from you. We are seeking a technically savvy candidate, with competency and enthusiasm in data management and mathematics, able to problem solve and create innovative analytical solutions. Inter-industry experience is often valuable, however relevance and applicability needs to be clearly communicated. Competency with Power BI, DAX & M, and Azure/AWS Analytics would be advantageous.§ §About Us§ §KBR have been established for over 100 years and we pride ourselves on being an innovative and forward-thinking company with a reputation for delivering on some of the most challenging and complex engineering projects in the world.§ §So how do I apply?§ §If what you've read resonates with your values, experience and career aspiration then we want to hear from you!  Just click apply and upload your resume and cover letter.§ §KBR values an inclusive and diverse work environment and we encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply. Our hiring decisions are based on the key requirements of each role and candidates are selected based on their unique strengths and experiences.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50582264.txt	§Invertebrate Research Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Invertebrate Research Manager§§Advertiser: §Supercritical Pty Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§17 Sept 2020§§Location§§Lismore & Far North Coast§§Salary§§$25 - $29.99 per hour§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Science & Technology§, §Biological & Biomedical Sciences§§§§§§Invertebrate Research Manager§ §About Us§Supercritical Pty Ltd is an Australian owned hemp business focused on research and development of plant genetics and industrial scale plant compound extraction processes in order to create novel products derived from hemp for the agricultural and biosecurity sector.§Supercritical owns and operates a farm and research facilities in Northern New South Wales where we operate under a cultivation and scientific research permit (issued by N.S.W. Department of Primary Industries since 2015). Supercritical’s corporate headquarters are located in Melbourne. See §www.super-critical.com§The Role§Supercritical maintains a state-of-the-art greenhouse specifically designed for research purposes on our farm. We have developed a number of unique hemp strains and are currently investigating issues related to pest insect/plant relationships and bio-pesticide use.§We are looking to appoint a suitably qualified/experienced person to the position of Invertebrate Research Manager. This will be an individual with relevant invertebrate research experience to manage and further develop the on-farm invertebrate research program. On-site accommodation is provided.§Duties and Responsibilities Include:§Development and maintenance of pest and beneficial insect colonies§Developing, designing, and delivering research projects§Large scale data collection, including imaging and analysis§Development of new techniques/processes to collect data§Applying and monitoring bio-pesticide§Working as part of the wider research direction of the company on key experimental aspects of research projects.§Contributing to, and possibly leading, the production of reports and scientific papers.§Liaison with our collaborators (University of Melbourne)§About you§You are an enthusiastic and motivated individual with experience in and passion for quantitative biological research. You are committed to progressing your career in invertebrate biology (possibly pest management) and interested in gaining relevant industrial experience in a new and developing industry. §You are practically minded and able to work through the technical challenges of developing new experimental approaches.§You are comfortable working independently, have excellent attention to detail and are skilled in electronic record management and email communications. Experience with high-resolution imaging would be an advantage.§We would like to meet you if you have:§Post-graduate qualifications in Biological Science or Agricultural Science§Prior experience in working with invertebrates, pest invertebrates, laboratory invertebrate colonies§High self-motivation and capability for independent work§Experience generating and analysing large data sets§Excellent interpersonal, written, and oral communication skills with the ability to liaise with a diverse range of people§What we offer:§A six month initial contract - (25 hours per week base with further hours on an as needs basis @$25 p.h)§Accommodation§Flexible working hours§Stimulating work setting focused on cutting edge biological/environmental research§Collaborative team environment§ §For further information and to apply please send a cover letter and your CV to §careers@super-critical.com§ §Applications close 8h October 2020§ §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§Have you completed a qualification in science?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

jobText: TXT/50584200.txt	§Research (Senior) Assistant Ion Channel Discovery Biology§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Research (Senior) Assistant Ion Channel Discovery Biology§§Advertiser: §Channel Biologics§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§17 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Science & Technology§, §Biological & Biomedical Sciences§§§§§§Channel Biologics is a young, dynamic, fast growing Australian biotechnology company based in Concord, Sydney. We specialise in technology development for the generation of biologics against difficult targets. We are backed by class-leading technology for the discovery of antibodies against previously undruggable targets and focus on challenging classes such as ion channels and GPCRs for the treatment of a variety of diseases. With a proven leadership team experienced in antibody discovery and development, Channel Biologics will streamline the creation of new biologics. The successful candidate will be part of the ion channel discovery biology group and help establish the laboratories within Channel Biologics. Join us now as we build a company from small beginnings into a powerhouse for the generation of new therapies.§ § § §Qualifications and experience:§ § §Bachelor’s degree (with Honours or equivalent) +2 or more years experience§ §Previous experience in drug discovery and screening with a focus on ion channels§ §Experience in the following: Mammalian cell culture, cell-based assays, statistical analysis§ §Highly desirable: Electrophysiology, protein purification, flow cytometry, automation§ §Excellent interpersonal, presentation, and time management skills§ § § §How you might spend your days:§ § §Maintaining cell lines and performing transfections§ §Screening of biologics using cell-based fluorescence reporter dyes, electrophysiology, and flow cytometry§ §Expression and purification of proteins, particularly antibodies§ §Executing experiments both independently and in collaboration with your teammates§ §Routine lab duties including preparation of media/buffer, autoclaving, and maintaining stock levels§ §Collaborating with and supporting other team members to meet project deliverables and timelines§ § § §We'd love to hear from you if:§ § §You are an experienced RA with knowledge of ion channels§ §You are looking to make an impact in an industry setting§ §You can work in a self-directed manner, demonstrate initiative, and are willing to work flexible hours§ §You thrive in a collaborative, fast-paced work environment with multiple competing priorities§ §You have impeccable attention to detail§ §You can present your work in a clear, concise, and confident manner§ §What we offer:§ § §Great work/life balance§ §Easy transport access§ §An attractive compensation package, including a competitive salary and health/lifestyle benefits§ §Opportunity to join a start-up company and help shape us from the ground up§ §Ability to grow your technical skill set and engage in professional development§ § § §To apply: § §If this role matches your skillset and you are ready for a new challenge, we strongly encourage your application. To apply, simply submit a cover letter and detailed resume, including any positions held and your current qualifications and experience. Title is conditional to experience.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years' experience do you have as a research assistant?§Have you completed a qualification in science?§§§

jobText: TXT/50551947.txt	§Energetic Materials Roles§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Energetic Materials Roles§§Advertiser: §CS Executive Group Inc. ChemSkill§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§11 Sept 2020§§Location§§Adelaide§§Salary§§Attractive Hourly Rate or a Fixed-Term Tenure§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Science & Technology§, §Laboratory & Technical Services§§§§§§CLIENT§ §The §Defence Science and Technology (DST) §is part of the Australian Department of Defence dedicated to providing §science and technology support for Australia's defence and national security needs§. In its position as the second-largest public-funded R&D organisation in Australia, DST is a national leader in safeguarding Australia by delivering valued scientific advice and innovative solutions for Defence and national security.§ §The Explosives and Pyrotechnics (EP) group develops the necessary science and technology (S&T) in relation to energetic materials, energetic systems, and energetic effects (i.e., energetics), which are the basis for Explosive Ordnance (EO).  Within the EP group, the Advanced Propulsion and Weapon Effects (APWE) Branch conducts fundamental and applied research in that includes processing, development, and testing of new propellant and explosive materials for Defence applications.§ § § §ROLES§ §Based in its Edinburgh site in Adelaide, there are three full-time positions (each working an average of §37.5 hours per week§) for a project leading to the development and manufacture of explosive ordnance. The initial engagement on the project shall be under a nine-month contract and DST provides provision for an extension of up to 12 months, which could see work continuing through until mid-2022.§ §CS Executive Group can offer employment under a fixed-term tenure, which includes §paid annual leave, sick leave, and public holidays§. Alternatively, if you opt to forgo those benefits, we can engage you on §a contract based solely on hours worked§ that affords a higher hourly rate of pay in accordance with casual employment terms.§ §Here is DST's summary for each of the project-related positions: -§ §Senior Practitioner – Energetic Materials§ § §under direction, manufacture propellant and explosive formulations;§ §undertake laboratory testing on a range of formulations, so as to characterise chemical and mechanical properties;§ §perform test data analysis;§ §assist with the development of test methodologies; and§ §prepare risk assessments and standard operating procedures for facilities and processes§ §Practitioner – Energetic Materials§ § §assist with manufacturing propellant and explosive formulations; and§ §undertake analytical/laboratory testing on formulations, so as to characterise chemical, sensitiveness and mechanical properties§ §Practitioner – Trials Management§ § §testing on a range of propellants and explosive ordnance to characterise performance, safety and effects;§ §provide trials instrumentation and data acquisition support;§ §assist with the development of test methodologies;§ §prepare risk assessments and standard operating procedures for facilities and processes; and§ §assist with experimental design and instrumentation.§ §Additionally, all of the above roles shall are required to:§ § §upkeep of manufacture and test facilities;§ §liaise with workshop staff where their involvement is necessary for preparing hardware and materials for manufacture/testing; and§ §provide additional technical support when required by Task Leader or Group Leader§ § § §SELECTION CRITERIA§ §To be successful in your application you must meet the following criteria:§ § §Australian Citizenship§—this is a mandatory requirement, as befits the nature DST's project work;§ §Science-based diploma or degree, ideally in chemistry or chemical engineering;§ §Proven ability to work cooperatively in a small team, liaise and communicate effectively;§ §Demonstrated competence in the safe handling of hazardous chemicals, specifically techniques relevant to manufacturing/testing energetic material;§ §Oral and written communication skills of a high standard;§ §Demonstrated understanding of and commitment to WHS in technical laboratories and/or field trials;§ §Must be willing to undergo the necessary security vetting to obtain a SECRET clearance level; and§ §If you are not based in Adelaide, you must be willing to relocate there at your own expense§ §Applications shall close at 5 pm (ACST)§on Thursday, 24 September 2020§ §APPLICATIONS§ §Please click the 'Apply' button to submit your application. Please ensure you attach a Resume and Cover Letter in Word Format addressing the above requirements. § §If you would like to know more about this unique opportunity then send a message to: -§ §recruiters@csexecgroup.com§ §Or call Dr Daniel Turner on §0415 573 220§ (8:30 am–5:00 pm ACST)—please SMS after hours for him to call back at a mutually convenient time.§ § § §THANK YOU§ §On behalf of our client and CS Executive Group, we thank you in advance for the time you are taking to apply for this role.§ §Unfortunately, due to the large volume of correspondence our recruitment team receives on a daily basis, we shall only contact those applicants considered suitable for shortlisting as candidates.§ §Accordingly, should you be unsuccessful with your application, please note your details have been captured to our Talent Pool database that may mean you are contacted in the future for similar opportunities to this.§ § § §Visit our website to view all of our current opportunities: -§ §www.csexecutivegroup.com/jobs§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§Have you completed a qualification in science?§What's your expected annual base salary?§Do you have any leave planned in the next 6 months?§How many hours are you available to work per week?§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50675268.txt	§Postdoctoral Research Fellow in Biomedical/Bioelectronics§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Postdoctoral Research Fellow in Biomedical/Bioelectronics§§Advertiser: §The University of Queensland§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Oct 2020§§Location§§Brisbane§§Salary§§$69,342- $92,782, plus super of up to 17%.§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Science & Technology§, §Modelling & Simulation§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Postdoctoral Research Fellow in Biomedical/Bioelectronics §      §        §§        §The School of Agriculture and Food Sciences§        §The School of Agriculture and Food Sciences is part of the Faculty of Science and is located at UQ’s St Lucia and Gatton campuses. It is one of the largest schools of its type in Australia, comprising research and teaching experts in agribusiness and rural development; animal, equine and wildlife science; plant and soil sciences; and food science and technology. The School contributes to UQ’s high standing as one of the world’s top 20 universities for agricultural sciences and Australia’s leading agriculture institution.§        §The School is a dynamic multidisciplinary hub, maintaining strong partnerships with industry, government and community, and integrating fundamental and applied research to find innovative and technology-focused solutions to global challenges. It teaches into a high number of undergraduate, postgraduate coursework and higher degree by research degree programs that encompass agriculture and related disciplines.§        §Staff and students have access to UQ's world-class facilities, including the Food Science Innovation Precinct, which comprises laboratories for food grading and chemical and microbiological analysis, as well as the Queensland Animal Science Precinct and equine and poultry research units.§        §The School’s diverse research expertise covers:§        §          §Agribusiness and rural development§: researchers investigate issues and emerging opportunities in industry and market development, agricultural development and food security, natural resource management, and rural community development. Focus areas include agribusiness, agricultural economics, resource economics, community development and systems analysis;§          §Animal, equine and wildlife science§: working with production animals (livestock and poultry), horses and wildlife, experts seek to address major contemporary issues such as sustainability, animal welfare, biodiversity, climate change and food/feed security;§          §Food science and technology§: colleagues aim to improve the taste, quality, appearance, nutritional value and safety of food, and ultimately to help enhance global health outcomes and economic benefits. They are affiliated with the UQ Queensland Alliance for Agriculture and Food Innovation’s Centre for Nutrition and Food Sciences and focus on food materials science and engineering, food microbiology, genomics, food sensory science, food chemistry and physical properties, and nutrition;§          §Plant and soil sciences§: aiming to develop cross-disciplinary solutions to the challenge of increasing food production while improving environmental outcomes, research activities span fundamental science that underpins innovation through to pragmatic field-based research that directly informs end-users and policy-makers.§        §        §For more information, visit the School of Agriculture and Food Sciences website: §agriculture.uq.edu.au§.§        §About This Opportunity             §        §This position will work on an NHMRC grant investigating breastmilk pasteurisation by nanosecond pulsed electric field. This project involves a multidisciplinary team of CIs from UQ’s School of Pharmacy and School of School of Information Technology and Electrical Engineering and a PhD student. Our project is aimed at exploring the use of novel nanosecond pulsed power technology to make a safe 'bioactive' donor breastmilk to improve care of vulnerable preterm infants in NICU. This study will lead to the development of suitable processing conditions that preserve the important biomolecules in donor-EBM while conforming to regulatory levels of bacterial reduction and elimination of milk pathogens. Under this project, the CIs are seeking a post-doctoral fellow who will be largely involved in investigating the fundamental changes that happen in the properties and structure of microbial cells and food matrices under the effect of pulsed electric field.§        §This position is located at our §picturesque St Lucia campus§, renowned as one of Australia’s most attractive university campuses, and located just 7km from Brisbane’s city centre. Bounded by the Brisbane River on three sides, and with outstanding public transport connections, our 114-hectare site provides a perfect work environment – you can enjoy the best of both worlds: a vibrant campus with the tradition of an established university.§        §For US applicants, please note that Australian Universities use British terminology, as such a Lecturer (Level B) position is equivalent to that of an Assistant Professor position in the US.§        §Our Ideal Candidate§        §We are searching for a research scientist to undertake cell modelling, design and develop a dynamic PEF treatment system and pulse generator using appropriate modelling software, as well as assist in the co-ordination the research team, to ensure projects meet their objectives.§        §You must have ongoing unrestricted work rights in Australia to apply for this opportunity.§        §We value diversity and inclusion, and actively encourage applications from those who bring diversity to the University. jobText: TXT/50566836.txt	§Project Environmental Scientist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Project Environmental Scientist§§Advertiser: §CDM Smith§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§15 Sept 2020§§Location§§Perth§, §CBD, Inner & Western Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Science & Technology§, §Environmental, Earth & Geosciences§§§§§§Looking to join a high performing team and develop your environmental career? § §An exciting opportunity exists for a full-time Project Environmental Scientist to undertake environmental work within our national CDM Smith Environmental Science team based in our Perth office. This role provides support to projects and other technical groups across Australia, with a focus on skills development and training. The role allows the individual to thrive and learn in a dynamic environment, whilst making valuable contributions to the organisation and supporting key projects for international clients.§ §We are looking for a self-motivated candidate with approximately three to six years experience in environmental sciences, interested in working with a skilled group of technically excellent professionals.§ §Success in this role will be based on the following criteria:§ § §University degree qualified in the area of environmental science;§ §Three to six years experience in the environmental science industry;§ §Demonstrated understanding of environmental impact assessment principles and practice, and site environmental management and compliance (auditing);§ §Experience in offshore and onshore environmental approvals for energy and mining clients;§ §Experience in regulator and/or stakeholder engagement is desirable, but not essential;§ §Demonstrates the following personal attributes: good communicator, self-aware, energetic and proactive, keen learner, takes initiative, critical thinking and problem solving, dependable, strong organisational skills;§ §Sound technical writing skills;§ §Established organisational skills and confidence in managing small to mid-sized projects, including liaising with and building positive relationships with clients and/or sub-contractors;§ §Willingness to undertake fieldwork, both in metropolitan and remote areas across Australia;§ §Ability to grasp new concepts quickly, be adaptable and flexible, and contribute individually and within a team environment to the success of a project;§ §Valid manual drivers licence; and§ §Right to work in Australia for an immediate start.§ §This is a fantastic opportunity for someone who is seeking an opportunity to further progress their career within a growing office of a thriving global company and with the added benefit of industry-recognised senior staff to provide training and mentoring. § §So who are CDM Smith? §We are a professional services firm consulting in the environmental and engineering spaces and take great pride in putting our clients first and providing sustainable, fit for purpose and cost-effective solutions for complex and challenging industry problems, both nationally and internationally. We are committed to delivering high-quality outcomes by bringing together specific technical expertise, intuitive on-ground know-how and a passion for what we do. § §We provide our employees with the opportunity to work on key projects in Australia and overseas. Our staff are motivated by a working environment that respects technical ability, integrity, innovation and diligence. We believe strongly in providing a positive workplace culture and flexibility to thrive in a supportive team environment.§ §Please submit your Cover Letter, CV and Academic Transcript §by 2 October 2020 §to the following email address:  §Au-recruit@cdmsmith.com§  § §Please call Tim Mitchell §(0428 673 203§) or Steve Ley §(0448 978 810§) if you have any questions in relation to the position. Information about what our company does internationally is available at cdmsmith.com.§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§Do you have a current Australian driver's licence?§§§

jobText: TXT/50559164.txt	§Patent Examiner - Immunology and Bio-therapeutics§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Patent Examiner - Immunology and Bio-therapeutics§§Advertiser: §IP Australia§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§14 Sept 2020§§Location§§ACT§§Salary§§$76,583.00§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Science & Technology§, §Biological & Biomedical Sciences§§§§§§Please note: all positions are located in Canberra§ § §If you know about Immunology or Bio-therapeutics, then we want to hear from you!§ §A great opportunity to apply your technical knowledge in a new field§ §Excellent working conditions, job security, genuine flexibility, and work/life balance§ §About the Agency§  §IP Australia is an Australian Government Agency that’s a little bit different. We work with Australians to help them protect their Intellectual Property.  We have a strong sense of purpose, ensuring Australians benefit from great ideas.§  §About the role§  §As a Patent Examiner you will see cutting edge ideas and technologies and apply your technical knowledge, research, and analytical skills to assess these inventions.  You will be the public face of our organisation, working with individuals, patent attorneys, businesses to protect their Intellectual Property rights. You will engage in a specialised training program to hone and develop your critical thinking, analysis, and communication abilities in this context.§Our Immunology and Bio-therapeutics team in Canberra are looking for people with knowledge in one or more of the below areas:§ § §Antibody-based drugs and immuno-therapies and their uses in treating and preventing human and animal diseases.§ §About you§  §To be successful you must love your field of expertise, be passionate about innovation and have excellent reasoning and judgement. Strong communication skills, a strong sense of curiosity and a love for problem solving are all critical traits for an examiner.§  § §  §Most importantly you want to learn and apply that learning. You will be supported by a workplace coach through a competency-based training program to enable you to assess patent applications against legislative requirements including whether the invention is new, inventive, and clearly described.  After completing training, you will work independently but as part of a team, you will also be able to identify work group priorities and achieve team goals.§Advantages of being a Patent Examiner:§ § §You will see new ideas and technologies every day – and be responsible for assessing their eligibility for protection under a Patent.§ §You will enhance your critical thinking capability; questioning and analysing to ensure Patents are issued appropriately§ §You will work collaboratively with other scientists and engineers to problem solve and deliver positive outcomes for IP Australia and Australian business, but also have a high level of autonomy in your day-to-day work§ §You continue your learning, maintaining currency in your chosen field§ §You develop knowledge and capability in Patent Law§ §Eligibility requirements:§You will need:§ § §a recognised degree in at least one of the technologies areas listed under ‘About the role’§ §Australian Citizenship to be engaged in the APS and to meet IP Australia’s security clearance requirements§ § §  §Would you like to know more?§ § §Access our website and see our § case studies and FAQ’s.§ §For more information check out these videos that showcase two of our Patent Examiners§ §YouTube Video – Vivian§, § YouTube Video – Alex.§ §Join our webinar on how to apply – § details here§ §Information related to the salary range can be found in § IP Australia's Enterprise Agreement 2017 - 2020.§ § §  §Interested? We’d love to hear from you.§  §Please reach out to the IP Australia Recruitment Solutions team if you have any questions about the application process via §recruitment@ipaustralia.gov.au§  §If you have specific questions relating to the position please reach out to the relevant Contact Officer – details found in Table A on the Position Profile - Patent Examiner. §§§§

You will engage in a specialised training program to hone and develop your critical thinking, analysis, and communication abilities in this context.§Our Immunology and Bio-therapeutics team in Canberra are looking for people with knowledge in one or more of the below areas:§ § §Antibody-based drugs and immuno-therapies and their uses in treating and preventing human and animal diseases.§ §About you§  §To be successful you must love your field of expertise, be passionate about innovation and have excellent reasoning and judgement. Strong communication skills, a strong sense of curiosity and a love for problem solving are all critical traits for an examiner.§  § §  §Most importantly you want to learn and apply that learning. You will be supported by a workplace coach through a competency-based training program to enable you to assess patent applications against legislative requirements including whether the invention is new, inventive, and clearly described.  After completing training, you will work independently but as part of a team, you will also be able to identify work group priorities and achieve team goals.§Advantages of being a Patent Examiner:§ § §You will see new ideas and technologies every day – and be responsible for assessing their eligibility for protection under a Patent.§ §You will enhance your critical thinking capability; questioning and analysing to ensure Patents are issued appropriately§ §You will work collaboratively with other scientists and engineers to problem solve and deliver positive outcomes for IP Australia and Australian business, but also have a high level of autonomy in your day-to-day work§ §You continue your learning, maintaining currency in your chosen field§ §You develop knowledge and capability in Patent Law§ §Eligibility requirements:§You will need:§ § §a recognised degree in at least one of the technologies areas listed under ‘About the role’§ §Australian Citizenship to be engaged in the APS and to meet IP Australia’s security clearance requirements§ § §  §Would you like to know more?§ § §Access our website and see our § case studies and FAQ’s.§ §For more information check out these videos that showcase two of our Patent Examiners§ §YouTube Video – Vivian§, § YouTube Video – Alex.§ §Join our webinar on how to apply – § details here§ §Information related to the salary range can be found in § IP Australia's Enterprise Agreement 2017 - 2020.§ § §  §Interested? We’d love to hear from you.§  §Please reach out to the IP Australia Recruitment Solutions team if you have any questions about the application process via §recruitment@ipaustralia.gov.au§  §If you have specific questions relating to the position please reach out to the relevant Contact Officer – details found in Table A on the Position Profile - Patent Examiner. §§§§
