jobText: TXT/50580032.txt	§Senior Field Application Scientist §§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Field Application Scientist §§Advertiser: §QIAGEN Pty Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§16 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Science & Technology§, §Laboratory & Technical Services§§§§§§QIAGEN Position Profile§Position:          Senior Field Application Scientist, QIAGEN Digital Insights§                        §QIAGEN established QIAGEN Digital Insights (QDI) in 2014 and are worldwide leaders of bioinformatics content, applications and interpretation.  The primary mission of QDI is to integrate and streamline the solutions to provide sample-to-insight workflows to the benefits of our users in the discovery, translational, and clinical fields. § §This is a unique opportunity to join the QDI team responsible for commercialising QIAGEN's bioinformatics products.  The Field Application Scientist (FAS) position allows you to interact with a wide range of researchers across different scientific disciplines to promote software applications and services that provide superior NGS and 'omic data analysis and biological interpretation, and to provide product and scientific advice to key accounts.§ §The FAS will work strategically with QIAGEN Sales and Commercial Partners to support key accounts and early access customers, delivering scientific software demonstrations for groups of various sizes, conduct software evaluations and product training, and other activities to help potential customers understand the value of the QDI portfolio of applications, content, and services. § §This is a field-based role, based ideally in NSW.  Candidates should be prepared to experience periods of up to 60% travel, although average annual levels will be less.§ § §Engage in scientific discussions with customers and cultivate relationships§Train and support new customers§Analyse and interpret large molecular datasets such as DNA-Seq, RNA-Seq, microarray and proteomics data for clinical and basic research purposes§Be the technical expert on QIAGEN Digital Insights Applications and provide scientific presentations, compelling pre-sales product demonstrations, and scientific workshops to showcase the value and effectiveness of QDI solutions § §Position requirements, qualifications and experiences:§ §Ph.D. or equivalent plus 1-2 years of professional experience in bioinformatics, molecular biology or genetics-related fields of study stressing data analysis and biological interpretation of Next Generation Sequencing data, ideally using the QIAGEN CLC Genomics Workbench, or QIAGEN Ingenuity Pathway Analysis (IPA)§Demonstrated excellent written, presentation, and verbal skills including strong public speaking experience §Excellent interpersonal and relationship-building skills §Aptitude for understanding, communicating, and training scientific concepts, applications and methods §Demonstrated exceptional analytical and problem solving skills §Ability to travel between 40-60% of the time, including overnight stays §Ability to multitask a variety of assignments and proven ability to meet strict deadlines §Ability to be flexible and creative, and work in a fast-paced, high-growth environment §Fast, self-starter with the ability to handle and manage multiple tasks in a result-orientated commercial environment§Excellent project and network management skills and strong organisational skills §Experience as a remote, field-based employee desirable§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§Do you have a current Australian driver's licence?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How many years' experience do you have as a laboratory technician?§§§

Strong communication skills, a strong sense of curiosity and a love for problem solving are all critical traits for an examiner.§  §Most importantly you want to learn and apply that learning. You will be supported by a workplace coach through a competency-based training program to enable you to assess patent applications against legislative requirements including whether the invention is new, inventive, and clearly described.  After completing training, you will work independently but as part of a team, you will also be able to identify work group priorities and achieve team goals.§Advantages of being a Patent Examiner:§ § §You will see new ideas and technologies every day – and be responsible for assessing their eligibility for protection under a Patent.§ §You will enhance your critical thinking capability; questioning and analysing to ensure Patents are issued appropriately§ §You will work collaboratively with other scientists and engineers to problem solve and deliver positive outcomes for IP Australia and Australian business, but also have a high level of autonomy in your day-to-day work§ §You continue your learning, maintaining currency in your chosen field§ §You develop knowledge and capability in Patent Law§ §Eligibility requirements:§  §You will need:§ § §a recognised degree in at least one of the technologies areas listed under ‘About the role’§ §Australian Citizenship to be engaged in the APS and to meet IP Australia’s security clearance requirements§ §For more detailed information, including the other disciplines we are recruiting for please refer to the position profile below:§  §Position Profile§  §Would you like to know more?§ § §Access our website and see our § case studies and FAQ’s.§ §For more information check out these videos that showcase two of our Patent Examiners§ §YouTube Video – Vivian§, § YouTube Video – Alex.§ §Join our webinar on how to apply – § details here§ §Information related to the salary range can be found in § IP Australia's Enterprise Agreement 2017 - 2020.§ §Interested? jobText: TXT/50563300.txt	§Technical Sales Executive§§Private Advertiser§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Technical Sales Executive§§Private Advertiser§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§14 Sept 2020§§Location§§Perth§, §Fremantle & Southern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Science & Technology§, §Environmental, Earth & Geosciences§§§§§§At Ecotech, we believe together, we create solutions that shape the future.  We do this by working with our customers to provide bespoke solutions by designing, manufacturing, operating and supplying sophisticated monitoring equipment.  www.ecotech.com§ §We have an exciting opportunity for a tenacious Technical Sales Executive to join our domestic sales team. This role is based in Perth, WA and local regional/interstate travel forms part of the role. Reporting to the WA Sales Manager, the role is varied and covers a range of responsibilities including:§ § §Selling and promoting Ecotech’s monitoring instrumentation, systems and services into WA§ §Identifying opportunities proactively, through new business development and with existing accounts§ §Responding to incoming sales enquiries§ §Developing product knowledge through company literature and other independent sources of technical information§ §Attending conferences, visiting customers and performing training seminars§ §Producing high quality quotes and follow ups while maintaining our CRM system (Salesforce)§ §Account management with regular client contact understanding their needs and pain points§ §Scheduling appointments and preparing thorough meeting notes§ §Reporting Sales forecast and analysis§ § § §Essential to your success will be your:§ § §Proven experience in a business development or Sales role in a B2B environment§ §Experience making cold calls/visits to generate new business opportunities§ §Experience selling scientific instrumentation or complex systems§ §Ability to build solid, long term customer relationships§ §Sound understanding of engineering or scientific instruments§ §Experience in selling technical products and services§ §Ability to work autonomously in a fluid working environment§ §Energy and drive as well as being a team player who relates well with all stakeholder levels§ §Excellent communication, planning and organisation skills§ § § §When looking for new people to join our team, we look for people who share our values, who are like minded, courageous and passionate about their work.  Your enthusiasm and proactive approach will help you to achieve growth targets. If you’re tenacious, hungry and have a customer-oriented mindset then this role is for you. § §This is an outstanding opportunity for an experienced Technical Sales Executive to make a real impact.  If you have the relevant qualifications and experience, please submit your resume and covering letter outlining your skills, experience relevant to this role and what sets you apart.§ § § §Ecotech is an Equal Opportunity Employer§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§How many years' experience do you have as a sales executive?§Do you have a current Australian driver's licence?§What's your expected annual base salary?§Do you have experience in a cold calls sales environment?§§§

jobText: TXT/50614147.txt	§Data Scientist - Natural Language Processing Specialist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Data Scientist - Natural Language Processing Specialist§§Advertiser: §Hypercube Scientific§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§, §CBD, Inner West & Eastern Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Science & Technology§, §Mathematics, Statistics & Information Sciences§§§§§§Hypercube Scientific is a boutique consultancy offering simulation, optimisation and advanced analysis services. We focus on the mining, energy, healthcare, agriculture, and infrastructure sectors and build long term business relationships based on our excellence, integrity, energy and flexibility. Our offices are in Sydney and Perth, and we are open to hiring anywhere in Australia.§ §Due to high demand for our services and an exciting upcoming project, we have an opening for an ambitious scientist to add their keen analytical skills to our ambitious team. We need a Senior Natural Language Processing Specialist to help us push the boundaries of what is possible with assisting clients handling large and complicated sets of documents.§ §You will also get to be involved in our other work: cutting edge simulations of complicated business operations, detailed scheduling and optimisation problems, and quickly drilling down to what can (and cannot) be learned from messy, real-world datasets. In joining Hypercube Scientific, you will gain ground floor access to a fast-moving, dynamic set of business opportunities and be an integral part of the team from day one.§ §We seek enthusiastic and bright candidates with:§ § §Experience in Natural Language Processing§ §Postgraduate qualifications in one of the hard sciences (eg physics, maths, biology or chemistry).§ §Advanced statistical and analytical abilities.§ §Fluency in Python with ability and willingness to learn further tools and packages.§ §2+ years consulting experience preferred§ §Experience developing technical software in a team preferred§ §AWS experience preferred         § §Experience in one of our key sectors preferred§ §In return, we offer:§ § §Flexible, open and open-minded working environment. We are very open to discussing part-time roles or hours compatible with family or other commitments. We do our best to work with you so that you can do your best work with us! We have grown remotely during the pandemic and allow work from home.§ §Collaborative culture - Hypercube is built on integrity, on wanting each team member and each client to succeed.§ §11% super§ §Employee bonuses§ §Call Tom on §0407618552§ or send your CV to §tom@hypercubescientific.com.au§.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§Which of the following programming languages are you experienced in?§Which of the following data analytics tools are you experienced with?§Have you worked in a role which requires experience with statistical modelling?§§§

jobText: TXT/50558267.txt	§Patent Examiner - Medical Devices, Medical Diagnostic Engineers & Scientists§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Patent Examiner - Medical Devices, Medical Diagnostic Engineers & Scientists§§Advertiser: §IP Australia§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§14 Sept 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Salary§§$76,583.00§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Science & Technology§, §Biological & Biomedical Sciences§§§§§§Please note: all positions are located in Canberra§ § §Calling all Medical Device, Medical Diagnostic Engineers and Scientists§ §Read on to learn about applying your technical knowledge in a new field§ §Excellent working conditions, job security, genuine flexibility, and work/life balance§ §About the Agency§  §IP Australia is an Australian Government Agency that’s a little bit different. We work with Australians to help them protect their Intellectual Property.  We have a strong sense of purpose, ensuring Australians benefit from great ideas.§  §About the role§  §As a Patent Examiner you will see cutting edge ideas and technologies and apply your technical knowledge, research, and analytical skills to assess these inventions.  You will be the public face of our organisation, working with individuals, patent attorneys, businesses to protect their Intellectual Property rights. You will engage in a specialised training program to hone and develop your critical thinking, analysis, and communication abilities in this context.§Our Medical Devices, Medical Diagnostic Engineers & Scientists team in Canberra are looking for people with knowledge in one or more of the below areas:§ § §Medical imaging, diagnostics, neurostimulation, bio-signal recording and processing, medical implants and prosthetics, and biomechanical devices.§ §About you§  §To be successful you must love your field of expertise, be passionate about innovation and have excellent reasoning and judgement. Strong communication skills, a strong sense of curiosity and a love for problem solving are all critical traits for an examiner.§  §Most importantly you want to learn and apply that learning. You will be supported by a workplace coach through a competency-based training program to enable you to assess patent applications against legislative requirements including whether the invention is new, inventive, and clearly described.  After completing training, you will work independently but as part of a team, you will also be able to identify work group priorities and achieve team goals.§Advantages of being a Patent Examiner:§ § §You will see new ideas and technologies every day – and be responsible for assessing their eligibility for protection under a Patent.§ §You will enhance your critical thinking capability; questioning and analysing to ensure Patents are issued appropriately§ §You will work collaboratively with other scientists and engineers to problem solve and deliver positive outcomes for IP Australia and Australian business, but also have a high level of autonomy in your day-to-day work§ §You continue your learning, maintaining currency in your chosen field§ §You develop knowledge and capability in Patent Law§ §Eligibility requirements:§  §You will need:§ § §a recognised degree in at least one of the technologies areas listed under ‘About the role’§ §Australian Citizenship to be engaged in the APS and to meet IP Australia’s security clearance requirements§ §For more detailed information, including the other disciplines we are recruiting for please refer to the position profile below:§  §Position Profile§  §Would you like to know more?§ § §Access our website and see our § case studies and FAQ’s.§ §For more information check out these videos that showcase two of our Patent Examiners§ §YouTube Video – Vivian§, § YouTube Video – Alex.§ §Join our webinar on how to apply – § details here§ §Information related to the salary range can be found in § IP Australia's Enterprise Agreement 2017 - 2020.§ §Interested? We’d love to hear from you.§  §Please reach out to the IP Australia Recruitment Solutions team if you have any questions about the application process via §recruitment@ipaustralia.gov.au§  §If you have specific questions relating to the position please reach out to the relevant Contact Officer – details found in Table A on the Position Profile - Patent Examiner. §  § §§§§

jobTitle: Patent Examiner - Medical Devices, Medical Diagnostic Engineers & Scientists Job in Brisbane - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50558245.txt	§Patent Examiner - Medical Devices, Medical Diagnostic Engineers & Scientists§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Patent Examiner - Medical Devices, Medical Diagnostic Engineers & Scientists§§Advertiser: §IP Australia§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§14 Sept 2020§§Location§§Brisbane§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Salary§§$76,583.00§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Science & Technology§, §Biological & Biomedical Sciences§§§§§§Please note: all positions are located in Canberra§ § §Calling all Medical Device, Medical Diagnostic Engineers and Scientists§ §Read on to learn about applying your technical knowledge in a new field§ §Excellent working conditions, job security, genuine flexibility, and work/life balance§ §About the Agency§  §IP Australia is an Australian Government Agency that’s a little bit different. We work with Australians to help them protect their Intellectual Property.  We have a strong sense of purpose, ensuring Australians benefit from great ideas.§  §About the role§  §As a Patent Examiner you will see cutting edge ideas and technologies and apply your technical knowledge, research, and analytical skills to assess these inventions.  You will be the public face of our organisation, working with individuals, patent attorneys, businesses to protect their Intellectual Property rights. You will engage in a specialised training program to hone and develop your critical thinking, analysis, and communication abilities in this context.§Our Medical Devices, Medical Diagnostic Engineers & Scientists team in Canberra are looking for people with knowledge in one or more of the below areas:§ § §Medical imaging, diagnostics, neurostimulation, bio-signal recording and processing, medical implants and prosthetics, and biomechanical devices.§ §About you§  §To be successful you must love your field of expertise, be passionate about innovation and have excellent reasoning and judgement. Strong communication skills, a strong sense of curiosity and a love for problem solving are all critical traits for an examiner.§  §Most importantly you want to learn and apply that learning. You will be supported by a workplace coach through a competency-based training program to enable you to assess patent applications against legislative requirements including whether the invention is new, inventive, and clearly described.  After completing training, you will work independently but as part of a team, you will also be able to identify work group priorities and achieve team goals.§Advantages of being a Patent Examiner:§ § §You will see new ideas and technologies every day – and be responsible for assessing their eligibility for protection under a Patent.§ §You will enhance your critical thinking capability; questioning and analysing to ensure Patents are issued appropriately§ §You will work collaboratively with other scientists and engineers to problem solve and deliver positive outcomes for IP Australia and Australian business, but also have a high level of autonomy in your day-to-day work§ §You continue your learning, maintaining currency in your chosen field§ §You develop knowledge and capability in Patent Law§ §Eligibility requirements:§  §You will need:§ § §a recognised degree in at least one of the technologies areas listed under ‘About the role’§ §Australian Citizenship to be engaged in the APS and to meet IP Australia’s security clearance requirements§ §For more detailed information, including the other disciplines we are recruiting for please refer to the position profile below:§  §Position Profile§  §Would you like to know more?§ § §Access our website and see our § case studies and FAQ’s.§ §For more information check out these videos that showcase two of our Patent Examiners§ §YouTube Video – Vivian§, § YouTube Video – Alex.§ §Join our webinar on how to apply – § details here§ §Information related to the salary range can be found in § IP Australia's Enterprise Agreement 2017 - 2020.§ §Interested? We’d love to hear from you.§  §Please reach out to the IP Australia Recruitment Solutions team if you have any questions about the application process via §recruitment@ipaustralia.gov.au§  §If you have specific questions relating to the position please reach out to the relevant Contact Officer – details found in Table A on the Position Profile - Patent Examiner. §  § §§§§

jobTitle: Natural Areas Project Coordinator Job in Newcastle, Maitland & Hunter - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50595308.txt	§Natural Areas Project Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Natural Areas Project Coordinator§§Advertiser: §Lake Macquarie City Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§18 Sept 2020§§Location§§Newcastle, Maitland & Hunter§§Salary§§$92,889 - $100,003 plus 12% superannuation§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Science & Technology§, §Environmental, Earth & Geosciences§§§§§§Permanent Full time§ § §Balance life’s priorities – 35-hour week with flexible working conditions§ §Career defining leadership opportunity§ §Contribute to the community and council’s strategic and operational targets§ §Your opportunity to enhance the quality and influence the protection of Lake Macquarie’s natural environment.§  §LET’S EXPLORE THE JOB§Council has a unique opportunity for a passionate and capable environmental specialist to lead our Natural Areas Project team. You will guide a significant portfolio of environmental projects and programs for advancing natural resource management.§  §You will lead a high performing team who will carry out Bushfire Hazard Reduction works on asset protection zones and project works within Natural Areas, including vegetation rehabilitation in natural area reserves, riparian zones, natural foreshores, escarpments and beaches.§  §Reporting to the §Section Manager City Presentation§ you will:§ § §Coordinate and manage the implementation of the forward works program for the bush regeneration and bushfire mitigation teams§ §Provide leadership, direction and guidance to the Natural Area team in order to motivate staff and achieve objectives and to effectively deliver the works in a safe, timely, environmentally conscious and cost-effective manner§ §Identify, develop, review and maintain procedures and risk assessments, and ensure employees are aware of and comply with all relevant Council procedures and relevant legislative requirements§ §Undertake site assessments for identified natural areas and make recommendations for the restoration of degraded site values§ §Assist in the preparation and management of Natural Areas Project team budgets by constant review to ensure the teams objectives are met within budget § §Undertake business improvement activities by utilising data and observations to continuously review and improve processes, customer experience, resource management and performance§ §Please note: A full list of accountabilities is located within the attached Position Statement.§ § §LET’S DESCRIBE YOU§  §Our ideal candidate is an innovative environmental specialist who is on the front foot when it comes to the latest trends, practical experience and best practice in environmental management and bushfire mitigation works. You have strong programming, planning and financial acumen skills with the ability to ensure multiple projects are delivered within scope. You will encourage ecologically sustainable approaches to work programs and operations, and embed a strong safety culture and continuous improvement outlook across your team. You are also a proven leader with the ability to manage, bring people with you and engage your team in work that they see as valuable and enjoyable.§  §Specifically, you will be able to address the below criteria: § § §Tertiary qualifications in Natural Resource Management, Environmental Science, Environmental Education and/or demonstrated equivalent professional experience§ §Demonstrated ability to lead and develop a multi-skilled team in delivering works and services to a high standard of cost competitiveness, quality and timeliness§ §High level interpersonal, communication and negotiation skills with the proven ability to influence teams in order to deliver projects and meet objectives§ §Demonstrated experience in the scheduling and resourcing of an operational work team in a dynamic environment§ §Proven report writing skills and understanding of monitoring, evaluation, reporting and improvement (MERI) requirements for natural area management projects§ §Demonstrated skills in developing and managing projects including preparing and managing project budgets   §Please note: A full list of criteria is located within the attached Position Statement.§ § §LET’S REVEAL THE PERKS§ § §Competitive salary $92,889 - $100,003 per year plus 12% superannuation§ §Leaseback vehicle§ §Flexible working hours§ §Long service leave after just 5 years§ §Generous social club, wellbeing program and employee assistance program (EAP)§ §Annual flu vaccination program§ §Employee education assistance§ §Training and staff development programs§ §Supportive, empowering, innovative and collaborative work environment with close access to the Section Manager and technical professionals§ §Shape Lake Mac and be involved in a diverse range of projects including – rehabilitation works, biodiversity site increase species, rid of weed species§ §Best of both worlds - work in the office and the outdoors§ § § §LET’S TALK ABOUT US§ §When you join us, you are not part of an organisation; you are part of a future that more than 205,000 Lake Macquarie residents depend on every day. To work here is to be connected. To be part of a true community who value creativity and collaboration, wellbeing and sustainability, opportunity and diversity. Together, we believe in shaping our own future - not waiting for it.§  §Lake Mac strives to be an inclusive workplace for all people. We recognise that we operate in a diverse community and welcome and encourage applications from all ages and genders, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, people from culturally diverse backgrounds, the LGBTIQ+ community, refugees and people with disability. We understand the skills and attributes veterans can bring to our Council.§  §LET’S START§  §Position Statement – Natural Areas Project §Coordinator§ § §Applications close Midnight, Sunday 11 October 2020§ §For more information on the position, please contact Kirrily Vincer, §Section Manager City Presentation§, on §02 4921 0795§ or via email kvincer@lakemac.nsw.gov.au§ §If you require assistance with submitting your application, please contact Georgina Green, §Talent Acquisition Officer§, on §02 4921 0495§ or via email ggreen@lakemac.nsw.gov.au§ §Please note that as part of Lake Macquarie City Council’s recruitment process, prior to an offer of employment being made, recommended candidates may be subject to a medical assessment with Council’s doctor.§ §After the close date, a panel will assess all applications for suitability against the essential criteria for the position. Once completed, an interview, skills assessment or task and reference checks may be undertaken. All candidates will be notified of the outcome via the email address you supply as part of your application.§ § §§§§

Make It With Pride.§ §As a senior member of the management team, you ensure that technical, scientific and business programs are successfully delivered and that resources are effectively managed. You regularly interact with senior-level clients and the technical and scientific community.§ § §How you will contribute§ §You will translate business needs into robust scientific research strategies and lead your team to successfully apply existing technology or discover new science, using internal expertise and external partners to accelerate consumer-centric innovation and efficiency. In addition, you will build a balanced project portfolio, effectively managing human and financial targets. In this role, you will use your influencing skills to partner with senior leaders, communicating the impact and benefits of long-term research. You will also help create a culture of collaboration across the global community, identifying and applying best practices and ways of working and protect intellectual property to build a competitive advantage. As a people leader, you will grow a diverse talent base that meets our business needs and helps build the global pool of R&D talent.§ § §What you will bring§ §A desire to drive your future and accelerate your career and the following experience and knowledge:§ §Ensuring that research programs drive commercial outcomes, ideally in a fast-moving consumer goods environment§ §Influencing business strategy through critical thinking and technical thought leadership§ §Working collaboratively across functions, geographies and with internal and external partners to land the agenda§ §Coaching and mentoring others§ §Creating a culture of technical curiosity and collaboration§ §In this position you will:§ §Be responsible for the delivery of RDQ technical programs (including new product development, productivity, quality improvement, sustainability and wellbeing) for the Chocolate category in ANZ & Japan (ANZJ), in line with local and global objectives.§ §Effectively partner with the Business Unit (BU) President and Leadership team for ANZJ, to develop and deliver strategic plan imperatives, drive annual contract delivery, team engagement, and integration of existing and future operational units.  § §Actively develop chocolate tablet programs and technologies to address the regional BU needs for Asia Middle East Africa (AMEA), partnering with the global Chocolate Platform Leads and Technical Centre Network.§ §   §What extra ingredients you will bring:§ §Demonstrated experience leading teams, managing budgets & resources at a senior level within RDQ (food experience advantageous)§ §The ability to build and maintain strong internal and external relationships, leveraging these to effectively influence business decisions  § §A consumer centric approach, putting our consumers at the heart of everything you do§ §A true passion for building strong teams, with a key focus on OH&S, engagement and development across the broader ANZ RDQ team.§ §A strong technical background, with tertiary qualifications in a technical food related discipline§ § §Headquartered in Singapore, Mondelēz International’s Asia, Middle East and Africa (AMEA) region is comprised of six business units, has more than 21,000 employees and operates in more than 27 countries including Australia, China, Indonesia, Ghana, India, Japan, Malaysia, New Zealand, Nigeria, Philippines, Saudi Arabia, South Africa, Thailand, United Arab Emirates and Vietnam. Seventy-six nationalities work across a network of more than 35 manufacturing plants, three global research and development technical centers and in offices stretching from Auckland, New Zealand to Casablanca, Morocco. Mondelēz International in the AMEA region is the proud maker of global and local iconic brands such as §Oreo §and §belVita§ biscuits, §Kinh Do §mooncakes, §Cadbury, Cadbury Dairy Milk§ and §Milka§ chocolate, §Halls§ candy, §Stride§ gum, §Tang§ powdered beverage and §Philadelphia§ cheese. We are also proud to be named a Top Employer in many of our markets.§ § §Mondelēz International is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation or preference, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.§§§§

global policy framework to support changing business needs including scalability to different regions and business models§Partner with business process owners to evaluate, and simplify processes Our Research & Technology team develop new and improve existing products and processes by applying technical, food science and culinary skills.§ §Key role responsibilities include:§ §Design, develop, organise and manage major and complex innovation and renovation projects simultaneously, whilst ensuring precise and appropriate documentation§Provide proactive, differentiating and cost-effective product development solutions as well as best practice, support and training across all product categories. Support innovation in the development of new ideas or new product platforms through  ideation sessions and bench top experimentation, along with the ability to effectively communicate these concepts.§Lead, support and develop your direct report, whilst also supporting and building the technical knowledge of the wider product development team.§Support labelling, nutritional, regulatory, quality and food safety efforts.§Evaluate ingredients and processing techniques to identify and commercialise product improvement and cost reduction opportunities.§Provide technical guidance to our internal and external manufacturing sites§Identify, frame and pilot new business opportunities in all categories in conjunction with Marketing, Insights and Supply Chain.   § §Skills, experience & attributes sought:§Coupled with the above, we’re looking for an individual who is super passionate about what they do with a strong desire to be a part of a team who want to deliver exciting new foods to the market.  You will need to be a self-starter who enjoys and thrives in a fast-paced and sometimes ambiguous environment.  We’re a business that is strong on relationships and this role will see you working with multi-disciplinary teams on innovation and renovation projects.§ §Relevant tertiary qualification – in Food Science/Technology, Chemistry or related fields§Significant product development and implementation experience gained from the food industry.  Experience in cereal, snacks and/or baking is desirable. §Knowledge and experience with ingredient functionality, product design and formulation, process technology and commercialisation§Solid knowledge and understanding of food chemistry, food processing and food functionality§Excellent attention to detail and project management skills to meet deliverables through the life cycle of projects, delivering on time and to the highest quality.§Strong organisation skills – you will work on a number of active and future projects at any one time so you will have the ability to ensure momentum on all projects  §Strong commercial and business acumen§Ability to work collaboratively with multi-functional teams, building strong relationships§Excellent written and verbal communication skills§Someone who is agile and resilient, a self-starter who enjoys a challenge§A passion for food and the food technology and innovation environment!      §Benefits, culture & company:§We’re a company that makes great food and we hire great people!  § §Since first establishing in Australia in 1924, we have grown as an organisation and whilst our range of products has expanded our over-arching goal is still the same, to nourish with our foods.   § §Our K values (integrity & respect, accountability, passion, simplicity, success and humility and hunger) shape our Kellogg culture and guide the way the business is run.§ §We offer our employees competitive salaries including performance related bonuses and incentives, free on-site car parking, a focus on work/life balance and we enjoy half day Fridays!  As an individual you can grow and develop your career with the support of your Manager and development programs.  The benefit of a global organization is you can take your career off-shore.§ §Kellogg (Aust) Pty Ltd is an Equal Opportunity Employer that aims to provide an inclusive work environment involving everyone and embracing the diverse talent of its people.§ §§§§§

ChemSkill§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§10 Sept 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §Western Suburbs§§Salary§§Negotiable Hourly Rate Based on Experience!§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Science & Technology§, §Chemistry & Physics§§§§§§CLIENT§  §Our client is listed on the ASX and SGX and is a specialist provider of asset intelligence services and metering solutions for essential electrical, gas and water infrastructure across the Asia-Pacific region. One arm of this multinational business, provides  comprehensive oil and gas chemical testing services covering a wide variety of both routine and non-routine analyses.  §  §Our client prides themselves on innovation, setting high industry standards and collaborating with their clients to exceed their expectations. Due to the demand for their services, they are seeking an experienced Analytical Chemist to join their §Laboratories in Melbourne on a 12 month contract §base with a strong view to permanency§.§  § §  §ROLE§  §Our client has been undertaking chemical analysis for the utility and manufacturing industries for over 60 years and they place great stock in the integrity of their historical asset database. This history and their independence make them a leader in their field when it comes to analytical experience and the interpretation of test results. §  §The person in this role will be responsible for the chemical and electrical analyses of insulating media from a variety of sources and associated equipment.§  §Due to COVID-19, our client's laboratory runs a 3-week rotation shift to allow for social distancing. Please ring for more details on how this is conducted during stage 4 restrictions in Melbourne.§  §The key responsibilities of this role will involve following:§ § §Quality Control of products § §Use of GC - Head Space § §Testing of insulating oils using UPLC§ §Physical testing of products such as oil colour and appearance§ §Assisting in the development and implementation of new test methodologies§ §Calibrating and maintaining equipment as necessary to ensure quality accreditation standards. § §Providing accurate and timely data reports for analysis by various stakeholders§ §Ensuring that all work is completed in accordance with the relevant quality, workplace safety and test standards, including the application of all relevant MSDS's§ § §  §SELECTION CRITERIA§  §We are looking for a team player who is motivated and driven to meet targets and goals!§  §In-order to qualify for this exciting and rare opportunity, you will need to meet the following criteria:§ § §A Science Degree majoring in Applied or Analytical Chemistry or similar§ §Two years of experience as an Analytical Chemist in a quality focused testing laboratory§ §Practical and theoretical knowledge of analytical instrumentation such as GC and UPLC§ §Experience with Waters Empower software§ §Proven experience with wet-chemistry and physical testing§ §Must have good eye for detail and an appreciation for safety in the work place§ §Excellent communication skills - you will be liaising with personnel of all levels of the company§ §MUST be a good team player and reliable!§ §You must be flexible in your approach and able to cope with changes in priorities.§ §High level of self-motivation and problem-solving capabillity§ §Ability to exercise individual judgement and initiative in the application of scientific principles, techniques and methods§ §Excellent time management skills, attention to detail and a strong ability to multi-task.§ §Key to this role will be your flexible "can do" attitude, excellent work ethic and initiative whilst working autonomously or as part of a team§ §This is a great opportunity and the right candidate will be rewarded with a competitive hourly rate, comprehensive training and a rewarding career.§  § §  §APPLICATIONS§  §To discuss this position, please call Jo on §0411 197 171§.§  §Please send your Resume along with a Cover Letter addressing the Selection Criteria to CS Executive Group by using the "APPLY" button below.  All applications will be treated in the strictest confidence. §  § §  §THANK YOU§  §We would like to thank you for taking the time to apply for this role. Unfortunately, due to the large volume of applications we receive daily, we cannot contact all candidates.  Please note, however, if you are not successful on this occasion, your resume will remain on our database and you may be contacted for other roles.§  §For more opportunities, please visit our website on www.csexecutivegroup.com§  § §§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50562191.txt	§Postdoctoral Research Fellow / Research Fellow (Multiple Positions)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Postdoctoral Research Fellow / Research Fellow (Multiple Positions)§§Advertiser: §The University of Queensland§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§14 Sept 2020§§Location§§Brisbane§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Science & Technology§, §Biotechnology & Genetics§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Postdoctoral Research Fellow / Research Fellow (Multiple Positions) §      §        §§        §Institute for Molecular Bioscience§        §IMB§ is a global leader in multidisciplinary life sciences research, bringing together 500 researchers from across the globe for disease discovery, application and sustainable futures. §        §Formed in 2000 as an initiative of The University of Queensland, State and Federal Governments and private philanthropy, §IMB§ is one of the largest life sciences institutes in the Asia-Pacific region. It has capitalised on one of the greatest periods of discovery in history – the genetic and molecular basis of life and its diversity.§        §About This Opportunity§        §A Postdoctoral Research Fellow and/or Research Fellow is sought engage in research and grow their research profile within the Program in Complex Trait Genomics (PCTG). The Program in Complex Trait Genomics (website: htttp://cnsgenomics.com) is a joint initiative between the Institute for Molecular Bioscience (IMB) and the Queensland Brain Institute (QBI). The broad research focus is towards a better understanding of complex traits and disorders, including psychiatric and neurological disorders. A key research strength is the development of underpinning computational and statistical analysis methods.§        §Research in the Program covers four major themes: Statistical Genomics, Systems Genomics, Psychiatric Genomics and Motor Neuron Disease Genomics. Over the next 5 years the PCTG has a particular focus on:§        §          §Multivariate whole genome estimation and prediction analysis of genomics data§This project will require the development of statistical methods and computer algorithms to perform multivariate association analysis in large samples, to address questions of co-morbidity and pleiotropy. It requires skills in the manipulation and analysis of large datasets, and ability to write computer code. It also requires a solid understanding of statistical methods.§        §        §          §Quantification of the genetic architecture of common disease from whole-genome-sequence (WGS) data§The contribution of rare variants to common disease and quantitative traits is not well understood. In this project, WGS data will be used for computer simulation and real data analyses to address questions about the genetics and evolution of complex traits. The project will require skills in the manipulation and analysis of large datasets and in computer simulations.§        §        §          §Biobank science§Around the world there are an increasing number of biobanks with data that are available to researchers. These biobanks contain data on multiple phenotypes, including electronic health records, as well as whole-genome genetic data. Biobanks facilitate questions to be addressed about the nature and nurture of complex traits, the genetic architecture of disease and comorbidity, genetic epidemiology and the genetics of traits across multiple ancestries. Skills required of these projects include the ability to develop new ideas and skills in ‘big data’ analysis.§        §        §These positions are primarily located at our §picturesque St Lucia campus§ but flexible off-campus working arrangements (based within Australia) can be negotiated.§        §Our Ideal Candidate§        §Our ideal candidate will be highly motivated to contribute their expertise to the PCTG research program.  A PhD in statistical genetics, quantitative genetics, bioinformatics, computer programming, statistics, econometrics or other relevant areas in addition to knowledge or expertise in the principles of genetics and genomics, and linear model methodology, is essential to the role. A strong background in statistics and a proven ability to code efficiently in low-level programming languages (eg., C/C++) will be highly advantageous. §        §As part of the PCTG our ideal candidate will possess demonstrated high-level communication and interpersonal skills including the ability to effectively collaborate and will demonstrate evidence of research productivity.§        §Knowledge or expertise in one or more of the following areas is desirable:§        §          §Quantitative genetics models and theories§          §The development and application of multi-marker methods§          §The analysis of large-scale SNP array and whole genome sequencing data§          §Analysis of large-scale genetic data§          §Integrative analysis of omics data§        §        §We value diversity and inclusion, and actively encourage applications from those who bring diversity to the University. Our §Diversity and Inclusion webpage§ contains further information if you require additional support. Accessibility requirements and/or adjustments can be directed to §recruitment@uq.edu.au§.§        §What We Can Offer§        §There are multiple full-time, fixed term positions available for up to two years, at Academic level A or B.§        §For Level A: The full-time equivalent base salary will be in the range $69,342.89 - $92,782.26, plus super of up to 17%. The total FTE package will be in the range $81,131.18 - $108,555.25.§        §For Level B: The full-time equivalent base salary will be in the range $97,590.98 - $115,888.95 plus super of up to 17%. The total FTE package will be in the range $114,181.44 - $135,590.08.§        §You will be able to take advantage of §UQ Sport Facilities§, recreation leave loading, salary sacrificing options, on-campus childcare, discounted private health insurance, cheap parking, §development programs§ and many other benefits.§        §For further information, please review §The University of Queensland's Enterprise Bargaining Agreement 2018-2021§.§        §Position Description§        § §511267_Postdoctoral Research Fellow_PD.pdf§        §Questions?§        §To discuss this role please contact Professor Naomi Wray at §naomi.wray@uq.edu.au§ or Professor Peter Visscher at peter.visscher@uq.edu.au.§        §For application queries, please contact §recruitment@uq.edu.au§ stating the job number in the subject line.§        §Want to Apply?§        §To submit an application for this role, use the apply button. Reporting to the Production / Quality Coordinator, you will ensure that our products are produced in a safe, timely and cost effective manner that meets quality and food safety standards.§ §You will be responsible for overseeing the complete operation of your department according to internal procedures.§ § §To succeed in this role, you will have:§ § §Extensive experience in the industry with relevant qualifications§ §A Passion for product development§ §The ability to organize and lead production trials§ §A good knowledge in all aspects of Food Hygiene and WHS§ §The ability to work fast paced and under pressure to meet production demands§ §Excellent communication and interpersonal skills§ §The ability to demonstrate a high degree of accuracy§ §A flexible, adaptable and hands-on approach, willing to work as part of a team§ §           Key responsibilities§ § §Product development of Bakery Goods§ §Provide Technical assistance and support to production staff§ §Training, developing and coordinating the production team§ §Identify and implement continuous process improvements§ §Troubleshooting production issues§ §Managing labour efficiency§ §Ensuring consistent high standards of product quality§ §Ensure procedures are followed at all times§ §Develop strong working relationships within all areas of the business§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§What's your expected annual base salary?§What's the largest size team you have managed?§How many years' experience do you have as a production supervisor?§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: 2021 Undergraduate Health, Safety, Environment and Quality Internship - Kilsyth Job in Yarra Valley & High Country - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50541727.txt	§2021 Undergraduate Health, Safety, Environment and Quality Internship - Kilsyth§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§2021 Undergraduate Health, Safety, Environment and Quality Internship - Kilsyth§§Advertiser: §Cummins Inc§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§10 Sept 2020§§Location§§Yarra Valley & High Country§§Salary§§Fully paid 13 month undergraduate internship§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Science & Technology§, §Environmental, Earth & Geosciences§§§§§§If you are an undergraduate OHS or Environment student looking to jump start your career, we are offering a 13-month full time internship based at our Cummins Filtration Kilsyth branch. § § § §Your opportunity to power your potential starts here!§ § § § §About Cummins § § §Cummins Inc., a global technology leader, is a corporation of complementary business segments that designs, manufactures, distributes and services a broad portfolio of power solutions. The company’s products range from diesel and natural gas engines to hybrid and electric platforms, as well as related technologies, including transmissions, battery systems, fuel systems, controls, air handling, filtration, emission solutions, and power generation systems. Headquartered in Columbus, Indiana (U.S.), since its founding in 1919, Cummins employs approximately 62,600 people in approximately 190 countries and territories.  § §  § §What’s in it for you?§ §Cummins will help set you up for success and your future career as you develop your theoretical knowledge into practical skills while contributing meaningfully to the operation of our multi-billion dollar business. Gain real word, practical experience! § § § §About the role§ § §Our Cummins Filtration Kilsyth branch is offering a rare 13-month full time Quality and HSE Internship opportunity commencing 1st of February 2020 for a current OHS or Environment  undergraduate student.§ §  § §“What Will You Do”§ § § §Liaising with key internal stakeholders § §Data management, analysis & report writing § §Take ownership for our non-conformity system and processes (following training) § §Prepare and present status reports for material board review § §Development, evaluation improvement of documenting manufacturing processes & flow § §Product and process quality improvement through structured problem-solving methodologies § §Participate in community involvement teams § §Supporting the HSE South Pacific team with some project work  § §Conducting research and investigation for projects in specific areas of Health, Safety and environment  § §Supporting the development of training packages and kits for the Regional leaders  § §Managing the completion of project reporting on a monthly and quarterly basis with the Regional Health, Safety and Environment leaders § §Understanding of HSE or Quality Standards and involvement in compliance audits, legal and systems § §Preparing and publishing the monthly Health, Safety and Environment reports  § § § §Eligibility Requirements§ § §To qualify for this internship, it is essential that you: § § §Are currently studying an undergraduate OHS or Environment Degree§ §Have between 1 and 8 units of study left to complete of your Bachelors degree as of February 2020 § §Are available for the full 13 months and be willing to defer your studies for that duration § §Possess Australian Citizenship or Permanent Residency § §  § §Note: Applicants that do not meet these qualifying requirements unfortunately will not be considered.§ § §  § §To be successful in this role, you will possess: § § §A keen interest in the OHS and Environment analysis  § §Technical strength in statistics and numerical analysis § §A confident, outgoing approach to seek out necessary information to achieve set outcomes § §A keen interest in developing your HSE knowledge to complement your HSE or non HSE Degree  § §Be interested in the development and delivery of projects  § §Ability to engage and develop strong stakeholder relationships with a remotely located national team   § §Clear communication skills, both written and verbal  § §Time management skills and ability to multi-task  § §An interest and willingness to learn and develop new skills in a diverse organisation  § §Ability to understand and maintain confidentiality  § §Strong computer literacy and a strong working knowledge of Microsoft Office suite  § §Valid car driving license highly preferred  § § § §How to apply§ § §Applications close midnight Sunday the 4th of October 2020. § § §For all applications please submit your resume, cover letter and academic transcript via the link provided § §In your cover letter, please specify how many units of study you have remaining on your degree and your motivation behind applying both to Cummins and this specific internship § §  § §Note: We will be unable to assess your application without all of the required documents, so please ensure you attach your resume, cover letter and academic transcripts at the time of application.§ § §  § §At Cummins, we are an equal opportunity employer dedicated to diversity in the workplace. Our policy is to provide equal employment opportunities to all qualified persons without regard to race, gender, colour, disability, national origin, age, religion, union affiliation, sexual orientation, veteran status, citizenship, gender identity and/or expression, or other status protected by law.§ § § §§§§

planning, risk analysis, surveillance, monitoring and control programs for plant diseases of state and national significance.§        §The successful applicant will be an experienced professional who will work under general direction, using initiative and independent judgement, and will have demonstrated ability to critically review plant disease information to prepare scientifically-based advice for policy development.§        §You will also be required to maintain information in database applications including databases supporting declaration of organisms under the Biosecurity and Agriculture Management Act 2007(BAM Act 2007) and the Western Australian Organisms list (WAOL).§        §Key responsibilities include:§        §          §Assists with provision of scientifically-based risk analysis and pathology input to plant biosecurity programs.§          §Participates in risk assessments for plant pathogens and assists with development of intra and interstate phytosanitary policy in accordance with national and international phytosanitary agreements.§          §Assists with submissions to national and state risk assessments and policy reviews prepared by the Commonwealth and other State and Territory governments to protect Western Australia’s plant industries from exotic plant pathogens.§          §Maintains an up-to-date knowledge and awareness of relevant plant pathology research, development findings, issues and trends.§          §Participate in emergency responses as required.§        §        §Please refer to the Job Description Form attached for full position details.§        §Eligibility / Other Conditions§        §To be eligible for a permanent appointment to the Western Australian public sector you must be an Australian citizen or have permanent residency status in Australia. To be eligible for a fixed term or a casual appointment you must have documentary evidence of your entitlement to live and work in Australia for the period of the contract and this is required as part of your application.§        §A Bachelor degree in Agricultural science, or approved equivalent with undergraduate training in plant pathology, or equivalent relevant experience§        §Subject to appointment, successful applicants will be required to:§        §          §provide evidence of eligibility to work in Australia for the term of the vacancy before commencing employment;§          §obtain and provide a current National Police Certificate (police clearance) before commencing employment;§        §        §          §complete the Department’s induction program within three months of commencement.§        §        §This position is located in South Perth.§        §Please note, any successful candidate, including current employees of the Department of Primary Industries and Regional Development, will be offered employment subject to the award and agreement conditions that apply to the advertised role as outlined in the attached JD§F/s. The position will support CSIRO Mineral’s growing commitment to map systems at all scales in collaboration with the Australian mining and exploration industry.§ § The Research Scientist will use their knowledge in 3D modelling, petrology, mineralogy, mineral chemistry, geochemistry and geology of Iron Ore systems and combine it with results of various micro analytical techniques.§            §          §          §            §Your duties will include:§            §              §                §Incorporate novel approaches to scientific investigations by adapting and/or developing original concepts and ideas for new, existing and further research.§                §Operate mineralogical and geochemical analytical equipment in the field and laboratory.§                §Produce high quality scientific and/or engineering papers suitable for publication in quality journals and for presentation at national and international conferences.§              §Location:§ Kensington, WA§ § §Salary:§ AU$113k - AU$132k plus up to 15.4% superannuation§ § §Tenure:§ Specified term of 3 years§ § §Reference:§ 69447§            §          §          §            §To be considered you will need:§            §              §                §A doctorate and/or equivalent research experience in the field of geosciences, along with a record of capability to write high quality reports and/or publications in peer reviewed journals.§                §Experience in generating 3D geological models using drill hole geochemistry, downhole geophysics, and geological mapping. Experience using Leapfrog, GoCAD, Vulcan software as well as implicit modelling such as Map2Loop and geomodeller is welcome.§                §Experience in interpreting downhole/airborne geophysical data and geochemistry to define stratigraphy and overlying weathering mantle§                §Ability to apply studies of microscale processes and geochronology results to exploration for ore systems§                §Demonstrated ability to work within a multi-disciplinary research team, plus the motivation and discipline to carry out autonomous research, to achieve organisational goals.§                §Experience working in the minerals industry or in research projects with industry support, particularly in work experience relevant to iron ore systems§              § For full details about this role please review the §Position Description§            §          §          §            §Eligibility§            §The successful applicant will be required to obtain and provide a National Police Check or equivalent.§          §          §            §Flexible Working Arrangements§            §We work flexibly at CSIRO, offering a range of options for how, when and where you work. jobText: TXT/50710266.txt	§Senior Environmental Planner/ Scientist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Environmental Planner/ Scientist§§Advertiser: §Cardno§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Perth§, §CBD, Inner & Western Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Science & Technology§, §Environmental, Earth & Geosciences§§§§§§§The role§Due to continued job growth, Cardno’s Water & Environment team are currently seeking interest from highly motivated Environmental Planners / Scientists to join our busy team. Joining an established team of Environmental professionals, you will provide environmental advice, permits and approvals for a wide cross section of clients and projects.§ § Located in West Perth, you will be part of a social and dynamic office that values their people and communities. Our office is in walking distance to Kings Park and Elizabeth Quay, as well as being only a short bus ride to our Central Business District.§ § Your responsibilities will include -§ §Leading and preparing environmental approvals documentation, environmental impact assessments and environmental management plans, using knowledge of WA and Federal environmental legislation, current industry standards, and approval processes.§Provision of specific technical input into studies and major projects as appropriate§Leading and preparing technical written reports to support project outcomes§Client and regulator liaison to achieve project objectives§Draw on existing client relationships and build new client relationships to further develop our Western Australian business§Lead and prepare proposal documentation§Ensure financial outcomes of assignments are achieved through effective project management§Work part of a multidisciplinary and cohesive team to successfully deliver environmental approvals services to our clients, across a wide range of sectors.§Supports and models HSE initiatives§About you§To be successful you will display -§ §Tertiary qualifications in Environmental Science/ Environmental Planning / Environmental Engineering or related discipline§Demonstrated 7-10 years relevant practical experience, preferably within the consulting industry§Thorough knowledge of relevant legislation and standards, particularly in the Western Australian and Federal regulatory environment§Demonstrated experience in the preparation of regulatory approvals documentation for a range of infrastructure projects. Additional experience in the resources and transport sector would be desirable, but not essential.§Professional standards of technical report writing§Flexibility and the ability to prioritise work as required§Ability to lead project teams§Well-developed interpersonal skills to work within a team environment§A positive and proactive attitude§Why join Cardno?§Cardno has a focus on you. You will be trusted and empowered in a role that can be tailored in a flexible way. We are a performance based organisation where you will be recognised and rewarded for your contribution.§ § Your professional development is as valuable to us as it is to you and it will be a priority. Cardno provides visible career paths in technical eminence, client & key account management, project management and people leadership. We offer meaningful opportunities to make an impact and leave a legacy for local communities, globally.§ § By joining Cardno, you can bring your true self to work every day. We are committed to inclusion and celebrating our diverse workforce, their individual talents and the innovation they bring to work. We welcome and encourage applications from people of all backgrounds and abilities, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, LGBTQ+, women, mature age workers and people with different abilities.§ § §About Cardno§We are a global provider of integrated professional services which enrich the physical and social environment for the communities in which we live and work. Our team of multidisciplinary specialists has more than 70 years’ experience in designing, developing and delivering sustainable projects and community advancement programs.§ § www.cardno.com/careers§ §§§§

jobText: TXT/50573228.txt	§Postdoctoral Bioinformatician§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Postdoctoral Bioinformatician§§Advertiser: §Baker Heart and Diabetes Institute§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§15 Sept 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Salary§§$80,000 - $109,999§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Science & Technology§, §Biotechnology & Genetics§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §Postdoctoral Bioinformatician §    §    §      §        §Opportunity to be a part of a Melbourne-based research centre §        §Full-Time, 3 year contract, with potential for renewal §        §Salary is subject to skills and experience. The salary ranges between $83,404.29 to $101,186.80 plus 9.5% Superannuation per annum. Bronze member of the Science in Australia Gender Equity (SAGE) Program §      §      §        §About the Baker Institute§Baker Heart and Diabetes Institute is an independent, internationally-renowned medical research facility, with a history spanning more than 90 years. The Institute's work extends from the laboratory to wide-scale community studies with a focus on diagnosis, prevention and treatment of diabetes and cardiovascular disease.§        §The Baker Institute is the nation’s first multi-disciplinary organisation tackling the deadly trio of obesity, diabetes and cardiovascular disease through research, education and patient care.§        §About the Role§We are looking for a Postdoctoral Bioinformatician.§ The successful candidate will be based at the Baker Institute in the Systems Genomics and Metabolomics Labs and supervised by A/Prof Michael Inouye (www.inouyelab.org) and Prof Peter Meikle (https://www.baker.edu.au/research/laboratories/metabolomics). The successful candidate's main roles will be (i) to provide expert biostatistical and bioinformatic analysis to perform risk prediction using a variety of data types, including polygenic risk scores and metabolomic data. (ii) develop new risk prediction methodologies that may transform how we screen for and prevent cardiovascular disease. (iii) oversee project management for sample processing and data management.§        §Duties§In this role you will be expected to:§        §          §Perform high quality research in biostatistics, bioinformatics, genomics and computational biology§          §Develop new or modifying existing risk prediction methodologies to suit new data types (e.g. genomic or metabolomic).§          §Manage data and wrangling, quality control and normalization§          §Manage projects, including ensuring that samples are processed and data returned to a high fidelity and in a timely manner§          §Contribute to preparing manuscripts for publication, technical reports and other research-related documents.§          §Participate in the planning and development of general goals for the research project.§          §Organise data for supporting new funding applications.§          §Perform critical literature reviews.§        §        §Skills and Experience§The essential skills to succeed in this role are:§        §          §A PhD in a quantitative discipline (such as bioinformatics, biostatistics, computational biology, computer science, or epidemiology) and/or science discipline (such as biochemistry, molecular biology or genetics/genomics) with substantial quantitative component.§          §Research experience in disease risk prediction, statistical genetics, or a high competency in the statistical or computational analysis of large datasets.§          §A high level of interpersonal skills, which enable the appointee to liaise effectively with a wide range of people at a variety of levels internal and external to the Institute.§          §Demonstrated ability to use Unix-based systems, high performance or cloud computing, modern scripting/programming languages including R and python.§          §Demonstrated ability to produce high quality results and to meet deadlines without compromising close attention to detail and accuracy.§          §Proven capacity to work as a member of a team as well as autonomously without close supervision.§          §Demonstrated ability to lead and contribute to high impact research publications.§        §        §Benefits§Remuneration will be commensurate with the successful candidate's qualifications and experience, plus superannuation and generous salary packaging options. Other benefits include flexible working hours and generous primary caregiver leave. Numerous fellowships, grants and workshops to support parents, women and ethnic minorities in science are available as an ongoing commitment of the Institute to promote gender equity and diversity.§        §Read more about our gender equality and diversity initiatives: https://baker.edu.au/who-we-are/mission-values/gender-equity.§        §How to Apply§Applications should include a current resume with details of 3 professional referees quoting §reference (MIPM03)§.  To be eligible to apply for this position you must have an appropriate Australian or New Zealand work visa.  For a position description or further information, please visit our website at: https://www.baker.edu.au/career. §        §Applications Close:§ Thursday, 15 October 2020§        §The Baker Institute is an Equal Opportunity Employer and we welcome interest from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders for roles within the Institute. We value diversity, inclusivity, gender equity and we promote family friendly practices. We are a proud recipient of an inaugural Athena SWAN Bronze Award from Science in Australia Gender Equity (SAGE). §        §Contact details§A/Prof Mike Inouye§Munz Chair of Cardiovascular Prediction and Prevention§Director, Cambridge Baker Systems Genomics Initiative§michael.inouye@baker.edu.au§www.inouyelab.org§        §Prof Peter Meikle§Domain Head, Systems Biology§Laboratory Head, Metabolomics§Baker Heart and Diabetes Institute§peter.meikle@baker.edu.au§https://www.baker.edu.au/research/laboratories/metabolomics§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§About the Baker Institute§Baker Heart and Diabetes Institute is an independent, internationally-renowned medical research facility, with a history spanning more than 90 years. The Institute's work extends from the laboratory to wide-scale community studies with a focus on diagnosis, prevention and treatment of diabetes and cardiovascular disease.§ §The Baker Institute is the nation’s first multi-disciplinary organisation tackling the deadly trio of obesity, diabetes and cardiovascular disease through research, education and patient care.§ §About the Role§We are looking for a Postdoctoral Bioinformatician.§ The successful candidate will be based at the Baker Institute in the Systems Genomics and Metabolomics Labs and supervised by A/Prof Michael Inouye (www.inouyelab.org) and Prof Peter Meikle (https://www.baker.edu.au/research/laboratories/metabolomics). The successful candidate's main roles will be (i) to provide expert biostatistical and bioinformatic analysis to perform risk prediction using a variety of data types, including polygenic risk scores and metabolomic data. (ii) develop new risk prediction methodologies that may transform how we screen for and prevent cardiovascular disease. (iii) oversee project management for sample processing and data management.§ §Duties§In this role you will be expected to:§ § §Perform high quality research in biostatistics, bioinformatics, genomics and computational biology§ §Develop new or modifying existing risk prediction methodologies to suit new data types (e.g. genomic or metabolomic).§ §Manage data and wrangling, quality control and normalization§ §Manage projects, including ensuring that samples are processed and data returned to a high fidelity and in a timely manner§ §Contribute to preparing manuscripts for publication, technical reports and other research-related documents.§ §Participate in the planning and development of general goals for the research project.§ §Organise data for supporting new funding applications.§ §Perform critical literature reviews.§ §Skills and Experience§The essential skills to succeed in this role are:§ § §A PhD in a quantitative discipline (such as bioinformatics, biostatistics, computational biology, computer science, or epidemiology) and/or science discipline (such as biochemistry, molecular biology or genetics/genomics) with substantial quantitative component.§ §Research experience in disease risk prediction, statistical genetics, or a high competency in the statistical or computational analysis of large datasets.§ §A high level of interpersonal skills, which enable the appointee to liaise effectively with a wide range of people at a variety of levels internal and external to the Institute.§ §Demonstrated ability to use Unix-based systems, high performance or cloud computing, modern scripting/programming languages including R and python.§ §Demonstrated ability to produce high quality results and to meet deadlines without compromising close attention to detail and accuracy.§ §Proven capacity to work as a member of a team as well as autonomously without close supervision.§ §Demonstrated ability to lead and contribute to high impact research publications.§ §Benefits§Remuneration will be commensurate with the successful candidate's qualifications and experience, plus superannuation and generous salary packaging options. Other benefits include flexible working hours and generous primary caregiver leave. Numerous fellowships, grants and workshops to support parents, women and ethnic minorities in science are available as an ongoing commitment of the Institute to promote gender equity and diversity.§ §Read more about our gender equality and diversity initiatives: https://baker.edu.au/who-we-are/mission-values/gender-equity.§ §How to Apply§Applications should include a current resume with details of 3 professional referees quoting §reference (MIPM03)§.  To be eligible to apply for this position you must have an appropriate Australian or New Zealand work visa.  For a position description or further information, please visit our website at: https://www.baker.edu.au/career. § §Applications Close:§ Thursday, 15 October 2020§ §The Baker Institute is an Equal Opportunity Employer and we welcome interest from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders for roles within the Institute. We value diversity, inclusivity, gender equity and we promote family friendly practices. We are a proud recipient of an inaugural Athena SWAN Bronze Award from Science in Australia Gender Equity (SAGE). § §Contact details§A/Prof Mike Inouye§Munz Chair of Cardiovascular Prediction and Prevention§Director, Cambridge Baker Systems Genomics Initiative§michael.inouye@baker.edu.au§www.inouyelab.org§ §Prof Peter Meikle§Domain Head, Systems Biology§Laboratory Head, Metabolomics§Baker Heart and Diabetes Institute§peter.meikle@baker.edu.au§https://www.baker.edu.au/research/laboratories/metabolomics§§§§
