jobTitle: Technical Support Officer - CTBT Network Job in Melbourne - SEEK
advertiser: Australian Radiation Protection and Nuclear Safety Agency
jobText: TXT/50646348.txt	§Technical Support Officer - CTBT Network§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Technical Support Officer - CTBT Network§§Advertiser: §Australian Radiation Protection and Nuclear Safety Agency§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Salary§§$88,895 - $93,334 per annum package + 15.4% super§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Science & Technology§, §Laboratory & Technical Services§§§§§§Primary purpose of the role§In this role, you will work under limited direction and perform a range of moderately complex tasks associated with operating and maintaining Australia’s radionuclide air monitoring and noble gas stations that form part of the Comprehensive Nuclear-Test-Ban Treaty (CTBT) International Monitoring System (IMS). You will co-ordinate station operation activities including managing a roster of operators for the Melbourne station, scheduling special measurements at all Australian stations as well as co-ordinating all maintenance activities. In this role you will be responsible for preparing reports as well as establishing and maintaining a high degree of documentation management and record keeping.§Key accountabilities§ § §Under limited direction and using established principles, practices and procedures, undertake a range of moderately complex tasks associated with the overseeing routine operation and maintenance of Australia’s CTBT air monitoring and noble gas stations;§ §Assist with budget submissions and proposals;§ §Assist in the maintenance and upgrading of station equipment (including software), relating to the operation of CTBT air monitoring stations;§ §Undertake field work to perform both scheduled and unscheduled maintenance tasks;§ §Liaise with operational and technical staff from organisations contracted to assist with the running of the CTBT air monitoring stations;§ §Maintain accurate station records of work performed and prepare associated administrative and technical reports.§ §Develop and administer Training Programs for CTBT network partners.§ §Assist with operations and maintenance of UV and ARMS networks where required.§ §Job specific capabilities§To be considered for this position, you will have experience in operating and maintaining large complex data acquisition systems. You will possess both a strong technical competency as well as an astute attention to detail to ensure the network meets its strict performance objectives.§You will also have experience working as part of a team, including with representatives from other organisations, both national and international, in order to achieve a common goal.§You will have experience maintaining a high standard of technical documentation including developing procedures and writing executive reports.§You must hold Australian citizenship or possess permanent residency status leading to citizenship and be prepared to travel internationally and interstate on occasions. This position is a designated security assessment position which will require you to successfully undertake and maintain a security clearance.§Benefits§ § §Flexible working options§ §Study assistance and salary packaging options§ §Employee Assistance Program§ §Located in the leafy northern suburbs 15 km from CBD§ §Modern amenities room with garden courtyard§ §Free parking§ §For further information, please contact David Hardman via phone §03 9433 2299§Application close: Monday 12 October 2020§To obtain a copy of our position description and how to apply for this job, please visit https://www.arpansa.gov.au/about-us/careers for further information.§Please submit your resume, ARPANSA application cover sheet and a statement addressing the key selection criteria in the position description to §recruitment@arpansa.gov.au§ before you will be considered.§ARPANSA values workplace diversity and is committed to providing a supportive, inclusive and respectful work environment. We welcome people with diverse skills, experiences, perspectives and backgrounds, and encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander People, people with disabilities, people that identify as LGBTIQ+, and people from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds.§ §Should you require special assistance through any stage of the selection process, please contact the Office of People Strategies and Wellbeing team.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50688060.txt	§Epidemiologist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Epidemiologist§§Advertiser: §Murdoch Childrens Research Institute§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Salary§§$92,190 pro rata+ super + salary packaging§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Science & Technology§, §Laboratory & Technical Services§§§§§§§Who Are We?§ §At MCRI we share a powerful vision; to re-imagine the future of child health. We are the home to many life-changing scientific discoveries. We believe that no question is too impossible to try and answer. We are renowned for our cutting edge focus on early interventions, improved diagnosis, prevention and development of potential cures. Our success is founded on a philosophy of collaboration through a multi-disciplinary approach to solving the toughest questions in child health.§MCRI is a proud member of the Australian Network on Disability. We are committed to creating a positive working environment which values all backgrounds and experiences. We strive to foster an inclusive culture that is underpinned by equal opportunity for all and a culture based on respect, consideration and dignity. Don’t take our word for it, check what our § employees are saying!§ §The Opportunity§ §We are looking for an Epidemiologist (Research Assistant) to join our team at Generation Victoria (Gen V)§ §GenV is a world-first initiative aiming to transform the whole of the State of Victoria into a single dynamic solutions platform, breaking down barriers in research to solve pressing questions and translating that into tangible actions that can improve the health, development and well-being of children and their parents.  It is one of the world’s largest birth cohorts, GenV will be open to all 170,000 babies born in Victoria over two full years: §https://genv.org.au/§ § A key part of your role   will be to work with the GenV Biostatistician and GenV Senior Epidemiologist to substantially contribute to and progress the epidemiological components of this landmark study.§ §As our new Epidemiologist you will be involved in the birth cohort protocol development, exposure and outcome measures.§ §This role will see you work with a variety of audiences such as the Gen V research team, MCRI teams and external stakeholders therefore it is essential you have excellent communication and engagement skills. § §Your ability to foster these relationships will play an instrumental role in the growth of GenV’s science. § §To be successful in this role you will have previous experience working on a cohort, excellent organisational and research skills and are passionate about the difference you can make.§ §You are ready to join a dynamic and innovative team and contribute to making a long term impact on children’s health.§ § § § § §Your responsibilities will include but are not limited to: § § §Undertake activities and contribute to methodologic thinking associated with GenV in epidemiology, including but not limited to protocol development, sampling design and validity and comprehensive exposure and outcomes measurement§ §Assist in and contribute to the preparation of documentation of the birth cohort including but not limited to sampling design, exposure and outcome measures, related measures for potential confounders and factors related to underlying mechanisms of exposure-outcome pathways.§ §Contribute towards and where applicable show leadership in areas of content expertise § §Contribute to relevant science programs within the Solutions Hub, including grant applications § §Provide guidance and contribute to GenV/Lifecourse student supervision§ §Participate and contribute to the translation of GenV work such as students projects, presentations and publications§ §Engage with epidemiologists and other scientists from diverse content areas around forthcoming opportunities in GenV§ § § § § §You Demonstrate:§ §Essential: § § §Tertiary qualification in BSc or BA /Honours/Masters or related discipline§ §Appropriate level of expertise gained from a combination of experience, training or professional accreditation§ §Outstanding research and personal abilities suited to a career in research, as evidence by the quality of qualifications, prior research, achievements and contributions§ §Experience in population based research, including (but not limited to) ethics and governance frameworks§ §Experience writing and submitting  publications§ §Well-developed skills in statistical analysis with appropriate supervision§ §Initiative when faced with new contexts, working with others to identify barriers and opportunities§ §Ability to work independently, while also working constructively with supervisors, and as a team member§ §Excellent time management and multitasking skills with attention to detail§ §Working with Children & National Police Clearance (if appointed) in compliance with the Victorian Governments Child Safety Standards.§ §Desirable: § § §An interest in young children and their families, preferably demonstrated through choice of thesis topics and/or post-graduation employment§ § § § § §On Offer:§ § §4 month part time 0.6 Maternity leave contract§ §Salary Range $92,190pa pro rata+ super + salary packaging§ §On-site facilities include: childcare, Employee Assistance Program,  mindfulness, gym, and bike storage… to highlight a few§ § § § § § § §Apply Now§ §Indeed Website Please Note ALL Applications must come via MCRI Careers only. Direct applications via email do not apply. §www.mcri.edu.au/careers§ § § §For a full list of responsibilities and the key selection criteria § §download the position description. § §Only applicants who address the key selection criteria will be considered. In one document please place your cover letter, key selection criteria, and resume. Applications will only be considered when submitted via the MCRI website.§ § § §For specific questions not answered in the PD please contact Dr Jessika Hu  § § § §jessika.hu@mcri.edu.au§ § § §Existing MCRI and VCGS staff (excluding Unpaid non-managers and non Graduate Research Students) are required to apply through the MCRI internal site only. Navigate to Nucleus--> Talent Management--> Careers §to submit the application.§ § § §Click §apply§ to proceed with your application.§ §Closing Date§: 16 October 2020§ §Position Reference§: 22693§ § § §MCRI is a proud member of the Australian Network on Disability. Should you require any specific support or adjustments please talk to us and we will be happy to accommodate.§ §Please note: Applications via recruitment agencies will not be accepted for this position§§§§

jobText: TXT/50654742.txt	§Program Support Officer, Exploring for the Future Program§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Program Support Officer, Exploring for the Future Program§§Advertiser: §Geoscience Australia§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§ACT§§Salary§§$72,860 - $80,897§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Science & Technology§, §Environmental, Earth & Geosciences§§§§§§Exploring for the Future is an Australian Government program, led by Geoscience Australia, dedicated to exploring Australia’s resource potential and boosting investment. Launched in 2016 with $100.5 million in funding, the program initially focused on northern Australia. In June 2020, the Australian Government announced an additional $125 million of funding, over four years, to expand the program across the whole of Australia.§The Project Officer will provide project management and administrative support to the Program Management Office and contribute to the delivery of program outcomes. You will be required to work within established priorities, project management practices and methodologies to deliver quality outcomes. You will be required to perform research and analysis to make decisions that involve complex or escalated issues related to Exploring for the Future Program and its associated projects.§Working under limited direction, in this role you will:§ § §assist with project management processes utilising corporate records management systems to ensure consistency and compliance in the development and management of: § §o program and project documentation§o identification and management of project risks and issues§o program and project status reporting§ § §prepare reporting material for the Program Manager and provide support to project activities to ensure work remains on schedule to achieve long term goals§ §actively support subject matter experts in the implementation of targeted stakeholder engagement and communication activities§ §provide secretariat support for the program and its governance bodies, working groups and meetings, including meeting organisation, membership management, minute taking, developing papers and associated correspondence§ §provide travel administration for the program, including booking and acquitting group travel and accommodation (domestic and international), and providing clear guidance on the travel and financial frameworks that guide it § §manage incoming and outgoing email from the program’s central mailbox§ §manage relationships and negotiate with stakeholders in relation to more complex program coordination matters.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50640474.txt	§REMONDIS Australia Graduate Program - Chemist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§REMONDIS Australia Graduate Program - Chemist§§Advertiser: §REMONDIS Australia Pty Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Sydney§§Salary§§Graduate salary§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Science & Technology§, §Chemistry & Physics§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §REMONDIS Australia Graduate Program - Chemist §      §        §§        §REMONDIS Australia§ is globally part of the REMONDIS Group of Companies. Our parent company originated in Germany and commenced operations in 1934 and is one of the world’s largest environmental management organisations. REMONDIS is one of the world's largest recycling, service and water companies. With over 30,000 employees and around 900 business locations on 4 continents, the group serves more than 30 million people and many thousands of companies.§        §We are one of Australia’s leading waste management companies with our head-office based in Sydney (Mascot) New South Wales with over 30 operational site and 1,000+ workers, offering comprehensive collection, treatment and disposal solutions and services for commercial and municipal customers.§        §REMONDIS Australia is dedicated to service excellence; working in partnership with customers to deliver innovative, safe, reliable solutions and services that support customers to improve operational performance and meet sustainability targets.§        §Leaders for the Future§        §When it comes to talent, it is important to think of tomorrow today. The Leaders for the Future Graduate Program is an approximately two-year program designed to identify tomorrow’s leaders through developing well rounded individuals and building your skills and business acumen.§        §Working as a Chemist, you will dive into a role working across multiple liquid/hazardous disposal facilities across NSW. With purpose-built rotations designed to enhance your knowledge of key waste processes, this program will allow you to make the difference you want to see in your environment.§        §You will spend five (5) to six (6) rotations gaining hands-on experience on projects alongside driven and talented professionals across different teams within the business. To be a leader at REMONDIS is to be well rounded and as a graduate you will get to understand the key drivers in a successful business.§        §You will be able to take responsibility from the beginning in these specially designed programs and the support of experienced mentors / leaders.§        §Commencement date§        §January 2021.§        §Are you eligible?§        §Requirements: §studies in any of the following disciplines: Science or Applied Science majoring in Chemistry§        §To participate in this program, you will need to have completed a minimum of a Bachelor’s Degree and graduated in 2019 or 2020 and have current working rights in Australia. You will need to demonstrate leadership and teamwork, a desire to continuously learn, an innovative mindset, be pragmatic and not afraid to be involved in all aspects of Waste Management and have excellent verbal and written communication skills.§        §The process§        §          §Complete the application form. Contact §graduates @ remondis.com. au§ with your expression of interest to be directed to the form;§          §Shortlisted candidates to complete psychometric testing;§          §Selected candidates to attend an assessment centre on 5th November 2020.§        §        §What will you get?§        §          §Competitive Salary§          §Opportunity to learn and develop in one of Australia’s leading waste management organisations§          §Ability to shadow a General Manager§          §A unique program offering exposure and experience across the business to be a well rounded Leader for the Future.§        §        §So apply today and join REMONDIS as we elevate and support you in your career as we all Work For The Future and realize that vision today!§        §Please contact §graduates @ remondis.com. au§ to be directed to receive an application form. (Please do not apply via the Seek link)§        §Applications close Tuesday 20th October 2020 at 5pm§        §As part of our usual recruitment process you will be required to provide a copy of a current licence, proof of entitlement to live and work in Australia, and undergo a full medical, with a drug and alcohol test.§        §REMONDIS is an Equal Opportunity Employer and we invite you to be part of an organisation that fosters a diverse workplace. jobText: TXT/50650691.txt	§Animal Care Technician§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Animal Care Technician§§Advertiser: §Ozgene§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Perth§, §CBD, Inner & Western Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Science & Technology§, §Biotechnology & Genetics§§§§§§§ tbody > tr > td, .job-template__wrapper table[cellpadding="1"] > thead > tr > th { padding: 1px; }§-->§.job-template__wrapper [bgcolor="#073265"] { background-color: #073265; }§.job-template__wrapper [bgcolor="#FFFFFF"] { background-color: #FFFFFF; }§.job-template__wrapper [border="0"] { border-width: 0px; border-style: solid; }§§  §    §      §        §          §            §              §                §                  § §                  §Animal Care Technician§                  § §                  §                    §"to advance humanity - inspire curiosity"§                    §Curious to learn? Keen for a new challenge? Want to use your knowledge to make a difference? Then we are looking for you!!!§                    § §                    §The Company§                    §For over 20 years, Ozgene has been one of the leading companies for biotechnology and medical research in the world. Our vision is to advance humanity by inspiring curiosity, striving for constant innovation with the aim to provide our clients with the best service.§                    § §                    §The Position§ §                    §Ozgene is seeking a full-time graduate animal technician with a Bachelor of Science or certificate IV in veterinary nursing. Candidates should work well with animals and display constant respect and care towards them. Teamwork as well as good written and oral communication skills are required for this role. As a member of our animal facility you will work closely with a variety of staff members to promote a high standard of work, supporting scientific procedures and ensuring the welfare of all animals.  §                    § §                    §Your duties will include§: §                    §                      §Basic mice husbandry  §                      §Ensuring mice have food, water and their bedding is clean §                    §                    §                      §Promoting mice health and wellbeing §                      §Carrying out tasks in accordance with animal welfare requirements  §                      §Maintenance of animal facility  §                      §Following quarantine guidelines  §                    §                    §This role does not require any previous experience of working in a scientific animal facility.§                    § §                    §Our Vision§ §                    §Our vision is to expand Ozgene by building our team members from the ground up. We want curious people, that are not afraid of a challenge and want to use their knowledge to advance humanity. We will provide you with support and coaching in regard to our Organisational Capability culture. Our philosophy focuses on using your skills to stabilise and improve our veterinary processes, providing you with the conditions to channel your curiosity into exceptional service to our clients. §                    § §                    §If you are keen to find out more about this position apply now or contact the Culture Coach at §careers@ozgene.com§. Information is also available on our careers webpage at www.ozgene.com.§                      §                    §                  §                §              §            §          §        §      §    §  §§§"to advance humanity - inspire curiosity"§  §Curious to learn? Keen for a new challenge? Want to use your knowledge to make a difference? Then we are looking for you!!!§  § §  §The Company§  §For over 20 years, Ozgene has been one of the leading companies for biotechnology and medical research in the world. Our vision is to advance humanity by inspiring curiosity, striving for constant innovation with the aim to provide our clients with the best service.§  § §  §The Position§ §  §Ozgene is seeking a full-time graduate animal technician with a Bachelor of Science or certificate IV in veterinary nursing. Candidates should work well with animals and display constant respect and care towards them. Teamwork as well as good written and oral communication skills are required for this role. As a member of our animal facility you will work closely with a variety of staff members to promote a high standard of work, supporting scientific procedures and ensuring the welfare of all animals.  §  § §  §Your duties will include§: § § §Basic mice husbandry  § §Ensuring mice have food, water and their bedding is clean § §Promoting mice health and wellbeing § §Carrying out tasks in accordance with animal welfare requirements  § §Maintenance of animal facility  § §Following quarantine guidelines  § §This role does not require any previous experience of working in a scientific animal facility.§  § §  §Our Vision§ §  §Our vision is to expand Ozgene by building our team members from the ground up. We want curious people, that are not afraid of a challenge and want to use their knowledge to advance humanity. We will provide you with support and coaching in regard to our Organisational Capability culture. Our philosophy focuses on using your skills to stabilise and improve our veterinary processes, providing you with the conditions to channel your curiosity into exceptional service to our clients. §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§Have you completed a qualification in science?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

jobText: TXT/50639825.txt	§Technical Support Officer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Technical Support Officer§§Advertiser: §Health Support Queensland§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§27 Sept 2020§§Location§§Gold Coast§§Salary§§$57,639 - $60,211 per annum plus super§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Science & Technology§, §Laboratory & Technical Services§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Technical Support Officer §      §        §Health Support Queensland – Why work for us?§        §At Health Support Queensland (HSQ), you will be part of an organisation who helps care for Queenslanders. We know it is important for people to work in an organisation that provides more than just a job. In joining HSQ, you will embark on a journey to help us realise our vision of being ‘Australia's best healthcare support partner'.§        §Once you join us, we will expect you to exemplify the HSQ fundamental principles of ICARE:§        §          §Integrity—being honest and ethical in everything we say and do.§          §Customers and patients first—putting customers and patients at the centre of everything we do.§          §Accountability—taking personal responsibility for our actions.§          §Respect—being considerate, recognising our differences and looking out for each other.§          §Engagement—actively investing in positive outcomes by partnering with others.§        §        §What is on offer:§        §          §Up to 12.75% employer superannuation contribution§          §Annual leave loading 17.5%§          §Salary packaging§          §Work/life balance, variety and flexibility§          §Employee Assistance Program§        §        §About the role:§        §          §Carry out general technical support activities which may include: Equipment receipt, packing, dispatch, pick-up and delivery (driving required); Management of parts, consumables, test equipment and technical manuals; Data entry and checking; Telephone answering and customer service; Cleaning of specialised workshop areas and equipment; and other miscellaneous workshop support activities as required.§          §Regular back-up coverage of: Reception, switchboard and general administration duties.§          §Assist biomedical technicians to provide repairs, planned maintenance, installation/de-installation and other services for a wide range of electronic and/or mechanical health technology equipment. This may include working under indirect supervision following training.§          §Communicate effectively with colleagues, management, clients and other stakeholders.§          §Comply with and utilise procedures, policies, regulations, and standards which impact upon the position including Code of Conduct for Queensland Public Service, contemporary human resource management requirements and practices, such as workplace health and safety, equal employment opportunity and anti-discrimination policy.§        §        §What we are looking for:§        §          §Ability to communicate and liaise effectively with staff, clients and external agencies.§          §Ability to gain and apply technical knowledge and skills necessary to assist biomedical technicians to service and support a range of electronic and/or mechanical health technology equipment.§          §Numeracy, literacy and computer skills to an adequate level to order and receive goods, process delivery documents, work orders and accurately enter information by keyboard into computer databases.§          §Ability to work as a team member to achieve goals and objectives.§          §Ability to actively participate in a working environment supporting quality human resource management practices including employment equity, anti-discrimination, occupational health and safety and ethical behaviour§          §A current Queensland Driver's License is required§        §        §How to apply:§        §Please provide the following information to the panel to assess your suitability:§        §          §Your current CV or resume, including the names and contact details of two referees. Referees should have a thorough knowledge of your capabilities, work performance and conduct within the previous two years, and it is preferable to include your current, immediate or past supervisor§          §A short statement (Max 2 pages) that gives details of your skills, experience and knowledge as required on the role description under the heading ‘what are we looking for?'§        §      §      §      §    §    §  §§§Health Support Queensland – Why work for us?§At Health Support Queensland (HSQ), you will be part of an organisation who helps care for Queenslanders. We know it is important for people to work in an organisation that provides more than just a job. In joining HSQ, you will embark on a journey to help us realise our vision of being ‘Australia's best healthcare support partner'.§Once you join us, we will expect you to exemplify the HSQ fundamental principles of ICARE:§§Integrity—being honest and ethical in everything we say and do.§Customers and patients first—putting customers and patients at the centre of everything we do.§Accountability—taking personal responsibility for our actions.§Respect—being considerate, recognising our differences and looking out for each other.§Engagement—actively investing in positive outcomes by partnering with others.§§What is on offer:§§Up to 12.75% employer superannuation contribution§Annual leave loading 17.5%§Salary packaging§Work/life balance, variety and flexibility§Employee Assistance Program§§About the role:§§Carry out general technical support activities which may include: Equipment receipt, packing, dispatch, pick-up and delivery (driving required); Management of parts, consumables, test equipment and technical manuals; Data entry and checking; Telephone answering and customer service; Cleaning of specialised workshop areas and equipment; and other miscellaneous workshop support activities as required.§Regular back-up coverage of: Reception, switchboard and general administration duties.§Assist biomedical technicians to provide repairs, planned maintenance, installation/de-installation and other services for a wide range of electronic and/or mechanical health technology equipment. This may include working under indirect supervision following training.§Communicate effectively with colleagues, management, clients and other stakeholders.§Comply with and utilise procedures, policies, regulations, and standards which impact upon the position including Code of Conduct for Queensland Public Service, contemporary human resource management requirements and practices, such as workplace health and safety, equal employment opportunity and anti-discrimination policy.§§What we are looking for:§§Ability to communicate and liaise effectively with staff, clients and external agencies.§Ability to gain and apply technical knowledge and skills necessary to assist biomedical technicians to service and support a range of electronic and/or mechanical health technology equipment.§Numeracy, literacy and computer skills to an adequate level to order and receive goods, process delivery documents, work orders and accurately enter information by keyboard into computer databases.§Ability to work as a team member to achieve goals and objectives.§Ability to actively participate in a working environment supporting quality human resource management practices including employment equity, anti-discrimination, occupational health and safety and ethical behaviour§A current Queensland Driver's License is required§§How to apply:§Please provide the following information to the panel to assess your suitability:§§Your current CV or resume, including the names and contact details of two referees. Referees should have a thorough knowledge of your capabilities, work performance and conduct within the previous two years, and it is preferable to include your current, immediate or past supervisor§A short statement (Max 2 pages) that gives details of your skills, experience and knowledge as required on the role description under the heading ‘what are we looking for?'§§§§

jobText: TXT/50698000.txt	§Product Technologist - Deli§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Product Technologist - Deli§§Advertiser: §Coles§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Melbourne§, §CBD & Inner Suburbs§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Science & Technology§, §Food Technology & Safety§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Product Technologist - Deli §      §Company description:§        §Good things start here§        §This could be the very first step towards an exciting new career with us – a fresh beginning. At the Coles Group, these are moments we live for.§        §Starting good things is what drives our purpose: to sustainably feed all Australians so they can lead healthier, happier lives. With a team of 120,000 people and an iconic portfolio of Australia’s most trusted brands, we’re perfectly positioned to turn a promising start into a whole lot more.§        §Our Merchandise team plays an integral role in identifying and delivering ranges across all Business Units including grocery, non-food, fresh produce, bakery, meat/deli/seafood and dairy/freezer/convenience to Coles Supermarkets.§As one of the largest teams in Coles they operate at a fast pace, always ensuring that customers have choice and quality products at the right price. It is a close knit team with talent assembled from all over the world; ensuring we remain at the cutting edge of merchandising methodologies.§Job description:§        §About the role§        §Reporting to the Technical Leader, you will drive quality, ensure compliance and support production innovation of Coles brand products within the Deli team.§        §What you'll be doing§        §As a Product Technologist within the Deli team, you will be working with high risk food products; ensuring quality and compliance standards are met - whilst driving product innovation. You will be the custodian of safety, quality, legal compliance, usability & reputation for Own Brand Products. §        §You'll also:§        §          §Create value by executing the brand strategy§          §Land new innovative products, reviewing past product performance and driving commercial outcomes§          §Deliver supplier accountability & performance in quality and safety§          §Engage & collaborate strategically with category teams and suppliers§        §        § §Good things you’ll need§        §Demonstrated experience working with high risk food products within a FMCG, manufacturing and retail environment.§        §You'll also need:§        §          §Bachelor Degree in Food Science, or a related field.§          §Significant, relevant experience in food or related subject matter expertise within a compliance vocation.§          §Small goods/high risk food product experience advantageous/preferred. §          §Technical management SME (Subject Matter Expertise).§          §Proven experience in supplier management, investigations, audit response and data analysis.§          §Experience working with both international and local suppliers to deliver product innovation and essential safety controls.§          §Strong planning, time management and influencing skills.§        §        § §Why Coles?§        §We’re committed to making this a great place to work, from day one. From flexible working arrangements to discounts across all our internal brands (including 5% off at Coles supermarkets!), there are plenty of reasons to love working here. Explore all this and more at our Coles Careers website.§        §For everyone who shares our passion§We encourage applications from people of all ages, nationalities, abilities and cultures – including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, the LGBTQI+ community and people living with disability. We’re happy to adjust our recruitment process to support accessibility needs – so reach out to us at inclusionrecruitment@coles.com.au.§        §We’d love to meet you§If you have the skills, experience and motivation to succeed in this role, please take the next step and submit your application.§      §      §      §    §  §§§Company description:§Good things start here§This could be the very first step towards an exciting new career with us – a fresh beginning. At the Coles Group, these are moments we live for.§Starting good things is what drives our purpose: to sustainably feed all Australians so they can lead healthier, happier lives. With a team of 120,000 people and an iconic portfolio of Australia’s most trusted brands, we’re perfectly positioned to turn a promising start into a whole lot more.§Our Merchandise team plays an integral role in identifying and delivering ranges across all Business Units including grocery, non-food, fresh produce, bakery, meat/deli/seafood and dairy/freezer/convenience to Coles Supermarkets.§As one of the largest teams in Coles they operate at a fast pace, always ensuring that customers have choice and quality products at the right price. It is a close knit team with talent assembled from all over the world; ensuring we remain at the cutting edge of merchandising methodologies.§Job description:§About the role§    §Reporting to the Technical Leader, you will drive quality, ensure compliance and support production innovation of Coles brand products within the Deli team.§ §What you'll be doing§ §As a Product Technologist within the Deli team, you will be working with high risk food products; ensuring quality and compliance standards are met - whilst driving product innovation. You will be the custodian of safety, quality, legal compliance, usability & reputation for Own Brand Products. § §You'll also:§ § §Create value by executing the brand strategy§ §Land new innovative products, reviewing past product performance and driving commercial outcomes§ §Deliver supplier accountability & performance in quality and safety§ §Engage & collaborate strategically with category teams and suppliers§ § § §Good things you’ll need§     §Demonstrated experience working with high risk food products within a FMCG, manufacturing and retail environment.§ §You'll also need:§ § §Bachelor Degree in Food Science, or a related field.§ §Significant, relevant experience in food or related subject matter expertise within a compliance vocation.§ §Small goods/high risk food product experience advantageous/preferred. § §Technical management SME (Subject Matter Expertise).§ §Proven experience in supplier management, investigations, audit response and data analysis.§ §Experience working with both international and local suppliers to deliver product innovation and essential safety controls.§ §Strong planning, time management and influencing skills.§ § § §Why Coles?§    §We’re committed to making this a great place to work, from day one. From flexible working arrangements to discounts across all our internal brands (including 5% off at Coles supermarkets!), there are plenty of reasons to love working here. Explore all this and more at our Coles Careers website.§ §For everyone who shares our passion§We encourage applications from people of all ages, nationalities, abilities and cultures – including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, the LGBTQI+ community and people living with disability. We’re happy to adjust our recruitment process to support accessibility needs – so reach out to us at inclusionrecruitment@coles.com.au.§ §We’d love to meet you§If you have the skills, experience and motivation to succeed in this role, please take the next step and submit your application.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

An innovator in the health industry, Amazonia is a §plant-based§ business that boasts brands such as §Frozen Super Foods Acai, Raw, RawFIT and Tender Jack§ under its umbrella of wellness.§ §We offer our people an energetic, achievement-focused workplace with plenty of action and a fantastic values-based culture. We're §passionate and innovative§, and we are always on the lookout for ways to do things better…and looking to expand our team.§ §Our values (Innovation, Education, Sustainability, Authenticity, Respect, Community) shape our culture and guide the way Amazonia is run. If your values align with this ethos and you’re excited to get behind §a purposeful brand§ we would love to hear from you.§ § § §About the job§ §We are looking for a§ New Product Development superstar,§ a technical lead skilled in Food Technology, Research & Development & Design-Led Innovation, an individual that is §incredibly innovative and commercially savvy. § §Contributing and being a part of our success will find you:§ § §Lead key NPD projects§ to support business goals using design-led innovation processes§ §Develop concepts, products and solutions with the consumer at the heart of the design§ §Understand customer & consumer expectations and problems§ and seek to solve them§ §In collaboration with brand marketing & sales teams §develop new products & establish project plans§ §Globally, source the best raw material suppliers, formulators & co-manufacturers to create new products§ §Work closely with our supply chain manager & designers to §incorporate packaging innovation§ into new product launches§ §Conduct competitor analysis and assess market competition by comparing product to competitors' products.§ §Identify new packaging formats, ingredients, technologies and game changing IP for our existing brands to commercialise.§ §Where appropriate, §create new category, first mover brands§ §Facilitate efficient and accurate documentation and sampling.§ §Ensure claims are substantiated§, labels are compliant, and safety and consistency of finished products is achieved.§ § § §About you§ §You are commercially astute, innovative and business savvy. You must thrive on striving for excellence in everything you do. §You are creative, empathetic and tenacious and can influence at all levels. § §This role involves a lot of cross-functional interaction and your relationship building and communication skills will be first class. It will be imperative to §build collaborative internal relationships§.§ § §Experience in developing innovative products§ across a range of industries; ideally across §food & nutraceuticals§ categories§ §A Bachelor or Master’s degree in Applied Science, Organic Chemistry, Food Science, Food Technology or similar.§ §An inquiring mind,§ intense curiosity,§ and strong desire to innovate in the consumer goods space§ §Proven project management experience§ with good supervisory and teamwork skills in a fast faced and challenging environment§ §Knowledge of TGA, cGMP§ standards and requirements is preferred§ §At least 10 year(s) of working experience in the field of new product development, project management, regulatory affairs, or quality assurance.§ §Systematic, driven, enthusiastic and resourceful and highly goal orientated person§ §Good interpersonal, analytical and organisational skills§ §Ability to think out of the box and take initiative in solving problems§ §Strong industry knowledge, specifically in health, wellness and beauty categories§ §Capability to make holistic decisions related to technical and innovative solutions.§ § § §You are purpose driven and whilst the bottom line is important so is mutual respect, doing good and being a considerate human. We hope you share our §passion for wellness and creating a sustainable future for our planet§ too.§ § § §Interested to know more about us please click here www.amazonia.com§ §Our values - https://youtu.be/dfkfVfEi5dM§ §We want to hear from you, Apply Now!§ § § §PLEASE NOTE: §Purple Playground HR, our outsourced HR team, is your first point of contact for any enquiries or submission of applications for this position with Amazonia. Any enquiries made directly to Amazonia will not be accepted. For the entirety of the recruitment process, you will be liaising with Purple Playground as they are in partnership with us here at Amazonia.§ §Below are the contact details of Purple Playground if you wish to contact them:§ §Email§: §recruitment@purpleplayground.com.au§ §Thank you for your interest and wishing you the best of luck!§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in Australia?§§§

jobText: TXT/50721899.txt	§Data Scientist§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Data Scientist§§Advertiser: §TABCORP§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§12 Oct 2020§§Location§§Sydney§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Science & Technology§, §Mathematics, Statistics & Information Sciences§§§§§§One day you are helping us boldly innovate, another you’re leading an initiative, or pitching in where needed. At Tabcorp, each day brings a different challenge and another opportunity – and this is what we live for. §As part of the Data Science team you’ll bring your skilled, organised, problem-solving self to positively impact your career, your team, our customers and community. We move at pace, and we’re looking for people who want to learn and grow with us. Together, we say yes to possibilities. We create amazing experiences. And, so can you.§What you’ll do§The team is responsible for building and maintaining data science models, assets and capabilities to inform decision making, drive our customer personalisation processes and manage risk.§As a Data Scientist, you will engage with business stakeholders, understand the underlying business processes that generate data, determine what datasets and machine learning tools and algorithms can be used to best solve business problems and deploy in operational systems. This includes:§§Working with stakeholders across the wagering business to prioritise the highest value use cases§Design solutions and programs of work to build models and assets that deliver business insight and optimise outcomes§Manage and deliver on the models and assets using agile ways of working§Collaborate with technical and business colleagues to embed these models and assets into production processes§Be able to explain highly technical concepts to non-technical business stakeholders§§What you’ll bring§§A proven track record of delivering data science solutions into production that have delivered significant business/financial value§Strong collaboration, communication & stakeholder management skills§Start-up mentality (fast-paced, flexible and team-oriented)§Demonstrated experience as a Data Scientist applying machine learning techniques, advanced analytics and statistical modelling§Deep understanding & experience of machine learning concepts techniques from data/feature engineering, EDA, model building, testing and validation and continuous integration and deployment best practices§Advanced Degree in computer science, mathematics, statistics or quantitative science experience§§All our people have the option to take advantage of flexible working, leadership and career development, plus community programs and volunteer days.§§About Tabcorp§We’re Australia’s largest gambling entertainment company. Together, we build on our 100+ year heritage by delivering Excitement with Integrity, every day. Each one of us is here to put our customers at the heart of everything we do by creating moments that engage, surprise and thrill.§Our 5,000-plus strong team is as diverse as Australia itself. Our people drive homegrown world-class brands; Tatts, TAB, NSW Lotteries, Golden Casket, SA Lotteries, Keno, Sky Racing, Sky Sports Radio and MAX. As an ASX listed company we’re proud to shape our industry for the better. Because together, anything’s possible.§Tabcorp is committed to creating an inclusive workplace where all our people feel valued for their unique qualities and have a sense of belonging.
